loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes de 54 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo y su hijo. Mercedes se dedica a la venta de tortillas, lo cual ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos. Junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar y llevan el sustento diario. Hace algunos meses comenzaron la construcción de su vivienda la cual no han logrado terminar por falta de recursos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, grava, arena, ladrillos y lámina galvanizada para terminar su vivienda y hacer uso de ella.
texts.en: Mercedes is 54 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and son.  Mercedes makes a living selling tortillas, and this is her main source of income.  With her husband, Mercedes is able to support the household.  A few months ago the couple started building their home but it is not finished, as they do not have enough money.  Mercedes is applying for this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in cement, gravel, sand, bricks, and laminate sheets, in order to finish and live in her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, sand, bricks, and laminate sheets, in order to finish her home.

loans.name: William Amilcar

texts.es: William de 32 años de edad es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia. Habita junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 12 años de edad. Toda su vida ha trabajado en la compra y venta de ganado y así es como lleva el sustento diario a su casa. Con el fin de dar mayor seguridad habitacional a su familia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pared para hacer una división de un dormitorio en su vivienda. Con el crédito comprará ladrillo, cemento, grava, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar con dicha ayuda y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Thirty-two year-old William is a very hardworking man who is devoted to his family. He lives with his life partner and his twelve year-old son. 

All his life has worked buying and selling cattle, and this is how he supports his family. 

In order to provide safer housing his family, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to build a partition wall for a bedroom in his home. He will use the loan to buy bricks, cement, gravel, sand, and iron. 

He hopes to receive this aid, and thus be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, gravel, sand, and iron to build a partition wall for a bedroom.

loans.name: Sombang Lestari Group

texts.en:
Living in rural area, far from the big city, Ni Kadek spends her daily life as a farmer and pig breeder. Living with her husband and two children, Ni Kadek works hard to fulfill her family's needs. With the Sombang Lestari group, she is receiving a new loan.

Ni Kadek will use her loan to purchase three superior piglets for fattening. She will buy superior feed with her own money. She hopes she can earn 200,000 IDR each pig per month. Now the price for one superior piglet is 400,000 IDR.

Ni Kadek and her family feel the benefit from the pig program and she’s very thankful for that. She hopes she can support her children's  education until university and make sure they can have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets to raise

loans.name: Capacachi -31 Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento CAPACACHI -31,  está compuesto por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un varón,  todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Nancy, tiene 37 años y es casada con cuatro hijos que tienen las edades de 4, 7, 15 y 20  años,  ella se dedica a la venta de  verduras como Choclo en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la populosa feria de la Cancha,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de Choclo al por mayor como y así incrementar su capital de trabajo, la señora Nancy Va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es  poder abastecerse  de este producto ya que esta época de fin de año tiene mucha venta y es donde tiene que aprovechar para así tener más ingresos económicos, se siente agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos casos sacan adelante a sus familias.
texts.en: The "Capacachi-31" communal bank is made up of nine members - eight women and one man.  All of the members have different businesses; the bank's president is 37-year-old Nancy.  Nancy is married and has four children, aged 20, 15, 7, and 4 years old respectively.  Nancy makes a living selling vegetables, such as corn-on-the-cob, at her stall in the busy Cancha market.  This is Nancy's first loan with the communal bank and she will use it to buy corn-on-the-cob in bulk and thus increase her working capital.  The end of year holidays always brings more sales and so Nancy must take advantage of this in order to earn a higher income.  Nancy is grateful for this opportunity being provided to her and her colleagues as, in many cases, it helps the group's members to prosper with their families.

loans.use: to buy corn-on-the-cob in bulk.

loans.name: Wanawangurumo Group

texts.en:
Magreth, who is in her early twenties, is married, with a boy who is in school. 

For three years now, Magreth has been running a tailoring business. She works from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit. 

This will be her ninth loan request to Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all paid back in full, Magreth purchased more business materials, fabrics, sarongs, and threads for tailoring. 

Magreth used her business profit to cover school fees and household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more fabrics to resell. Magreth dreams of  making her business attractive. 

Magreth will share this loan with her loan group "Wanawangurumo," which totals seven members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics to resell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from manicure/pedicure service. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional pork liver, pork intestine, cooking oil, salt, etc. to sell for her food vending business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pork liver, pork intestine, cooking oil, salt, etc. to prepare and sell

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Nely works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing.  Nely is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Nely has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Sulficia

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Sulficia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Sulficia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Sulficia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Higinio

texts.en:
This is Higinio, 44, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Vicky, his business partner, and they have children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.
  
Higinio operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP [Philippines pesos] in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Higinio dreams that his business will continue to grow and hopes that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 48, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Manuel, an employee, and they have children. Susan, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.
 
Susan operates the buy and sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sells them with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Susan is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items like pants, dresses, shorts, skirts, shirts and blouses to expand her product inventory.

Susan hopes that her business grows bigger and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for RTW products and merchandise items like pants, dresses, shorts, skirts, shirts and blouses to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Leny works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling other types of food. Leny is borrowing PHP 9,500 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Leny has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Juan Mauricio

texts.es:
Juan de 32 años de edad, su nivel de educación es de sexto grado, actualmente está casado; su esposa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su casa de habitación todos los días de la semana. El matrimonio ha procreado dos hijos de las edades siguientes: Uno de 4 años y otro de 10 meses, que viven con él, por sus edades los hijos no estudian y ni trabajan, en la casa de habitación solo viven ellos cuatro. 

Juan se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte en su pick-up, el tiempo que tiene de ejercer  esta actividad es de 3 años,  se decidió a dedicar a esta actividad debido a la falta de empleo; ya que su esposa e hijos necesitaban de lo necesario para tener una mejor condición de vida. El cliente no se dedica a ejercer otra actividad, es su primer trabajo que tiene, como es servicio de transporte este hacer viajes a diferentes partes del departamento y se moviliza en su vehículo, no tiene horario de trabajo; ya que a cualquier hora que lo buscan realiza el viaje.

 El crédito será invertido, en la construcción de un plafón en su casa de habitación, ya que posteriormente construirá una habitación mas, debido a que la familia va creciendo y no cuanta en el espacio suficiente.
Con el financiamiento comprara: 5 quítales de hierros, 30 bolsas de cemento, una camionada de arena, una camionada de concreto y pago de mano de obra. 

El sueño principal para su negocio es comprar un nuevo vehículo, para prestar un mejor servicio del que está prestando actualmente,  el sueño para la familia es que puedan tener una vida digna y de mejores prestaciones.
texts.en:
32-year old Juan has grade six education and is married. His wife makes and sells tortillas in the house seven days a week. They have two children, one aged 4 years and the other 10 months. Neither of the children go to school or work because of their age. Only Juan, his wife, and their two children live in the house.

Juan has provided transportation using his pick-up truck for three years. He started this business as there were no other jobs and he needed money to provide his wife and children with a better standard of living. He has no other job; this is his only work. He travels to different parts of the department in his vehicle but with no fixed schedule as it depends on when people want to use his services.

The loan money will be used to build another part to his house as his family is growing and there isn't enough room. He will buy 5 quintals [one quintal equal about 100lb] of iron, 30 bags of cement, a truck-load of concrete, and hire workers.

Juan's dream is to buy a new vehicle for his business so he can provide better service than he does at the moment. His dream for his family is a better life and improved benefits.

loans.use: buy 5 quintall of iron, 30 bags of cement, a truck-load of concrete, and hire workers to build an addition to his house

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es: Sandra, con 33 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos. Durante varios meses estuvo desempleada y, debido a eso, su familia estaba pasando por una crisis económica pues el salario que su esposo gana no alcanzaba para solventar todas las necesidades del hogar; por esta razón decidió montar su propio negocio, un pequeño almacén de remates, en el que ofrece ropa, utensilios de cocina, artículos para el hogar, entre otros, actividad que inició hace pocos días y que le genera los recursos suficientes para comenzar a estabilizar la economía familiar. Su perseverancia, empuje y su constante lucha le han permitido salir adelante y para ello solicita el apoyo del crédito, con el que desea comprar mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, ropa interior, utensilios de cocina, entre otros) de esta manera podrá aumentar la variedad de los productos que ofrece y podrá satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, dándole la posibilidad de incrementar sus ventas y las ganancias que recibe. De esta manera, Sandra manifiesta su interés en sacar adelante su actividad y convertirla en una rentable fuente de ingresos que le ayude a mejorar las condiciones de vida y ofrecer a sus dos hijos una buena educación y un mejor bienestar, además en un futuro sueña con abrir otros almacenes para brindar oportunidades de empleo a otras personas necesitadas.
texts.en: Sandra is 33 years old, married, and a mother to two children.  She was unemployed for a number of months and, because of this, her family had financial problems, with Sandra's husband's salary not being enough to cover household costs.  Sandra therefore decided to start her own business: a bargain store, where she sells clothes, kitchen utensils, items for the home, and more.  She started this business a few days ago and it has provided her with a sufficient income to be able to help to stabilise the family's finances.  Sandra's perseverance, drive, and her constant efforts have helped Sandra to get ahead.  She is now applying for a loan in order to buy merchandise (blouses, jeans, underwear, kitchen utensils, and more) in bulk.  With these products she will be able to increase the variety of products she offers and can satisfy her customers' needs.  She will be able to increase her sales and her profits.  With these profits, Sandra tells us that she would like to improve her business and make it a profitable source of income which helps her to improve her living conditions and give her children a good upbringing and better well-being.  Moreover, Sandra dream of opening other stores in the future, in order to provide jobs to people who need it.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (blouses, jeans, underwear, kitchen utensils, and more) in bulk.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 58 years old and married with six children.

Imelda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Imelda has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Imelda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Melinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a welding shop. Melinda is borrowing 7,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 59 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Virginia is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As the married mother of four children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from pig fattening and tricycle transportation. Alma is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of  saving money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke singing rentals (karaoke)  business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional chair and more case of beer to sell.

Edna has been in this business for nine years. She earns more income from a general store and food-vending.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional chair and more case of beer to sell.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny works hard to support her family. Leny is married and has a hollow block making business in the Philippines.

Leny requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like sand, cement, etc. for her business.

Leny has been in this business for four years now. In the future, Leny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like sand, cement, etc. for her business

loans.name: Badi

texts.en:
Badi is 41 years old and the mother of seven children.

Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market that is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. However due to lack of money, he finds it difficult. 

For that, his wife Badi is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials.  This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

Badi is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials

loans.name: Om-Basel Group

texts.en:
Om-Basel is a group which consists of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They are responsible women who work hard to offer a good life to their families.

Joma`a is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in Aden, Yemen. She works as an employee in the university and gets a low salary. She is not as interested in getting money as she is in focusing on offering great opportunities to students. She thinks this career serves society. 

She lives with her family in a bad situation, and she intends to buy construction supplies to renew her small house. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 60,000 YER [Yemen rials] rom AMB. She hopes to improve her living standards with this loan.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renew her small house.

loans.name: Faiq

texts.en:
Faiq is 57 years old. He is married and the father of four children. His eldest daughter is getting married. In order to buy her a dowry for the wedding, he applied to VFAC for a loan. Credit will help him not sell cattle, and he will be able to provide a dowry for his daughter according to traditions. 

Faiq has been engaged in agriculture for more than 32 years. He sells turkey, eggs, animals for meat purposes and dairy products. His wife helps him keep the farming household. Faiq works as an operator in road management and most of the time he is at work. 

In the picture you see Faiq with his wife and one of their children.

loans.use: To support his daughter with dowry.

loans.name: Asala Group

texts.en:
The members of the "Asala" group are four women. They all live in traditional extended families in Hodeidah, Yemen. They know each other through family, friendship, and neighborhood ties. They requested a loan of 150,000 Yemeni Rial (YER). 

Saleha is a leader of the group and is 56 years old, a married woman, and has children. She has been selling clothes, incense, and perfumes for many years. She started her business with a small amount of money provided by her husband. She says that she does well with the business. She applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy clothes, incense, and perfumes for her business. She hopes the business will continue growing like it's done to date, and hopes to open a clothing store. She is grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy clothes, incense, and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Efrin

texts.es: Efrin tiene 39 años, está casado con Reina de 38 años y tiene 2 hijos que viven en una casa construida a base de material noble en calidad de alquiler. Su principal actividad es la agricultura que desempeña hace mas de 20 años, no obstante gracias a los ahorros que fue obteniendo cumplió en beneficio de su esposa uno de sus principales objetivos que es el poseer una tienda de productos comestibles. Llevo 5 años con este negocio siendo su esposa la principal encargada quien también es la responsable del cuidado de sus hijos. Con un local en habilitado en calidad de alquiler y gracias a la buena atención que brindan han logrado captar buena clientela el cual le genera buenos ingresos. Le agrada su negocio puesto que le permite a su pareja estar al pendiente de sus niños quienes necesitan toda la atención del caso. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con  1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería como sacos de arroz , azúcar, conservas enlatadas, cereales y paquetes de gaseosa que  tiene una buena demanda en su negocio.
texts.en: Efrin is 39 years old. He is married to Reina, 38, and he has 2 children. They live in a rented house made out of quality construction materials. His main activity is farming, which he has done for more than 20 years. Nevertheless, thanks to the savings he obtained, he achieved one of his main goals for the benefit of his wife. This is to have a grocery store. He has had this business for 5 years. His wife is the main person in charge, and she is also responsible for taking care of their children. They have an equipped, rented store, and thanks to the good service they provide they have succeeded in winning a good clientele that generates good income for them. They like their business since it allows his wife to look after their children, who need a lot of attention. This is his third loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support he receives to move forward. He also promises to make his repayments in a punctual manner. This time he would like to have 1,000 nuevos soles in order to buy merchandise such as bags of rice, sugar, canned goods, cereal, and packages of soft drinks that are in high demand in his business.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice and canned goods, among others.

loans.name: Laylo

texts.en:
Laylo is 44 years old. She is a purposeful woman. She lives with her family in a village where nature is wonderful and the local people are busy with growing vegetables and crops and also with animal husbandry. Laylo is one of the hardworking local people who have been busy with animal husbandry and growing crops for more than 10 years. She is a careful mother of 4 children. Her husband is a foreign worker in Russia. 

This autumn Laylo brought in her harvest and sold it in the local market but she could not get enough money for buying food items, coаl and a stove for the winter season. She is asking for a loan to buy food items, coil and stove. She awaits your support. She has a dream: “To be rich and successful”.

loans.use: To buy food items, coal and a stove for the winter season

loans.name: Renil

texts.en:
Renil wants to be a manager someday. He is 21 years old and lives in Oroquieta City with his family. 

He is studying BS Business Administration in a private school, Dr. Solomon U. Molina College. His father works in the government as an AFP. 

Renil joined GDMPC and requested a loan to pay school fees for the second semester. He is thankful to GDMPC for helping people like him have a better future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for the second semester

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is thankful for the financial assistance that she received. She was able to buy more supplies and merchandise products needed in her business. She has been in this business for five years now. Her income in business is assisting her everyday expenses. She continues to work to provide for her everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zenaida dreams of being more successful in business and hopes to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 63 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lucena has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. Lucena requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods like rope, native baskets, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lucena has been in this business for nine years. Lucena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods like rope, native baskets, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 43 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like coffee, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

Marisa has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year.

Marisa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like coffee, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 51 years old and married, with four children, two of them in school.

Merly is in the agricultural business, farming coconut in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer.

Merly has been farming coconut for 10 years now, and she has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her work.

In the future, Merly would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Nelia works hard to support her family. She has a 'buy and sell' mud crabs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing and raising livestock. Nelia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional mud crabs to sell for her business.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional mud crabs to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 44 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucia has been in pig fattening for seven years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nhessa

texts.en:
Nhessa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like soap, can goods, eggs, noodles, chips, etc for her general store business.

Nhessa has been in this business for two years. Nhessa earns more income from raising pigs.

Nhessa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like soap, can goods, eggs, noodles, chips, etc

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua lives in the Changamwe area near Mombasa, Kenya. He is 45 years old and he is a married man with two children. Both his children attend school. He also does agriculture as a business and he has been in business for four years  now. 

Joshua heard about  Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy chicks and renovate the chicken hutches. He has ambition of growing the business to be a large-scale producer in the future. The challenge in the business has been diseases and the cost of chicken feed. He will use the income that he will earn to improve his standard of living and also pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy chicks and renovate the chicken hutches.

loans.name: Kimsron

texts.en:
Kimsron, 44, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of Koh Sotin district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Kimsron and her husband earn a living as farmers who have been growing tobacco and sugarcane for 26 years. The current business earns them about US$7 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Kimsron is just with VIsionFund for this cycle. Now she is asking for a loan to pay her son's tuition fee so he can study driving for two months. She hopes this loan will enable her son to have a driving license.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sreytouch's Group

texts.en:
Sreytouch is 27 years old and married.  She lives with her family in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district. She has two daughters to take care of, and now they are still in school. 

To make a living, she has been farming rice and selling groceries for several years.  The current business earns her family about KHR 25,000 per day.
 
Sreytouch has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, Sreytouch is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and some of it to spend on buying more grocery items for resale.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and groceries for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ma. Menarda

texts.en:
Ma. Menarda is 47 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is still in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Ma. Menarda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
As the married parent of five children, Nora works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and she also earns income from farming vegetables. 

Nora is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell for her banana business.

Nora has been sustaining her business activities through no fewer than 20 past loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Al-Najm Group

texts.en:
Al-Najm is a group of five women from Hodeida, Yemen. Najma is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Hodeida, Yemen. She is uneducated and lives with her husband. Once she had children, her husband couldn’t cover the living expenses of his family though he works very hard and for long hours. 

She is a very caring wife and mother. She couldn’t see her husband working for long hours and not help him. So she decided to help him and start up a small business two years ago. 

She sells fried food and cosmetic materials. Now she wants to expand her business to provide for her family. Thus she applied for a loan in the amount of YER 60,000 to buy oil, flour, spices, other food items and cosmetic materials for her business. Najma hopes to make more profits and open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy oil, flour,spices, other food items and cosmetic materials for her business.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou est une femme marié et mère de famille qui s’active dans le commerce de mercerie depuis plus de 5ans. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter et vendre des tissus, file à coudre, pilote et autres accessoires. Seynabou aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.  Elle commence sa journée  de 9h à 13h pour prendre la pause et se reposer et reprend son travail de 15 à 19h. Grace aux crédits de l’institution il souhaite développer son activité et devenir un fournisseur potentiel.
texts.en: Seynabou is a married woman and a mother who has been working in the tailoring business for over five years. She needs this loan in order to buy and sell fabrics, sewing thread, sewing machines and other accessories. Seynabou helps her husband with the family's daily spending allowance. Her day starts at 9 AM, then at 1 PM she takes a break and then she returns to work from 3 PM until 7 PM. Thanks to this loan, she wishes to develop her business and become a potential supplier.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing essentials to sell to her customers

loans.name: Tanzania Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children; one is in school. For ten years now, Fatuma has been running a restaurant selling food and soft drinks like water and soda. She starts working from 6 am to 4 pm per work day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Fatuma has used her previous loans to buy 'mama lishe' (local cafe) food supplies, a deep freezer and more soft drinks. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully, with the business profit used to cover school fees and household expenses. Fatuma will use this loan to buy drinks and improve her restaurant by restocking food supplies. She dreams of owning a hotel and building a nice family house.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group "Tanzania" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks and improve her restaurant by restocking food supplies.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 25 years old and married with one child. With her child currently in school, Gina works very hard to provide for the family.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, snack foods, shampoo, canned goods, juice and other groceries. 

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jasper Lyoise Faith

texts.en: Jasper Lyoise Faith studies for a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education at Misamis University of Science and Technology, Oroquieta City. Her parents are both serving in church as pastors. To pay the school tuition fees for the second semester, she has borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit, where she joined recently. She hopes to continue her studies and wishes to become a teacher in the near future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the second semester.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel wants to work in a bank in the future. She studies towards a BS-Business Administration at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City. Her father earns a living from driving while her mother sells snacks in their community. With this source of income, supporting three student in college is not easy, but Liezel always find ways to overcome in order to pursue her dream. 

Liezel joined GDMPC recently and has borrowed a loan to cover the costs of school fees for the second semester. With faith, Liezel is hopeful to finish her studies and be able to have a better career in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of school fees for the second semester.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is 35 years old and married with four children.

Jessa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jessa has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jessa aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marcela works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.  

Marcela is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks like sugar, noodles, coffee, cooking oil, shampoo, etc. to sell for her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. 

Marcela has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like sugar, noodles, coffee, cooking oil, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Dely

texts.en:
Dely is 54-years-old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school.  Dely works very hard to provide for them.

Dely runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soy sauce, vinegar, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Dely has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Dely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soy sauce, vinegar, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita works hard to support her family. Marianita is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Marianita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marianita has been in this business for 4 years now.

Marianita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is 56 years old and married. She has seven children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Prima is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy pigeed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs. Prima has been in pig fattening for 12 years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

Prima has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 68 años de edad, es  agricultor, solamente estudio hasta  2 grado de estudio.  Vive junto a su compañera de vida  y sus 4 hijas;  de los cuales tres todavía están estudiando.


Carlos, trabaja en la agricultura desde pequeño, lo hacía junto a su padre quien le enseño el trabajo; actualmente trabaja sus cultivos y además trabaja en un corral cerca de su casa, cuidando el ganado que tienen en el cual ya lleva 8 años en ese trabajo. 


El préstamo será utilizado, en la recolección de la cosecha de maíz, en el pago de mano de obra que le ayudaran a la recolección, además quiere sembrar más maíz de regadillo, ya que cerca tiene un ojo de agua donde puede regar el cultivo.


A futuro, desea seguir trabajando y luchando para que a su familia no le falte nada y que sus hijas que están estudiando puedan culminar sus estudios, y que puedan seguir los estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Carlos is 68 years old, works as a farmer, and has a second grade education.  He lives with his life’s partner and four daughters; three are still in school.

Carlos has been working as a farmer since he was a boy.  He did this with his father who taught him and he currently works his crops and also at a corral near his house, caring for livestock they have there and he has been doing this for eight years.

He will use the money from this loan to help with the corn harvest, to pay for labor, and also to plant more corn, since he has a well nearby with which he can water his crops.

In the future he wants to continue working for his family so that they want for nothing and so that his daughters in school can complete their educations and attend university.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Aged 64 years old, San is a married mother of seven children living in a rural village of the Trang district, Cambodia. To support her family, San has been raising pigs and ducks. The current business earns about KHR 33,000 per day to support her daily expenses. 

San has been with VisionFund for eight loan cycles and has completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her business. Now she is asking for another loan to spend on tuition fees for her granddaughter to study finance and banking. She hopes that this loan will help her granddaughter to have a good and bright future from these academic studies and earn a better living in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her granddaughter.

loans.name: Maria Etelvina

texts.es:
María Etelvina es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora de 43 años de edad, casada y madre de 4 hijos dos de ellos están en la escuela y los dos mayores ayudan en las actividades del campo. En su familia es una tradición el rubro del café ya que es la mayor fuente de ingresos para poder cubrir las necesidades del hogar mediante la falta de empleo en su comunidad la cual sabiendo aprovechar y atender de manera correcta las plantaciones las ganancias son prosperas y positivas. Su esposo también se dedica a la caficultura y también a la construcción. El terreno que ellos trabajan es propio una parte fue comprada y otra por herencia de sus padres ubicados a 15 minutos de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando. Uno de los mayores problemas y desafíos encontrados en este rubro en el costo de los insumos que se utilizan para proteger sus cultivos ya que agregado a esto el acarreo del mismo desde el lugar de compra hasta su casa de habitación. También otro desafió que ella ve es la baja de precios en el mercado del grano ya que de no saber tratar el producto este puede perder el valor de su compra ante los intermediarios y demás clientes.    
Por lo que ella necesita financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, abono 12-24-12, urea, foliares, entre otros que ayudaran a poder cumplir la meta que ella y su pareja se han propuesto para esta temporada de poder vender su cosecha a un buen precio y en su totalidad. 
María Etelvina sueña en un futuro ampliar sus tierras cultivando todo el terreno que con mucho esfuerzo ha adquirido para sacar adelante a sus hijos los cuales ella quiere se preparen académicamente para que el día de mañana sean personas preparadas y con muchas oportunidades y opciones en la vida.
texts.en:
María Etelvina is a hardworking woman.  She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of four children, two of whom attend school and the two oldest help with the farm work.  Raising coffee is a tradition in her family because it’s the main source of income with which they cover the household necessities.  Because of the lack of jobs in the community, knowing how to work the plantations properly creates prosperous and positive income.  Her husband also raises coffee and works construction.  They own the land they work; some they purchased and some they inherited from their parents.  It’s located 15 minutes from their home and they walk there.  One of the main problems and challenges is that this is an expensive trade because of the supplies they use to maintain their crops.  Another challenge is that the market price of the crop is going down and the product can lose value among the intermediaries and other customers. 

She needs a loan to buy fertilizer, compost, 12-24-12 fertilizer, urea, seedlings, and other things that will help her achieve the goal that she and her husband have set for this season, and be able to sell their harvest at a good price.

María Etelvina hopes to be able to increase her amount cultivation on the land that she acquired with so much effort, and get her children ahead.  She wants to prepare them academically so that they will be ready for tomorrow and have many opportunities and options in life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is 26-years-old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling bananas, taamu, yams, etc. in her community and has been doing this for three years. Makerita has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a grass sprayer and a crowbar. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Makerita will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a grass sprayer and a crowbar.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
This is Nimfa. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials, such as fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials, such as fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nimfa dreams that her business will grow even more and hopes to have a happy and good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week, where she can share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God as she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Yuom

texts.en:
Yuom is 60 years old and married, with five children of various ages and careers. 

Yuom owns and manages a farming business, growing rice both for sustenance and sales. With the help from her husband and some children, she is able to earn approximately USD 5 per day, which normally goes for meals and other commodities costs. She has been doing this business for more than 35 years.

To help her further develop her farming business, Yuom is asking for a loan of KHR 3,500,000 to buy fertilizer to ensure good growth of her rice crops and to buy a trailer, which can be attached to her plowing machine for loading things. 

As this will be her first loan cycle, she believes that she can develop her current business more productive and boost the household income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice crops and a farm trailer

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor is 42 years old and married with five children.

Eleanor works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling Avon and Natasha in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of Avon and Natasha products to resell.

Eleanor has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling Avon and Natasha for 15 years, and earns an income from rice retailing.

Eleanor aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of Avon and Natasha products to resell.

loans.name: Marycel

texts.en:
Marycel is 39 years old and married with two children.

Marycel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marycel has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and earns an income from clothing sales.

Marycel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Martin, a small-scale farmer who makes his living by farming.  He lives in Nkubu, which is a very fertile area in Eastern Kenya.  Like many localities in the region, Martin grows bananas on his farm, which is his main source of income.  As an additional source of income, he has a bodaboda (motorcycle transport) business that operates in the local area.  In farming, he faces the challenge of lack of enough capital to run the farm.
Martin chose Juhudi Kilimo because their services are easy and affordable, and they offer low interest rates on their loans.  He wants to purchase farm equipment with the loan, which will help him work better in farming.  This will bring in more income and thus, help his family in bettering their lives.

loans.use: to purchase farm equipment.

loans.name: Fides

texts.en:
Fides lives in Mombasa, Kenya.  She is 27 years old and married, with one child 4 years old. Her child attends school. 

She is a business lady.  She deals in second-hand clothes, and she has been in the business for the past year. This business is the only income generator for her, and she works hard every day to make sure the business grows.

She wants to buy five bales of second-hand clothes to increase her customer base. She has ambitions to build more outlets of her business. The challenge that she faces in the busines is competition from other traders.

She knew Milango through friends who invited her to join so that she can save and be able to get funding for the business. The income that she will raise willl improve her standard of living and feed her family.

loans.use: to buy five bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Vergilia

texts.en:
Vergilia is 55 years old and married, with seven children, all in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Vergilia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Vergilia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ercilia

texts.es: Ercilia de 44 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 12 años de edad. Para Ercilia su familia es su principal motivación y es por ella que trabaja duramente para llevar el sustento diario. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de ropa en las principales zonas de su localidad. Con los ingresos que percibe logra mantener buena parte de los gastos del hogar. Su vivienda se encuentra en malas condiciones puesto que el techo se ha deteriorado y necesita cambio lo antes posible. Ha solicitado a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el techo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Ercilia is 44 years old. She lives in her own house with her life companion and her 12 year old daughter. For Ericilia her family is her motivation and this is why she works hard every day to support them. For the past 12 years she has been selling clothing in the various areas of her community. With her revenues she has managed to pay a good part of the household expenses. 

Her house is in poor condition as the roof has deteriorated and needs to be replaced as soon as possible. Ericilia has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to repair the roof as quickly as can be done.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach, aged 30 years, is a resident from the rural village of Baray, Kampong Thom province. Mach is engaged in farming activities to make a livelihood. She primarily grows and harvests rice and cassavas crops once a year on her own farm. She also works as a paid laborer for other farmers’ plantations for additional income. She has been in this occupation for nearly 10 years and earns a suitable income of KHR 12,000 per day. She has two children who are living under her care and income.

At this time, Mach is going to reinvest her capital for planting cassavas again, but she has insufficient money. She is asking for a loan in the sum of KHR 2,000,000 to buy cassava seedlings for planting. She believes that, through her effort and perseverance, she will be able to have a fruitful harvest which she can sell into the local markets at a good price.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Heam

texts.en:
Heam is 35 years old, married and has two children who are attending a local primary school. He permanently lives with his wife and children in a small home in Baray district of Kampong Thom province, Cambodia. To be a responsible husband and father, Heam is dedicated to a farming business, cultivating rice and other seasonal crops on his own farmland. He is also involved in fishing activities. Having been in these businesses for years, he normally earns an income of KHR 15,000 per day to pay for daily meals and other commodities.

Currently, Heam is experiencing difficulties in performing his daily tasks because his fishing boat and plowing machine were broken and stopped working. Heam would like acquire a loan in the amount of KHR 1,000,000 to fix the fishing boat and plowing machine. He is very thankful to all lenders for the loan support, which enables him to sustain his current businesses and make a consistent income to provide for the family.

loans.use: to fix the fishing boat and plowing machine.

loans.name: Laov

texts.en:
Laov is a resident from Baray district, Kampong Thom province. She is 50 years old and has a common-law relationship with her husband, who is a local farmer and the loving father of six children. Laov and her spouse work together to develop their rice farm and ensure a better quality of life. 

Farming is the major source of income for Laov's family. She has been doing this for more than 33 years. Laov would like to improve her household income, so she needs some capital to invest in the purchase of fishing materials, which will allow the family to become involved in fishing activities. For this reason, she is asking for a loan amounting to KHR 700,000 from Kiva lenders through its partner, HKL, to buy fishing nets, hooks, traps and other materials. With the income she expects to earn from the business as the result of the loan, she aims to save enough for the future growth of her family-owned business and for possible emergencies of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks, traps and other materials.

loans.name: Nin

texts.en:
Nin is a 31-year-old married woman and has two children, both of whom are going to school. To earn a living, Nin devotes her energy and time to a farming business, which is her traditional family business. She learned to do this from her parents, who are many-year experienced farmers. With the help from her husband in the current business, she is able to generate approximately KHR 20,000 per day. Farming is the sole source of income for her family.

In order to improve her farming productivity, Nin would like to borrow a KHR 2,000,000 loan, which will enables her to buy two cows for the maintenance of their rice fields. She thanks lenders for their generosity and good will towards less fortunate people like her, allowing her to further develop her business as well as her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two cows for the maintenance of their rice fields.

loans.name: Kimsreang

texts.en:
Kimsreang is 27 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are enrolled in school while the other one is still young. To help her husband earn income for the family, Kimsreang has a position in a local market, where she sells mixed grocery products, earning approximately $15.00 per day, which she usually uses for daily meals, home bills, school allowances for her children, and other costs. She has been a market vendor since 2011.

Since she doesn’t have a safe latrine for use at home, she is unable to help her family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 700 US dollars to build a household latrine and buy the necessary supplies. She is grateful for the water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate, which has encouraged her to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy all that is necessary for it.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann is 50 years old and a hard-working farmer in Kampong Thom province. 

He has been engaged in farming for over 30 years. Farming is the major source of income for his family. He primarily grows and harvest rice once a year. 

He is married to a local farmer, and together they have been blessed with six children: four single children and two married children. 

Three among his children are currently employed as garment workers in Phnom Penh. As they don’t have a motorcycle for commuting to work, they have to pay much for motor-taxi service every day. 

To help them reduce their daily costs, Vann is taking out a loan in the sum of USD 1,000 to buy a used motorcycle for his employed children. He hopes that his loan will not be rejected. 

Thanks in advance to all kind lenders, who have contributed their funds to help a poor fellow like him improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle so his children can commute

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel is married with 2 children and lives in the village of Panaon, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. Rodel manages a farm to earn a living. He has been doing this for four years, earning well for the family. 

Rodel joined GDMPC in 2012 and his previous loan that was used for the farm has been successfully repaid. He is always finding ways to augment his income for the coming year. His children will soon be going to school. 

Recently, Rodel borrowed a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm. Rodel hopes to double his income from the business for he wants to improve the general standard of living for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm.

loans.name: Leoncio Martin

texts.es:
Leoncio Martin tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz y maíz, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda el servicio de transporte en su mototaxi trasladando a sus pasajeros a las comunidades aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindado el servicio.
texts.en:
Leoncio Martin is 29-years old. He lives in the Cayaltí district. The people in his town make their livings farming sugar cane, rice and corn, running shops and raising livestock. Their town is two hours from Chiclayo in the northern coast of Perú.

Leoncio offers transportation services on his "mototaxi." He transports passengers from the outlying areas of his district. Leoncio is requesting a loan of 3 000 nuevos soles (USD $1075) to maintain his vehicle and thereby be able to keep offering his services.

loans.use: with vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Eddielyn

texts.en:
Eddielyn is a married mother with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eddielyn is 31 years old and both of her children are in school.

Eddielyn has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Eddielyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like pants, blouses, bags, slippers and other items.

Eddielyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Eddielyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like pants, blouses, bags, slippers and other items.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 35 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sren's Group

texts.en:
Sren is 42 and married. She has four children, three of whom are still in school. 

Living in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Sren has been farming rice and working as a paid worker. Having been in this business for 25 years, she manages to earn about 36,000 KHR per day to feed her family.
 
This is the first loan for Sren with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is a private entrepreneur from Arapi village of the Shirak region. He lives with his wife. 

It's already almost a year that Harutyun has been running a small grocery store. One of the rooms of his house Harutyun has transformed into a small store. He sells different grocery products in his store. 

Harutyun currently wants to expand his small store and he wants to change the place of the store. Besides, as the assortment of goods is not that big, he also wants to purchase new items for selling in the store. To reach his goa,l Harutyun needs a loan of USD 2,000 to renovate and expand the store and to buy new items to resell. The loan will help Harutyun to run his business in a more efficient and productive way. Harutyun and his wife highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be grateful to them for their help in collecting the needed loan to develop their small business.

loans.use: to renovate and expand the store and to buy new items to resell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur who farms corn as a business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy corn seed, fertilizer and other supplies for her corn farming business.

Margie has been in this business for four years. Margie earns additional income from raising chickens.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer and other supplies

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 26 years old, and a married mother of one kid. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Luisa has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa requested an 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as soft drinks, bread and a variety of goods to sell.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save money to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as soft drinks, bread and a variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 60 years old, married and has three children.

Estela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like noodles, soft drinks, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Estela has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Estela aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory (noodles, soft drinks, shampoo, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Mary Grace  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit and veggies to sell

loans.name: Neri

texts.en:
Neri is 35 years old, married, and has one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Neri has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like fish meat, spices, etc.

Neri has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Neri would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like fish meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Maria Miriam

texts.es: María de 38 años de edad es madre de dos niños de 19 años y 14 años de edad. Junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía de su hogar y dan a sus hijos lo necesario. María se dedica a la venta carne de cerdo desde hace mucho tiempo. Gracias a su carisma ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda ya que con el tiempo y las lluvias se ha deteriorado. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra  de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para hacer la reparación lo antes posible.
texts.en: María is 38-years old and the mother of two children who are 19- and 14-years old respectively.  She and her husband support the household together and give their children what they need.  María has made her living selling pork for a long time.  Thanks to her charisma, she has earned the confidence of many customers, who are ever happier with her services. María wants to improve her home's roof, as time and the rains have caused it to deteriorate.  She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails so she can make the repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails to repair her home's roof.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nateete, in the region of Kampala west, in Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, 3 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her business, which sells timber. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase inventory, and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and have more capital. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to have various branches of her business. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to increase inventory.

loans.name: Chanla

texts.en:
Chanla is a resident from Pursat province. She is 45 years old, married and has two school-aged children. Chanla and her husband work together to manage their two-hectare rice fields. They are very hardworking and always aim to move ahead in the current business and provide enough for the sake of their children. They have been doing farming for almost 20 years.

Currently, Chanla’s family doesn’t have a safe latrine for use at home, so she wants to improve the sanitation and personal hygiene. In this regard, she has requested a loan of 1,100 US dollars to build a household latrine and to buy its necessities. She will also use the remaining balance to build water storage at home. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL, with a special interest rate, which is encouraging her to focus on healthy living conditions and to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and to buy its necessities.

loans.name: Dayludita

texts.en:
Dayludita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines.

Dayludita requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock and supplies for her business. She has been in this business for three years now.

Dayludita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and supplies for her business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 51 years old, married and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice and raising pigs, in the Philippines. Eugenia has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Eugenia has been farming rice for 18 years now. She has borrowed twenty-four times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is 73 years old and widowed. She has nine children.

Basilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like detergent soap, sugar, soft-drink, shampoo and other groceries.

Basilia has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Basilia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store, like detergent soap, sugar, soft-drinks, shampoo and other groceries.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
As a parent of one childr, Avelina works hard to support her family.

She has a lumber yard business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and chainsaw for rent. Avelina is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of wood to sell for her lumber yard business.

Avelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of wood to sell.

loans.name: Ala

texts.en:
Ala is 49 years old and married, with seven children. 

She has a plantation and grows bananas, taamu,  taro, etc., which she sells in her community.  She has been doing this for five years. 

Ala has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, a pickaxe, boots, tarpaulin, and chemicals. 

She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ala will expand her business and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, a pickaxe, boots, tarpaulin, and chemicals

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Balcon I Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento NUEVO AMANECER BALCON I, está compuesto por Trece integrantes doce mujeres y un varón,  todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Maria, tiene 38 años y es casada y tiene un hijo de la edad de 17 años,  ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de pan,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de harina  al por mayor para elaboración de panetones para esta navidad como y así incrementar su capital de trabajo, la señora Maria Va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es  poder abastecerse  de este producto ya que esta época de fin de año con los panetones tiene mucha venta y es donde tiene que aprovechar para así tener más ingresos económicos, se siente agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: The entrepreneurial bank "Nuevo Amanecer Balcon I" (New Dawn Balcony 1) is made up of thirteen members: twelve women and one man.  They all make their livings in different businesses.  The president of this communal bank is Señora Maria.  She is 38-years old, is married and has one 17-year old son.  Señora Maria earns her living making and selling bread.  This is her first loan cycle with the institution.  She is going to use this loan to purchase wholesale flour for making "panetones" (Christmas pastries) for this Christmas season and to increase her working capital.  Señora Maria plans to use her profits to keep improving her business.  Her hope for the business is to be able to stock up with "panetones," as toward the end of the year she can sell a lot of them.  She needs to take advantage of the increased sales to increase her income.  Señora Maria is grateful for the opportunity that she is being offered.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale flour.

loans.name: Soknai

texts.en:
Soknai, age 32, is married with two children, both of whom are attending a local primary school. Soknai and her husband work the land for rice cultivation on farmland that was inherited by parents from both sides after their marriage. Through their hardships, they aim to provide their children with educational opportunities because they want them to earn a degree and become professional in the future. They have been doing farming for nearly 15 years.
