Currently, Soknai’s family doesn’t have a safe bathroom for use at home, so she wants to improve the sanitation and personal hygiene. For this reason,  she has requested a loan of 800 US dollars to build a household bathroom and buy its necessaries. The water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate encouraged her to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household bathroom

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
This is Say. She is 34 years old and a resident living in a rural village of Kampong Thom province. She earns a living by cultivating rice and trading beds with her husband. She and her husband have good co-operation. During the rainy season, they focus on their farming business to ensure a good production while during the other season, they buy beds from local carpenters in their region to retail to the other parts of the province by using a horse-pulled trailer. They have been doing this for more than 13 years and earn a daily income of KHR 32,000 per day on average.

Because of the shortage of money, Say is asking for a loan of KHR 3,000,000 as her working capital to buy beds for a traveling sale. With the support of the loan, she hopes that she will be able to improve her household income, so she can ensure enough food and education for her two school-aged children. She is very happy and thankful to all the kind lenders for their generosities.

loans.use: to buy beds for their traveling sale.

loans.name: Huruma Group

texts.en:
Lilian, a single woman aged early 30s, has been managing her family expenses by running two enterprises. One of Lilian's businesses is a grocery where she sells drinks like spirits, beers, soft drinks, juices and water. A beauty salon is another of Lilian's businesses, where she sells cosmetics at the same place. She has been operating these businesses for four years now and is working from 8am to mid-night hours. Lilian is able to earn good monthly returns. 

From Kiva Partner Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Lilian's third loan request which she will use to increase her stock of beauty salon cosmetics. With her previous loans, all of which have been repaid in full, she purchased more grocery drinks, empty crates for ordering beers and soda, bought a salon drier and small working equipment. With Lilian's profits, she covered school fees and household expenses, bought a home freezer and reinvested in her businesses. She dreams to be a successfully woman.  

Lilian will share this loan with her loan group" HURUMA" which totals 4 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase stock of beauty salon cosmetics.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn works hard to support her family. Rovelyn is single and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Rovelyn requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vegetables like cabbage, pepper, carrots, tomatoes, etc. to sell.

Rovelyn has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Rovelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables like cabbage, pepper, carrots, tomatoes, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She describes her family challenge to be that she spends a lot of time searching for water. She will use the KES 32,700 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and live a healthy life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 35 year old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 8 years and 16 years. She describes herself as a determined person. She operates a farm where she grows crops to sell to earn a living. She describes her family challenge to be a lack of clean drinking water. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will have clean drinking water.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Kiloko

texts.en:
Kiloko has a cereal-selling business which she has been running for 10 years now. She sells maize and beans. She is also a farmer. She is 54 years old, married they have been blessed with six children. Her spouse also provides additional income. Right now, her monthly income is KES 28,000.

Kiloko will use this loan to buy more stock of maize and beans to sell. She will also buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seedlings for use in her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to pay the school fees for her children and also to build a better house for her family.

This is her third loan term and she repaid her previous loans successfully. Her future hope is to venture into dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a lady of thirty four years, married to Edward and a mother of one child. She sells calling cards and Mpesa agent lines. She has been in this business for five years now,. She gets a monthly income of 23,000 UGX.

This will be Ruth's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy calling cards in bulk for her business and also agent lines. In future, she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy calling cards and agent lines.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Wilma works hard to support her family. She has a soft-drink retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods and ready-to-wear clothing. Wilma is borrowing PHP 26,000, through NWTF, to purchase more inventory of soft-drinks to sell.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to have a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of soft-drinks to sell.

loans.name: Elmiralyn

texts.en:
Elmiralyn is 21 years old and single. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elmiralyn is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy pigfeed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elmiralyn has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pigfeed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Erlinda works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing vending. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, eggs, canned goods, etc., for her general store business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from fish vending. 

Clarita is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Clarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
This is Mwanakombo. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to purchase a new motorcycle for her business.  
She would like to apply for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy more stock of household consumables to sell in her retail shop. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables in her retail shop for resale.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.

Bibi has been operating a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Irma Margarita

texts.es: Irma de 62 años de edad es una mujer admirable quien con mucho esfuerzo logra sacar los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de su hogar,  Irma se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace mucho tiempo y su esposo es un pequeño ganadero quien con mucho esfuerzo logra sacar los ingresos diarios. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones desea reparar su cocina puesto que en la actualidad la tiene al aire libre y desea asegurar sus pocas pertenencias. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de madera, lámina galvanizada y clavos. Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Irma is 62 years old, and she is a very commendable woman who works very hard to contribute towards the income of her home along with her husband. She  has been selling beauty products for a long time now, while her husband is a livestock farmer.

In order to improve the conditions of her home, she wishes to repair her kitchen, as it is currently an outdoors kitchen and she would like to protect her belongings.  This is why she is requesting a loan through FUSAI, to buy wood, corrugated metal sheets and nails. Irma acknowledges having the means to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy wood, corrugated metal sheets and nails.

loans.name: Optaciano

texts.es: Optaciano de 64 años de edad habita en casa propia junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 14 y 13 años de edad. Para él lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que traba duramente para llevar el sustento diario. Toda su vida se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz y frijoles y de esa forma mantiene a su familia. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una fosa séptica. Con el crédito comprará cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y pagará la construcción de la misma. Optaciano expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Optaciano is 64 and lives in his own house with his wife and two children, aged 14 and 13. For him, the most important thing is his family, and it is for them that he works hard to meet their needs.
He has worked all his life growing maize and beans, and this is how he provides for his family.

He is asking for a loan through FUASI to invest in the building of a septic tank. With the loan he intends to buy cement, sand, gravel and bricks, as well as paying for the septic tank to be built. Optaciano says that he has the means to repay the loan..

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and bricks, and to pay for a septic tank .

loans.name: Nor

texts.en:
Nor is a 42-year-old industrious mother of three adult children. To earn a living, Nor has two business ventures in Kampong Thom province. She cultivates seasonal crops and raises piglets for an additional profit. Her husband works in the same career and always helps to manage their daily tasks at their farms.

As of now, Nor needs to borrow a loan in the sum of 2,000,000 KHR to buy 10 pigs and feed for the pigs. When the pigs mature, Nor hopes to sell them in the local markets at a good price. In the future, Nor aims to enlarge her pig farm and increase the number of pigs that she raises. She thanks lenders for their generosities and good will towards poor fellows like her to improve her family-owned business.

loans.use: to buy 10 pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the  region of Kampala west, in Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, 1 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her general retail shop, which deals in various home items. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goods and increase on stock. This will help Rose to generate greater profits. Rose hopes that, in the future, she will be able to start other side businesses. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more goods and increase on stock.

loans.name: Melvie

texts.en: Melvie is a single entrepreneur who manages a coconut farm for a living. She earns a good income from the farm and she is able to help with her parents' needs and buy a motorcycle that she uses to carry farm products to market. After five years in farming, Melvie never gets tired of going there for she has relatives to help her work on the farm. She joined GDMPC recently and requested a loan to repair the motorcycle used to carry the farm products. When not needed for the harvest, she lets some of her relatives rent the motorcycle for transportation services. In the future, Melvie wants to have a better life.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle to transport farm products

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny is married, with an only child,  and resides in San Juan, Pana-on. 

Danny manages his farm, raising bananas for a living.  He has been in this business for four  years, and he earns good enough for his family's daily needs. 

Danny joined GDMPC in 2012, and his previous loan  for the farm was successfully repaid. 

Recently, he has borrowed a new loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for farm expansion. 

Always hoping for the improvement of his family, he is determined to expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a man of sixty two years, married to Luciah and a father of two children. He does photocopying job and he is also runs an M-PESA agency(money transfer through the phone). He has been in this business for eleven years now. Peter gets a monthly income of UGX 22,000.

This will be Peter's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to increase his M-PESA float. He wants to improve his family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: To buy more printing papers and add more M-PESA float (money transfer business).

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is married, with five children ages 15 to 28 years.  Her husband works as a driver. 

Juanita is a meat vendor. She is also engaged in the hog-raising business in her place in Bohol, Philippines.

Juanita is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and also animal feed. With this, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business, thus augmenting her income. 

Moreover, she wants to save money for reinvestment into the same business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia runs a business selling assorted snacks such as banana cue (sweetened, deep-fried bananas), hot dogs, hotcakes and many other items in the local community. Often, her children help in preparing the foods and inviting customers to buy. The business is a supplement to her everyday needs.  Cecilia used her previous loan from GDMPC to improve the business and was successfully repaid. Currently, she requested a new loan to buy additional ingredients to cook and sell in the market. She is hoping to sustain her business to have a stable source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients to cook and sell in the market

loans.name: Bernaditha

texts.en:
Bernaditha is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells rice grains in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Bernaditha is requesting a loan from NWTF for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 44 years old and has four children. She is married and one child is currently in school.

Marieta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of pigfeed.

In the future, Marieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of pigfeed.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina is 32 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Maria Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc.

Maria Cristina has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Maria Cristina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Juddy

texts.en: Juddy is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as a happy person. She operates a farm where she grows crops to sell. She describes her family challenge to be an insufficient source of light in their house. She will use the Kes 55,000 loan to buy a solar energy system (i.e solar panel, solar battery, cables etc.) to enable her to install solar energy in her house. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system i.e solar panel, solar battery, cables etc.

loans.name: Giulasgar

texts.en:
Giulasgar, from the village of Changilari, is 63 years old and married.  He is Azerbaijani and his children live there. Giulasgar and his wife own a house in Georgia and run an agricultural business. Specifically, they grow peaches in the garden and sell the harvest seasonally. 

In order to generate income, Giulasgar plans to start an animal sales business. If his loan is funded on the web-site, Giulasgar will buy 7-8 baby cows in the Javakheti Region, where prices are lower, and sell the livestock in his district with a price mark-up.  He will invest the increased profit in the same business and continue sales. Giuslasgar hopes that his business initiative will be lucrative and he will improve his living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy calves for resale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 60-year-old Isatu, from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is widowed and has 4 children. Isatu established her local food business because she didn’t want to depend on her children. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week moving around the community to sell her goods. She says that the main challenge is a lack of enough capital to run her business.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more cooking commodities to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Isatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cooking commodities to expand her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is in her late 30s and married with two children. She runs a domestic products business in the Tombo Western rural area of Sierra Leone. She started business because she wanted to maintain her family's welfare. 

She's been in this business since after the war and sells glass cups, knives and food containers within her community. She says that the main problem in her business is the improper business location.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to resell.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to build a boat. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and containers to sell

loans.name: Gongo La Mboto 1 Group

texts.en:
Sabrina, who is in her late 30s is married and has three children.  One of her children is still at school, one is a grown up and the last one is still young.  Sabrina has been running two businesses, selling charcoal and new clothes, for six years now. She works from 8.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Sabrina's 3rd loan from Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the charcoal stock and bought more clothes for selling door to door. She is happy with the loan. She has managed to pay back all of her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees and bought more clothes to resell. She also helped her husband to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and clothes to resell. She dreams of owing a pharmacy.

Sabrina will share this loan with her loan group, Gongo La Mboto 1, which has seven members. Each member will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and clothes to resell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera, in the region of Kampala west, in Uganda. She is Married and has 3 children, 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her clothing business; she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used for business expansion, and will help Joyce to generate greater profits and increase stock. Joyce hopes that in the future she will be able to start up other projects. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: with business expansion.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 30 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years, Jimmy has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential home-use commodities. 

To help expand his business, Jimmy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand his business and will help Jimmy to generate greater profits. Jimmy hopes that in the future he will be able to keep expanding his business. 

Jimmy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jimmy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his retail store.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Elida tiene 45 años de edad, vive el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a ala venta de cerveza, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, también cría cerdos que los ofrece en el mercado de la zona.

Es una mujer emprendedora, va a colocar una bodega de abarrotes, po lo que ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de víveres y de esta manera ofrece a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elida is 45-years old. She lives in the Buenos Aires district. The people in her town make their livings in agriculture, running shops and raising livestock. Her town is two hours from Piura, in the northern coast of Perú.

Elida makes her living selling beer. Her business is set up in her home. She also raises pigs to sell in the local markets.

Elida is an enterprising woman. She plans to open a small grocery store, which is why she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1 000 nuevos soles (USD $375). She will use the loan to purchase supplies. Having more to offer her customers will generate a greater income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to stock up her small grocery.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 41 years old and married. He sells clothes and has been in the business for four years now. Right now his monthly income is KES 10,000. Besides selling clothes, he is also a shoe shiner. Together with his spouse they have been blessed with three children.

Stephen will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell. He will also purchase shoe shining materials such as shoe polish and brushes. This is his first loan term and he will use the anticipated profits to open another shoe shining business. 

His future hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell and shoe shining materials.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself to be determined. 

Rose operates a farm where she grows crops to sell. She describes her family challenge to be the long distance they travel to fetch water. She will use the KES 32,700 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a healthy family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a single woman of 50 years. She is a mother of two children. She weaves baskets and makes bangles, earrings, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years now and gets a monthly income of 17,000 shillings.

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy materials for making baskets, bangles, earrings, etc. In the future, she wants to be a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en: Sidi is a Kiva borrower. She operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She describes her family challenge to be that they live in an area that hardly rains and they struggle to get water. She will use the KES 6,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family's living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are still in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Marilyn has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy pigfeed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Rugiatu, from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has 3 children. Two of her children are going to school. 

After the war, Rugiatu established her retail business. She began her business because she needed to create an income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week, moving around the community to sell her goods. She says that the main challenge to her business lack of enough capital.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to buy more toothpaste, soap and cream for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future; Rugiatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more tooth paste, soap and cream for resale.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson got a Kiva loan that has help him to transform his business. He is happy that he was able to repay the loan without challenges. He is seeking another loan so that he can buy materials for his tailoring shop and also for the M-pesa business that he started. 

Johnson hopes that, in the next five years, he will be able to diversify to other forms of businesses and increase his income. The major challenge that he faces in the business\s is competition from other businesses.

He learned of Milango through friends who invited him to join so that he could access funding for his business. The income that he will raise will improve his standard of living and he will also be able to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy cloth for tailoring and to increase float for M-pesa money transfer business

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Mabinty from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has 3 children. Mabinty established her tie-dye material business. She began her business because she needs to create an income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main business challenge is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy more tie-dye material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her children's welfare. In the future, Mabinty plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more tie-dye material for resale.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes works hard to support her family. Mercedes is single and has a fruit and vegetables vending business in the Philippines.

Mercedes has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell. Mercedes has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Mercedes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 64 years old and married with three children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc.

Teresita has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and earns additional income from rice retailing and pig fattening.

Teresita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net.

Wilma has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur, age 36, is married. His wife devotes herself to the domestic chores, and they have three children.

Seymur gets up at 5:00 a.m. together with his wife and children, who go to school. He works in agriculture, a trade he learned from his parents. While he is working the land, his wife milks the cows in the morning and sells the milk. Then, when he returns in the afternoon, he takes care of the animals in the pastures that he rents.

The loan that he is requesting from the VFAC is to buy a calf and to build a new hen-coop.

loans.use: to buy calf & to build a new hen-coop.

loans.name: Ayah Group

texts.en:
Ayah Group is made up of four women who live in the same neighborhood in Hodiedah, Yemen. They have requested a loan of 140,000 YER as financial support with the aim of expanding their businesses. 

Roqia is a 49 year old, divorced woman and she has children. She has been operating a clothes and food sales business for a few years. She started her business when her husband left her. This business allows her to meet her needs without much difficulty. She obtains her supplies at a market in the city. She has requested a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy more clothes and food for resale. The extra income generated as a result of this loan will help her to develop her business into a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and food for resale.

loans.name: Kenyi Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been a client of Finance South Sudan Limited for over two years. He is 30 years of age and the father of two children. One of the children goes to school. He knew about Finance South Sudan through other clients.

Peter is a businessman who runs a general store that sells items like beers, sodas, sugar, soaps, and many other household goods. He has been in this business for two years now. He is borrowing an amount worth 1,500 South Sudanese pounds (SSP) to enable him buy more stock for the business. 

Peter will pay back the loan from the business profits and the loan will also enable him to pay school fees for his child and pay for medication and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy items like beer, soda, sugar, and soap

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos se dedica desde hace varios años al ganado repasto y al cultivo de maíz, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar  algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos Hijos, Carlos está solicitando un crédito  para poder comprar concentrado y vitaminas para el ganado y poder seguir con su trabajo, para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
For several years Carlos has earned his living raising cattle and growing maize. He sells the products in nearby areas, and with the income he pays for his household expenses. He lives with his wife and two children in his own house.

Carlos is seeking a loan to buy special cattle feed and vitamins so he can continue working and be able to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: Buy cattle feed and vitamins

loans.name: Tamalinda Group

texts.en:
Naomi is a single mother with two children, one is in school and another has completed school. For five years now, Naomi (aged late thirties) has been managing her family by running a clothes business (fabrics) door to door. She works from 9am to 6pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to increase her inventory of fabrics to resell. Naomi's previous loans, all of which have been paid back in full, were used to buy more fabrics for her business. Naomi is working hard to make her business succeed. She used her profits to buy a radio, TV and sofa set. She paid household expenses and saved some in her bank account. Naomi dreams to take her own bigger loan. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, " TAMALINDA", which totals 3 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase more on fabrics to resell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 24 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past year, Betty has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells foodstuffs. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food items, such as maize flour, bread, and milk, to sell and will help Betty to generate greater profits and expand on the business income. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a wholesale shop outlet. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase for more food items such as maize flour, bread, and milk to sell

loans.name: Segundo Felix

texts.es:
Segundo Felix tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad tranquila que se caracteriza porque su población es muy acogedora, a dos horas de la ciudad e Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda el servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi., trasladando a sus clientes a las zonas aledañas a su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para comprar una moto furgón, para brindar otro servicios y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Felix is 41, lives with his family in the district of Zana, its habitants work in agriculture, trade and livestock farming, it's a quiet community that is characterized for their hospitality, located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, in the North coast of Peru.

He provides public transportation services in his motorized bike taxi, transporting clients to nearby areas of his community, he has requested a loan of 4,000 PEN to buy a motorized rickshaw, to provide other services and this way have more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorized rickshaw

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret runs an Agrovet shop in Makueni town where she sells pesticides, farm inputs and veterinary medicines. She is 26 years old and single. She supports her parent and her three siblings. She has been in this business for close to two years now and she makes a monthly income of KES 10,000.

This is her first loan term and she plans to buy more stock of pesticides, fertilizer, seedlings and farm chemicals. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business by buying more types of veterinary medicine. 

Margaret hopes to grow her Agrovet business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of Agrovet stock.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a Kiva borrower. He operates a restaurant where he sells cooked food. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that sometimes he closes his business due to lack of water. He will use the KES 6,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for use in the restaurant. He hopes that in the future he will improve his living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos lives in Akhalkalaki District. He is 56 years old, married and lives with his wife, two grown sons, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Sos is, at the moment, unemployed. The only source of income for the family is agricultural land, where they grow potatoes and sell seasonally. The family lives in poverty.

Sos decided to start his business as their existing income isn’t enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to country vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Sos will purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Zenaida has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from room rentals.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is 43 years old, is married and has children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen, and owns a grocery store. Mustafa works hard and has had the business for many years. He is an enterprising man, always ready to work to improve himself and succeed in the future. Mustafa's store is very well known in the area and has a lot of customers, as everything he sells is excellent. He wants to expand his business and is requesting a loan of YER100,000 from AMB to buy grocery products to expand his inventory. In the future, he hopes to keep expanding his business and establish a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to expand his inventory.

loans.name: Rwashamaire Mpora Mpora Kwetungura Group

texts.en:
This is a group located in Rwashameire Ntungamo district taking another loan. The group is comprised of men and women whose major activity is farming. A few are engaged in other businesses like trading. They applied for a loan to improve their agricultural activities. They have a challenge of low productivity within their businesses due to poor farming methods and price fluctuation. Their prime target is to change the lives of their families and also to take their children to good schools. But they are limited by the funds available to enable them achieve their dreams. With this loan they believe their production will improve, along with their lifestyle. 

Allen, a mother of five, will use the loan to buy organic manure and mulches, which will improve her productivity. She will then be in a position to better provide for her family. In the photograph are the group members and the Ugafode credit officer (extreme left).

loans.use: To buy organic manure and mulches

loans.name: Juana Elena

texts.es: Juana de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija de 17 años de edad, Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace 13  años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo  logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Juana solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales y cal para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Juana is 45-years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her 17-year old daughter.  She has made her living selling tortillas from her home for the last thirteen years.  She works from Monday to Sunday.  Doña Juana has a lot of customers, as she is a very hard-working and friendly person.  With the money she earns and help from her husband, they are able to meet their household expenses.  Doña Juana is requesting a loan to purchase "quintales" (a unit of weight equivalent to 100 kg). of corn and also lime to keep making tortillas.  She will then be able to earn a better profit, with which she and her family can have improved financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase "quintales" (a unit of weight equivalent to 100 kg.) of corn and also lime.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz Angélica tiene 31años de edad , vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, nos explica que se dedica a esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados y así tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz Angélica is 31 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in the district of Oyotún. Her community, which is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo along the northern coast of Peru, is dedicated to commerce, agriculture, and livestock raising.  

Luz works raising and selling pen animals, which she raises in the yard of her home. She tells us that this work enables her to support her husband with their family expenses. 

Luz has asked for a loan of 1,000 soles to buy animal feed, which will allow her to have a better production to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to enlarge small animals

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a Kiva borrower. She operates a retail store where she sells sugar, bread, salt, soap and other items. She describes her family challenge to be that they live in a dry area and it's hard for the family to access water. She will use the KES 6,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a healthy family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as a creative person. She operates a food stall where she sells cooked food. She describes her family's challenge to be that where she lives it hardly rains and they struggle to access water. 

She will use the KES 6,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Hrach

texts.en:
Hrach is 62 years old and lives with his wife in Yerevan city. For 10 years, Hrach has worked as a taxi driver using his own car. Due to his hard work, Hrach has a lot of customers who prefer to use his taxi service since he drives attentively and very carefully.
 
Now Hrach is asking for a loan to do repairs on the car and purchase new wheels for winter. Hrach has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Hrach to be able to continue the taxi business, which is the only source of his family's income.

loans.use: to repair his car and buy new wheels

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 32 years old and married with two children who are in school. Ailyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ailyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

Ailyn has been in this business for eight years.

In the future Ailyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

She has operated a fish-selling business for the past three years, selling at the market to her neighbors’ and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 47 años, viuda y con un gran motivo de vida que es su pequeño hijo de 14 años tiene un gran camino en cuanto a brindarle todo lo necesario para su futuro. Posee una vivienda construida  a base de adobe en donde comparte sus vivencias familiares.Posee un negocio dedicado a la venta de comidas el cual viene liderando hace mas de 6 años, en una local que alquila. Comenta que al inicio solo tenía conocimientos básicos en cuanto a la preparación de platos comerciales logrando enriquecer sus conocimiento por el requerimiento de sus comensales el cual hasta hoy la convierten en un local muy concurrido de trabajadores agrícolas y transportistas del lugar. Le agrada su trabajo puesto que se siente bien al tener una buena concurrencia por parte de su clientela. Se siente muy a gusto por su labor puesto le parece entretenido atender a su clientela con buen trato que motiva la concurrencia masiva. Su objetivo a largo plazo están en la construcción de su vivienda para posteriormente habilitarlo y desempeñar su negocio evitando así el pago del alquiler. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea en esta ocasión contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de víveres al por mayor para la preparación de sus alimentos como arroz, azúcar, cereales; entre otros.
texts.en:
Luisa is 47 years old, widowed, and very motivated to provide the best quality of life for her 14 year old son whom she wants to have a bright future. She owns an adobe home that she shares with other family members. She also has a business selling food from a location which she rents, which she has had for more than 6 years. She tells us that at the beginning she only had basic knowledge of how to prepare different dishes, but that through the demands of her customers she learned how to improve her cooking. Today, this has enabled her to have a lot of business, particularly with agricultural labors and transportation workers in her area. She is very grateful for her work because of the close relationships she has with her clients. She treats them well which enables her to establish these relationships. Luisa's long term goal is to improve her home so that she can later run her business from where she lives in order to avoid paying rent. 

This is the third Kiva loan that Luisa has benefited from, and she is very grateful for the financial support that has allowed her to continue to get ahead. She has always paid back her loan installments when due. Currently, she is asking for a loan of 1,000 soles to buy wholesale ingredients for her food preparation, including rice, sugar, and grains, among others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar and grains, among others

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 24 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the  region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Teddy has been working hard to manage her Salon.  

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her business and buy more hair extensions, and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Teddy hopes that in the future she will be able to open another branch. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase her business and buy more hair extensions.

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es: Maria de 42 años vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia, desde hace 10 años se dedica  la comercialización de productos de uso domésticos como: lejía, detergentes, jabones, desinfectantes, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela pues son productos que se usan diariamente, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mas productos por mayor y asi generar mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Maria is 42 years old and lives with her spouse and three children in their own home. She has sold household products including lye, detergent, soap, and disinfectants for ten years. Her business is located at her home and she has many customers because these products are used everyday. With the earnings from the business, she is able to cover her household's expenses. María is requesting this loan to buy more products at wholesale so that she can earn more to give her family what they need without being held back.

loans.use: to buy lye, detergent, soap, and disinfectant.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos de 10 y 7 años de edad y su esposo, ella  posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, leche, aceite, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda como: refrescos, azúcar, arroz, sal,  jabón, aceites, margarinas, etc. asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her two children (ages 10 and 7) and her husband.  She has a store where she sells basic groceries such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, milk, oil, and others.  She has had this business for many years, which has given her sales experience that allows her to obtain the best profits possible.  Her store is located in her home, which is in a heavily trafficked area.  It is well known by her neighbors in the area and she has obtained many customers, allowing her to keep the store well stocked.

She is seeking to expand her business with a new investment but is in need of capital.  For this reason, she is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs for her store such as soda, sugar, salt, soap, oil, margarine, etc.  She promises to pay off her debt and at the same time is confident that she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy soda, sugar, rice, salt, soap, oil, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Usalama Group

texts.en:
Subira, who is in her early 40s, is a widow with two daughters; one is in school. For three years now, Subira has been running mamalishe food business and cosmetics door-to-door. She sells her cosmetics on credit to known customers and allows them to pay monthly after they get paid their salary; unknown people are asked to pay cash. She starts working from 09am and works to 11pm every working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to start selling soft drinks in her restaurant. Subira dreams to have a good life. She will share this loan with her loan group "Usalama" which totals five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling soft drinks in her restaurant.

loans.name: Tirsa

texts.en:
Tirsa is married, the mother of eight children.  She lives in the town of  Panglao, Bohol, in the Philippines.  

She has been in the business of dried fish-vending and fishing for almost 14 years.  Her husband is a fisherman, and they both work hard to support their family. She also raises chickens in her backyard.


Tirsa needs a loan for their fishing business. She is requesting PHP 9,000 to buy new fishing nets and to repair their fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell. 

Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and repair her husband's  fishing boat

loans.name: Villaluna

texts.en: Villaluna is a single entrepreneur from Pana-on, Misamis Occidental and runs a general store for a living. For three years in this business, she has been able to support her parents and save a portion of her profit. She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to expand her business and hopefully sustain it for a better future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en: Elvera runs a general store in the village of Pana-on to earn a living. While her husband was at the farm, Elvera helped earn income by selling grocery goods and she has been doing this for a year. She joined GDMPC and requested a loan to buy additional grocery goods for sale. She plans to use her generated profits as capital to expand her business. She wants to improve the general living of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Dely Jasmin

texts.en:
Dely Jasmin is a married woman with three children who resides at Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Dely helps her husband to manage their farm to make a living. With her previous loan, she bought seeds, and her farm became successful and she was able to repay the loan successfully. 

She has requested a new loan from GDMPC recently to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides to improve her farm. She is hopefully waiting to have an abundant harvest this cropping to be able to help the entire family live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Elsa Violeta

texts.es:
Elsa Violeta tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña y frutales, a una hora con cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de de aves de corral patos, gallinas y pavos en la parte posterior a su domicilio, con los ingresos que recibe contribuye con los gastos familiares.

Es una mujer emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para compara alimentos balanceados para tener una mejor producción y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elsa Violeta is 44 years old, lives with her husband and their children in the Nueva Arica district, whose population largely works growing sugarcane and fruit trees.  She lives about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo along the northern coast of Peru.

Elsa works raising birds such as ducks, chickens, and turkeys in the backyard of her house.  She uses the money that she makes to help with the household expenses.

She is an ambitious woman and has asked for 1,000 sols to buy wholesome feed for her animals so as to achieve greater yield.  In this way, she will earn more income for her family.

loans.use: buy wholesome feed.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as a creative person. He operates a retail store where he sells charcoal. He describes his family challenge to be lack of water for domestic use. 

He will use the KES 6,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 39-years-old and married with four children.

Aileen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shampoo, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Aileen has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Aileen aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like shampoo, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Rose Elizai

texts.en:
Rose has been a client of Finance South Sudan for over 3 years now. She learned about Finance South Sudan from other clients. She is 45 years of age and married with 6 children, 2 of whom go to school. Rose is a business lady who has a retail shop that sells mixed goods like bar soaps, powder soaps, toothbrushes, sewing threads and many other mixed goods. She has been doing this business for over 7 years now.

Rose is borrowing an amount worth 4000 South Sudanese Pounds to enable her buy more goods for the shop. The loan will also enable her pay for school fees and medication for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like, bar soaps, powder soaps and toothbrushes

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married with four school going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rehema has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta tiene 46 años, está casada con Leonardo de 51 años y tiene 2 hijos que vivien con ella en su casa hecha a base de adobe. Jacinta tiene una tienda de productos comestibles, en estos años ha logrado establecer su negocio como un buen sustento para su economía familiar. A base de la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y demás comestibles ha logrado convertirse en una vecina muy conocida además de entablar muy buenas amistades. El tema del transporte desde la ciudad hasta su localidad es un tema algo complicado puesto que genera el incremento de los productos que expende. Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan a la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble esperando mejorar de esa manera la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.  Para esta ocasión requiere contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería consistente en sacos de arroz, azúcar, fideos y panetones.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 46 years old. She is married to Leonardo, who is 51 years old, and they have two children who live with them in their home, which is made of adobe.

Jacinta owns a grocery store. In the past few years, she has established her business as a good way to financially support her family. By selling primary products like rice, sugar, and other edible goods, she has become one a very well-known neighbor and has initiated many good friendships.

The topic of transportation from the city to her town is fairly complicated since it increases the products that she sells.

Her long-term goals are to build her home with better quality materials to improve her family's quality of life. 

This is her third loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she receives to move forward. She also promises to make her repayments on time. This time, she requests a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase merchandise like bags of rice, sugar, noodles, and panetons (a type of sweet bread).

loans.use: to purchase edible products like rice, sugar, noodles, and paneton (sweet bread).

loans.name: Ana Gricelda

texts.es: Ana de 44 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 13 años, 11 años y 10 años de edad. Ana se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hermosas hamacas. Junto a su compañero de vida quien es agricultor mantiene la economía de su hogar y dan a sus hijos lo necesario. En la actualidad no cuenta con el servicio de agua potable y esto le dificulta ya que tienen que salir de su casa a la cantarera comunal para acarrear el agua a su casa desde muy temprano incluyendo en esta actividad sus hijos . Con el deseo de cambiar esta situación solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la conexión del vital líquido y para la construcción de una pila para la cual necesita comprar ladrillo, cemento y arena.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and their three children, who are 13, 11, and 10 years old. Ana works making and selling beautiful hammocks. Along with her partner, who is a farmer, she supports her household and provides her children with what they need.

She currently does not have access to potable water at home. This creates difficulties because the family, including the children, has to go out to the communal water source and then carry water back home, starting in the very early morning. Ana wishes to change this situation, and it is for this reason that she is requesting this loan from FUSAI. She will invest in a connection to a water supply and in the construction of a concrete water basin. She needs to purchase bricks, cement and sand for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand to build a water basin and get potable water.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel vive con su esposo en casa propia, él se dedica a la venta de refrescos, lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela pues es un producto muy vendible, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, miguel esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fruta, azúcar, hielo, bolsas, etc. para poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias y así darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Miguel lives with his wife life in their own home. He works selling soft drinks, which he sells itinerantly through the different neighborhoods near his home. He has many clients as his products are in high demand. With the earnings he makes from his sales, he is able to support some of his family's living expenses. 

Miguel is asking for this loan to buy fruit, sugar, ice and bags, in order to continue his work. This will allow him to continue generating the income that will allow his family some economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, ice, bags, etc.

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es: Milagro de 49 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia, ella posee un molino desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela principalmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas pues ahí llegan a moler el maíz para elaborarlas ya que ella es una persona muy amable y responsable, adicional a eso también vende tortillas  Don Pedro solicita un crédito para poder comprar cuchillas, discos y todas las herramientas necesarias para tener un buen molino y así seguir con su trabajo para darles el sustento diario a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Milagro, 49 years old, is a single mother who lives in her own home. She owns a mill that she has had for many years, and her many clients are mainly women who make tortillas. They use her mill to grind the corn that goes into the tortillas. Milagro is a very nice and responsible person. She also sells tortillas. 

This loan is being asked for for the purchase of knives, disks, and other tools that are necessary to keep the mill sharp and working properly. This will allow Milagro to continue her work and give her family the support that they need.

loans.use: to buy knives, disks and other necessary tools

loans.name: Loy .p

texts.en:
Loy P. is 35 years old, and she lives in the town of Bulenga in the region of Kampala North in Uganda. She is married, with three children, two of them in school. 

For the past two years, Loy P. has been working hard to manage her hardware store, which sell house construction materials. 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more house construction materials, and it will help Loy P. generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. 

Loy P. hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business and become the biggest supplier in town. 

She is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Loy P.  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more house construction materials

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Agrupación 24 De Mayo. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive don Ramón, tiene  49 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, dos mayores y una de 6 años que estudia en escuela y es la única que aun vive con ellos. Su mujer es comerciante. 
El señor Ramón para ganarse la vida y para que no le falte nada a su familia se dedica al comercio al igual que su mujer, mientras que el vende queso en un pequeño local en el mercado su esposa vende caramelos y dulces en las afueras de un colegio de la localidad, el trabaja de jueves a domingo en este lugar ya que es cuando más ventas realiza mientras que su mujer en las mañanas de lunes a viernes , el lleva más de 8 años en este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar queso, dulces y golosinas para el negocio de la mujer. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 ciclos  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los  créditos. Sus sueños seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the district of Rocafuerte, the members of the communal bank "Agrupación 24 De Mayo" meet every fifteen days. This region is known for the delicious sweets that its residents prepare, which are recognized around the country. 

Ramón, 49 years old, is in a relationship from which he has three children - two of whom are grown and one of whom is six years old and in school. The youngest is the only one that lives with him and his partner. His partner works as a saleswoman, selling sweets and candies outside of a local high school. 

In order to earn his living and support his family with all that they need, Ramón also works selling food. He sells cheese from a small market stall where he works from Thursday to Sunday, during which time his sales are greatest. He has worked this business for 8 years, which has allowed him to get ahead in life. 

The loan that he is currently asking for will be used to buy cheese and sweets for his business and that of his partner. He has been part of this lending group for five loan cycles, and is very grateful for the loans he has received. His dream is to continue to run and grow his business.

loans.use: to buy cheese and sweets

loans.name: Dilia María

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Agrupación 24 De Mayo. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Dilia, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo  tres hijos pero uno de ellos  falleció y los dos que tiene tienen 5 y 1 años de edad, el mayor estudian en escuela. El marido es policía. 
Doña Dilia hace varios años aprendió belleza en un centro artesanal en la localidad y con todo eso que aprendió ella realiza trabajos de cortes de cabellos, tinturados y pintado de uñas,  realiza trabajos en su casa y a domicilio aunque más le agrada salir a domicilio ya que así ella cobra un poco mas por su trabajo, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar esmaltes de uñas, cepillos y tijeras que necesita para su trabajo. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
In the district of Rocafuerte, the communal bank group "Agrupación 24 De Mayo" meets every fifteen days. Rocafuerte is known for the delicious sweets that its residents prepare, which are recognized throughout the country. 

Dilia, 23 years old, lives in Rocafuerte and is a member of this lending group. She is in a relationship from which she has had three children. One unfortunately passed away, but the other two are 1 and 5 years old. The 5 year old studies in school. Dilia's husband is a policeman. 

Many years ago Dilia learned beauty skills from a center near her home, and she has now learned how to cut hair, dye hair, and paint nails. She does this work from her home and also travels to other people's homes, which she likes because it gets her out of her house and allows her to charge a bit more for her work. She has been working as a beautician for 7 years, which is how she has been able to help support her family. 

The loan that she is asking for is to buy nail polish, brushes, and scissors that she needs for her work. She has been a part of this communal bank group since its beginning, and she enjoys being a part of it because of the help that she has received from these loans. Her dream is to one day have her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, brushes, and scissors

loans.name: Ma. Magdalina

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalina is a married woman and a mother of two children from Panglao, Bohol. With her husband, she runs a small eatery or restaurant. They have been operating their business for several years now. This is their source of income. 

Ma. Magdalina is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy ingredients like fish, pork, beef, chicken, soft drinks, and three sacks of rice. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more food, augmenting her income and profit. Ma. Magdalina hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, pork, beef, chicken, soft drinks, and three sacks of rice

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is a single man and an entrepreneur who runs a business buying and selling in his community to earn a living. He sells home use products and cosmetics, earning well so he can fund his daily living. He also saves a portion of his profit for future emergencies. 

He joined GDMPC and took a loan to purchase additional goods and cosmetic products to resell. He plans to become a distributor in his village to earn more income and so to get a better living.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods and cosmetic products to resell.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan lives in the village of Enokavan, which is  in theTavush region. 

As he used to be, he is still engaged in animal breeding: cows, calves, and sheep. He is married, and he has three school-age sons, so all his efforts and working night and day are just for providing his children with good living conditions. 

The income from his farming is from the sale of milk and meat, both mutton and beef. Stepan’s previous loan from Kiva helped him plant his next crop and buy food for his animals.

This time he asks a loan of AMD 1,000,000 to buy large shipments of animal feed and also some piglets.

loans.use: to buy large shipments of animal feed and also some piglets

loans.name: Altise

texts.en: Altise started out her business with EarthSpark clean energy products by selling solar light bulbs and charcoal efficient stoves on a rent to own basis in her community.   Her business has since expanded and she has around 200 customers who have already earned property of goods rented.  Now she is coming to us for her fifth loan, in order to satisfy more demands and work to have more revenue to help pay her son's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is a 32-year-old married man from a small village in Khelvachauri district. He has a large family: his wife, daughter, parents, sister, brother are his family. The family have a plot of agricultural land, where mandarin trees are grown. The harvested mandarins are sold to local retailers. In addition they have a cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. His sister trades clothes. 

As their income is not enough for such a large family Besik decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start-up loan is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo and enables him to get a loan of $ 5,000 to purchase car spare parts to begin trading. The income of the family will increase and Besik will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to begin trading second-hand car spare parts.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, 37, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Kandal Stoeng district. She has four children, all of whom are dependents on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working as a garment worker while her husband is a tuk tuk driver. The current business earns them about US$18 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the second micro-loan for Sophal with VisionFund. She has successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her to improve her living conditions. Now she is applying for another loan to pay for her son’s tuition fees in the faculty of English Literature. She hopes that her son will have a special skill for a long term income which will support the family.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fees.

loans.name: Buena Vista De Oquendo Group

texts.es: El grupo “BUENA VISTA DE OQUENDO”  está  integrado  por 06 socios todos con diferentes negocios. Luzdina, es una de las socias ella tiene 52 años es casada con 3 hijos que siguen estudios superiores. Luzdina  es la tesorera del grupo, está feliz porque gracias a los préstamos recibidos ha mejorado su negocio ya que   una bodega que inicio hace 8 años  durante todo ese tiempo su negocio ha progresado enormemente, siendo  uno de los más requeridos por sus vecinos y personas quienes le compran productos de primera necesidad. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos de abarrotes sobretodo leche, azúcar y menestras. Su mayor sueño en la vida es agrandar su negocio y seguir trabajando para apoyar a su familia. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por este préstamo. Luzdina es la 2da de la izquierda viste casaca ploma con rayas blancas , en la foto adjunta aparece la Srta. Sandy.
texts.en:
The lending group “BUENA VISTA DE OQUENDO” is made up of 6 members, all of whom have different business. Luzdina, one of the members, is 52 years old and married with three children who are in school.
