Luzdina is the Treasurer of this lending group, and is very happy because thanks to the loans she has received she has been able to improve her business - a small grocery store which she opened 8 years ago. During the past 8 years, her business has progressed enormously, and is now one of the best attended shops by her neighbors. 

The loan that she is currently asking for will be invested in the purchase of groceries such as milk, sugar and grains. Her greatest dream is to grow her business so she can continue to support her family. This lending group is very grateful for KIVA investors and this loan. Luzdina is the second borrower on the left dressed in the grey pullover with white stripes. Sandy is the group member who appears in the separate foto.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Rosa Doris

texts.es:
Rosa Doris tiene 32 años de edad vive junto a su esposo e hijo en Niepos una zona rural de San Miguel, su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y gaseosas, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar abarrotes para colocar una bodega, haciendo crecer su negocio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Doris is 32 years old and lives with her husband and son in Niepos, a rural area of San Miguel. This region is situated two hours away from the city of Cajamarca, in the northern sierra of Peru, and its residents are mostly dedicated to agriculture and livestock. 

Rosa Doris works selling beer and sodas from her home. She is currently asking for a 2,000 soles loan to buy groceries to stock the business, as she would like to expand it to offer more products. She would like to grow her business in order to generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Agrupación 24 De Mayo. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 55 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tienen cinco hijos,  4 de ellos ya mayores de edad, el menor tiene 15 años y  estudia en colegio.
Doña Mariana con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de sabanas, edredones y fundas de almohadas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. Ella también elabora deliciosos dulces y ricos manjares de leche los mismos que entrega en su casa a comerciantes y personas que quieren probar sus dulces que son los más deliciosos del lugar,  son más de 20 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante ella con su hijo menor. 
Este crédito es para  comprar sabanas, edredones y víveres necesarios para preparar los dulces.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the district of Rocafuerte, the communal bank group "Agrupación 24 De Mayo" meets every fifteen days. This region is known for the delicious sweets that its residents produce, which are recognized around the country. 

Mariana, one of the group members, is 55 years old. Her husband died many years ago, but with him she had five children. Four of them are now grown, and the youngest is 15 years old and still in high school. 

Mariana works selling sheets, comforters, and pillow cases, which she does so she can earn money to support herself and provide for her home. She sells these products door to door. She also makes sweets and delicious caramels, which she distributes from her home to various salespeople who will sell for her or to individuals who want to try her sweets (which are known for being the most delicious in her area). She has been doing this for over 20 years, which has helped her to raise her youngest son. 

The loan that she is currently asking for is to buy sheets and comforters, as well as to buy the provisions she needs to make her sweets. She has been a member of this communal bank group since it was started, and is grateful for the continuous help she receives with her loans. Her dream is to give her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy sheets, comforters, and provisions to make sweets

loans.name: Veronica Lizbeth

texts.es:
Verónica Lizbeth tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales resaltando el mango entre ellos, comercio en general a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella brinda el servicio de fotografías, gigantografías para distintos eventos y ocasiones es muy conocida en la zona son pocas las personas que se dedican a esta actividad.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar una nueva cámara fotográfica digital y de esta manera tener una mejor resolución y calidad de imágenes, brindando así un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Verónica Lizbeth is 26  years old. She lives in the district of Buenos Aires. Most of the residents of this area make a living by growing fruit trees. Mango is one of the main fruits grown. The residents also make a living in general commerce. The district is located two hours from the city of Piura on Perú's northern coast.

She provides photography services and enlarged posters for special events and occasions. She is very well-known in the zone because few people provide this service.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase a new digital camera so that her photos will be higher in resolution and quality and so that she can provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a digital camera.

loans.name: Yhandira Maria

texts.es: La Señora Yhandira tiene 24 años tiene una hija de 4 años de edad,  se dedica a la venta y atención de un frial, en el que se venden embutidos, salchichas, aderezos, pollo, huevos, etc. que se encuentran en zona villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es el primero que ha tomado de con la institución,  La Señora Yhandira va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una heladera para la refrigeración de los pollos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para esta compra que mucha falta le hace en el trabajo, la Señora Yhandira es una mujer muy fuerte enfrenta muchos retos uno es que  es madre soltera se hace cargo sola del mantenimiento de su hija de 4 años, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mercadería para surtir su frial.
texts.en: Yhandira is 24 and has a 4 year old daughter. She sells and performs customer service work from a butcher shop in which she sells meats, sausages, seasonings, chicken, eggs, and more in the Villa Fatima area of the city of La Paz. This is her first loan taken from this institution. Yhandira will use this loan to buy a refrigerator for cooling chickens. Her reason to apply for this loan is the lack of cash for purchases that she very much needs at work. Yhandira is a very strong woman who faces many challenges. One is that she is a single mother who is solely responsible for supporting her four year old daughter. She will use the profits for buy more merchandise to stock her butcher shop.

loans.use: to invest in a refrigerator for her butcher shop's chickens.

loans.name: Aubourg

texts.en: Aubourg lives in Port-au-Prince with his family.  He is interested in selling Earthspark products because he knows the importance of clean energy in a country like Haiti.  Aubourg is married and has one daughter.  He is an accountant, and he used to sell these kinds of products on his own, but because of economic issues and lack of access to credit he had to stop.  He considers finding Earthspark as an opportunity to go on with his dream.  He does not have a business right now but because of his network, he is able to sell the Earthspark products very quickly.  He wants to get more stock from Earthspark so he can help his environment, as he was doing before.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Al-Rday Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Rday. It is made up of four women from Hodeida, Yemen. They are hard-working and enterprising.

Yasmeen is the group's leader. She is 22 years old and married, with one daughter. 

She has had a business selling new perfumes and clothes for two years. One of Yasmeen's goals is to continue to grow her business. Since she has professional experience in this field, she has attracted more customers, which has helped her husband support their family by continuing successfully running it and made the business more profitable. 

She is using her share of the loan to invest in her business, by buying more perfumes and clothes and reselling them to her customers. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business so that she can increase her revenue. 

She hopes to earn large profits so that she can improve her savings in order to obtain a big loan and further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes and clothes for resale

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
From a small village near Nablus called Tubas, Ibtisam is a 40-year-old married mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband has worked as a farmer for many years, but his income is not stable due to variations in crop quality and market demand. He therefore opened a restaurant three years ago to supplement his income, and he now has many  loyal customers. 

Ibtisam requested a USD loan from FATEN to help her husband buy more food for his restaurant. This loan will enable Ibtisam to develop his business and  increase his productivity. 

Ibtisam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo shown working in his restaurant.

loans.use: to  help her husband buy more food for his restaurant

loans.name: Beatriz Monserrate

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Agrupación 24 De Mayo. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Beatriz, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un  hijo de  8 años de edad el mismo que estudia en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Beatriz con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y bisutería, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, parte de este crédito ella lo va a utilizar para poner piso de concreto en su casa ya que actualmente el piso es de tierra y con el crédito espera terminar lo que le falta para mejorar su hogar y así cuando sus clientes lleguen estén en un lugar más adecuado. Lleva 5 años que se dedica al comercio con el cual cada vez mejora su calidad de vida.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, bisutería y materiales de construcción. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con sus ganancias cada vez mejora su hogar. Sus sueños es terminar por completo su hogar
texts.en:
In the region of Rocafuerte, the members of the communal bank "Agrupación 24 De Mayo" meet every fifteen days. Rocafuerte is known for the delicious sweets its residents prepare, which are recognized throughout the country. 

Beatriz, one of the group members, is 23 years old. She is married and has an 8 year old son who is in school. Her husband works as a driver.

Beatriz works selling clothes and all kinds of accessories in order to earn her own income and help support her family's needs. She sells her merchandise door to door, and also sells goods from her house where her clients will go to make their purchases. Part of the loan she is asking for will be used to put a concrete floor in her home (it is currently made of dirt), so that her clients have a better experience when they come to her home. She has had this business for 5 years, and it has allowed her to slowly improve her quality of life. 

With the remaining money from the loan, Beatriz will buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and costume jewelry. She has been a member of this communal bank group since it started, and she appreciates the help that she has been provided. Her dream is to continue improving her home and one day to finish it.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, costume jewelry and construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive con la abuela,  desde hace varios años se dedica a la reparación de escapes y radiadores  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en las afueras de  la carretera pues es un lugar con mucho paso vehicular, por esa razón posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo ayuda en los gastos de su casa, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas radiadores y materiales para el taller ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi podrá atender mejor a sus clientes y podrá obtener mejores ganancias para seguir ayudando en su casa.
texts.en:
This borrower lives with his grandmother. For numerous years he has worked repairing car valves and radiators, which he does on the outskirts of the highway as this is where there is a lot of vehicular traffic. He has a lot of clients, and with the income that he earns he is able to support his living expenses. 

This borrower is asking for this loan to buy more radiators and other materials he needs for his shop. This is the only source of income that he has, and by being able to better attend his clients he will be able to improve his earnings and continue helping out at home.

loans.use: to buy more radiators and materials for his shop

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is married and the mother of three children.  She is from Panglao, Bohol.

She is engaged in the food-vending business, selling home-cooked foods to the people in her place. This is her source of income.

For now, Mauricia is in need of additional capital to further improve her business. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, and seasoning. 

With this, she will be able to cook more foods and sell them, thus increasing her sales and  income. In the future, Mauricia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, and seasoning

loans.name: José Candido

texts.es:
José de 62 años de edad,  estudio hasta segundo grado, comenta que por la situación económica que pasaba su familia no logro que sus padres lo mandaran más a la escuela. Es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ellos tienen 5 hijos pero ya están adultos y casados, solo conviven con ellos 2 nietos de 12 y 10 años, que están a cargo en su hogar y actualmente están  estudiando en la escuela.   

   
José se ha dedicado toda su vida, a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos, desde que estaba pequeño sus padres le enseñaron este oficio, como era una alternativa de sustento económico para su familia.  Por tal razón, decidió dedicarse los trabajos de la agricultura. Aparte de dedicarse a la agricultura, también se dedica a los trabajos de jornalero, donde es otro pequeño ingreso que le genera a su familia y para llegar a su lugar de trabajo tiene que caminar 2 kilómetros o 30 minutos. Él también recibe el apoyo de su familia e hijos para desarrollarlos. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para la recolección de las semillas cultivadas (maíz, frijol),  transporte y almacenamiento esto le permitirá tener una mejor semilla, sin el peligro de perdida y tener una mayor porción de maíz y frijol para el resto del año. Él tenía el peligro de perder la cosecha, si no la recolectaba a tiempo; pero eso no fue así todo  gracias al crédito.

En un futuro, desea una mejor calidad de vida, una mejor casa, mejores cultivos un mejor trabajo para él y sus hijos, ver a su nietos crecer y que sigan estudiando y sean personas de bien en la sociedad, todo esto gracias al crédito que el solicito y que tiene la esperanza de superarse con este crédito y futuros créditos que sacara para trabajar en sus cultivos y poderlos ampliar y probablemente poder exportarlos.
texts.en:
José is 62 years old and has a second grade education. He tells us that because of his family's poor economic situation, as a child his parents could no longer afford to send him to school. He is married, and his wife works in the home. They have five children who are all married adults, but he and his wife live with two grandchildren (10 and 12 years old) who they are in charge of taking care of. Both of these children are in school. 

José has worked in agriculture his whole life, planting basic grains, which he learned to do from his parents when he was little in order to help sustain the family economically. He continues this work to this day. In addition to agriculture, he also works as a day laborer, to support his family with additional income. To get to his jobs he has to walk 2 kilometers, which takes him 30 minutes. He receives help from his family and children with his crops. 

The loan that he is asking for is to collect his corn and bean harvests, and transfer the seeds and store them in a place where they will be kept safe. This will allow him to have a better quality seed and ensure a greater production of corn and beans for the rest of the year. He was in danger of losing his harvest if he didn't collect the seeds on time, but thanks to the loan he has received he is ok. 

In the future, José wishes to improve his quality of life by having a better house. He will improve his harvests and provide a better standard of living for his children and grandchildren. He wants to watch them grow, continue to study, and be the people that society needs. He hopes that this loan will help him to get ahead, and that future loans he receives will allow him to grow his harvests and possibly even export them.

loans.use: to collect his corn and been harvests, and to transport and store the seeds which will permit a better quality of seed for the next planting, in order to have more corn and beans for the rest of the year

loans.name: Walter Jheovan

texts.es: Walter vive en casa propia con su esposa, el tiene un puesto de comida ubicado en el parque que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Es un hombre muy responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Cuenta con la satisfacción de tener clientela fija ya que está ubicado en un lugar muy transitado. Walter desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y asa obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Walter and his wife live in their own home. Walter has a food stall located in the plaza near where lives. With the income that he earns from his business, he is able to support the expenses of his home. Walter is a very responsible man and will work hard to provide his family with everything they need to survive. He has the satisfaction of having many regular clients, since his stall is located in an area that many people pass by each day. 

Walter wishes to make his business larger, and to do so will buy more tables and chairs to seat people as well as ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc. to vary his menu. He hopes that this will help him increase his earnings, which is why he approached Apoyo Integral for this loan. This will enable him to improve his economic stability.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom, 36 years old, lives in the town of Kyengera in the region of Kampala west in Uganda. A married father of three children, one of whom is in school, Tom has been working hard to manage his timber shop business, which deals in carpentry and woodwork, for the past 10 years. 

To help expand his business, Tom has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more wood for both carpentry and resale. This will help Tom to generate greater profits that will pay school fees for his child and improve the family's standard of living. Tom hopes that in the future he will be able to become a leading producer/supplier of wood in the town. 

Tom is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Tom who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more wood for carpentry and resale.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the region of Kampala West in Uganda. He is married and has two children. One of the children is currently in school. For the past 10 years, Christopher has been working hard to manage his piggery business, which deals in pork meat and pigs. 

To help expand his business, Christopher has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more pigs for pork meat and piglets to sell, and this will help Christopher to generate greater profits and pay for school fees and medication for his child. Christopher hopes that in the future he will become the leading distributor in pork. 

Christopher is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christopher who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for pork meat and piglets to sell

loans.name: Ida Del Rosario

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Agrupación 24 De Mayo. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Ida, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos, dos mayores y dos de 10 y 8 años de edad, tres de ellos estudian universidad y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es conserje en una escuela.
Doña Ida para ayudarle a su marido y sobre todo a sus hijos con los gastos que generan sus estudios, se dedica a preparar dulces de muchos sabores y colores los cuales son muy solicitados por personas de todas partes del país ya que son muy típicos del lugar y con un sabor delicioso, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en la terminal terrestre de Portoviejo por lo cual sus ventas son muy buenas ya que al lugar asisten personas de todas partes del país cuando viajan a sus lugares de residencia. Ella lleva más de 20 años con su actividad con la cual ayuda a su familia a vivir mejor.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los dulces. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque siempre le ayudan para salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the region of Rocafuerte, the communal bank group "Agrupación 24 De Mayo" meets every fifteen days. Rocafuerte is known for the delicious sweets that its residents prepare, which are recognized throughout the country. 

Ida, one of the members of this lending group, is 46 years old, married, and has four children - two who are grown, one who is 10 years old, and one who is 8 years old. The older children study at university and the youngest are still in school. Ida's husband works as janitor in a school.

In order to help her husband and especially her children with their school expenses, Ida works preparing sweets of different colors and flavors. These sweets are in high demand by people all over the country, as they are very typical of her region and have a delicious flavor. She has a small stall in the Portoviejo bus station from which she sells her sweets, and business is very good as people from all parts of the country are always passing by. Ida has ben making these sweets for over 20 years, which has helped her to support her family so they can live better. 

The loan that she is asking for is to buy provisions to make her sweets. This is the third loan cycle she has participated in with this lending group, and she appreciates the help it has provided her so far. Her dream is to provide the best education to all of her children.

loans.use: to buy provisions to make sweets

loans.name: Carlos Ivan

texts.es: Carlos de 31 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de yuca desde hace 2 años, adicional a eso trabaja de albañil, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa de un familiar con su esposa quien le ayuda en la comercialización de los productos y sus dos hijos de 7 y 1 año de edad, Carlos está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos  necesarios como: abonos, controles de plagas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. y asi seguir  con sus cultivos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos, 31 years old, works in agriculture, specifically growing yuca. He has been doing this for the past two years, and sells his goods in different markets located near his home. Additionally, he works as a carpenter. Through these activities, he is able to support his home expenses. He lives in his family's home with his wife, who helps him sell his goods, and their two children who are 1 and 7 years old. 

Carlos is asking for this loan in order to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide to protect his crops, and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide and herbicide

loans.name: Glenda Giomar

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso que se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Glenda, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad que aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer profesional.
Doña Glenda es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Garden y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene seis años que se dedica a esta actividad que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y productos naturales. Esta desde hace 6 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio creciendo día a día.
texts.en:
The Bienestar and Progreso (Wellbeing and Progress) Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Colorado, which is in the Montecristi canton. It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for the artisan crafts that are recognized nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous Panama hats.

This is where Glenda lives. She is 52 years old, married, and has three older children who still live at home. Her husband is a driver. Glenda is a stay at home mother but, in order to earn her own income, she sells Garden natural products, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She goes from door to door three days per week. She sells on cash and credit, and delivers her products every fifteen days.

She has been doing this for six years, and she started the business with the first loan that she received from the communal bank.

She will use this loan to purchase perfume, cream, cosmetics, and natural products. She has been a member of this communal bank for six years and enjoys it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to move forward with her business and grow daily.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, cream, cosmetics, and natural products.

loans.name: Edilma

texts.es: Edilma, a sus 56 años se dedica a trabajar como empleada de servicios domésticos en diferentes casas de familia pero, para complementar sus ingresos, también se dedica a vender productos por catálogo desde hace 8 años, de esta manera genera los recursos económicos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica de su hogar y para sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos.  Su empuje, empeño y fortaleza la motivan para solicitar un crédito con el interés de comprar surtido al por mayor (galletería, chocolatería, cosméticos, perfumería, calzado, accesorios, entre otros productos de catálogo), así tendrá más variedad de productos disponibles para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de fin de año que se aproxima, logrando así, mejorar las ventas y la entrada de dinero para su familia.  Edilma sueña con poder continuar con su negocio, haciendo de éste una actividad más rentable y sostenible en el tiempo para que en un futuro le permita disfrutar de una vejez tranquila y sin preocupaciones, mejorar la calidad de vida y disfrutar al lado de su familia de un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Edlima, at 56 years old, makes a living as domestic staff in different family homes. To complement her income, she has also sold products via a catalog for 8 years. In this way she makes enough income to help her husband out with the household expenses and to help get her five children ahead.

Her drive, effort, and strength have motivated her to request a loan with the intention of buying a variety of wholesale items such as sweets, chocolate, cosmetics, perfumes, shoes, accessories, and others catalog products. This way she will have a greater variety of products available to satisfy the demand that increases at the end of the year, which is nearing. She will achieve better sales and more income for her family.

Edlima dreams of continuing with her business and making it more profitable and sustainable with time so that in the future she can enjoy a peaceful retirement without worries, she can improve her quality of life, and she can enjoy well being alongside her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale items such as sweets, chocolate, cosmetics, perfumes, shoes, accessories, and others catalog products.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y comercio, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de leña para braseros, es conocido en la zona por la labor que realiza, también se dedica al cultivo de mango.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para cultivo de su finca y de esta manera tener una mejor `producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Manuel is 51 years old and lives in the district of Buenos Aires, two hours from the city of Piura along the northern coast of Peru. This region is known for its agricultural and commercial activities, and is characterized by its forests full of carob trees. 

Manuel works selling firewood for wood stoves, and he is known in this region for his work. He also cultivates mangos. 

Manuel has asked for a 1,000 soles loan in order to buy fertilizer to cultivate his mango crops, and thereby have a better production to offer his clients.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for mango trees

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo tiene 39 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus padres en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, trasladando a sus clientes a las zonas aledañas a su comunidad, su esposa vende dulces que ella misma prepara en los colegios del distrito.

Gonzalo ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo, de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio de una manera segura.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is 39 years old and lives with his wife and their parents in the district of Cayalti. Cayalti is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, along the northern coast of Peru, and is known for its agricultural and commercial activities. 

Gonzalo works providing transportation in his mototaxi, transporting clients around the farthest neighborhoods of this community. His wife sells sweets that she prepares herself to neighboring schools. 

Gonzalo has asked for a 1,000 soles loan in order to maintain his vehicle. This way he will be able to continue providing his clients with safe service.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Ergash

texts.ru: Эргаш позитивный и трудолюбивый мужчина. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Эргаш сотрудничает с Арванд с 2010 года.  Эргаш в своё время смог получить высшее образование, но сейчас не может найти хорошую работу по своей специальности. Его жена не работает, она является домохозяйкой, заботиться и ухаживает за детьми. Поэтому, чтобы иметь хороший заработок, которого будет достаточно на удовлетворение всех имеющихся нужд семьи, Эргаш занимается собственным бизнесом. Он занимается животноводством. Откармливает и продаёт скот. Он недавно начал данный бизнес, поэтому по сей день старается его расширять, чтобы получать больше дохода. Его два старших сына также помогают своему отцу. Они находятся на заработках в России и каждый месяц стараются присылать денежные средства своим родителям. Эргаш  надеется, что его бизнес поможет улучшить экономическое положении его семьи. Поэтому Эргаш обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку несколько голов скота для развития своего бизнеса. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Ergash is a positive and hardworking man. He is married with four children and has been working with Arvand since 2010. Ergash has a higher education but is not able to find a good job in his field. His wife doesn't work outside the home, but takes care of their home and children. Therefore, in order to have a good income that will be sufficient to cover all of his family's needs, Ergash runs his own business in animal husbandry, fattening and selling cattle. He began the business not long ago and is now working on expanding it to increase revenue. His two older sons also help out - they are working as migrant labourers in Russia and every month try to send money to their parents. 

Ergash hopes that his business will help him improve his family's financial situation. Therefore he has turned to Arvand to request a loan to purchase several head of cattle to develop his business. He hopes for a favourable result and thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Kuña Aty Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Aty Rory está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ellas está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Yrma, quien también hace la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Ella es modista y comenta que hace todo tipo de confecciones y que así se hizo de muy buena clientela y que ha crecido bastante. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos variados, para poder seguir con su trabajo, mejorando sus ingresos y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: This group called Kuña Aty Rory is in their first cycle of the "committee of women" program, in which each of them are putting in their best. They are part of the elimination of poverty project and all members are doing the survey of poverty elimination. One of the members is Yrma who has also taken the elimination of poverty survey to help her family though her work. She is a dressmaker and mentions that she makes all kinds of apparel. She has gotten a very good clientele and has grown considerably. She is a very hardworking person and a fighter. She has requested this loan to invest in the purchase of various fabrics and threads to continue her work to improve her revenue and help her family.

loans.use: to purchase various fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 26-year-old single man, who works in the transportation business. He specializes in transporting new cars, and those that have mechanical problems, from one place to another.

Ali is responsible for supporting one member of his family, which forces him to work harder to increase his income and develop his living.

Ali is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for a new driving license, which allows him to legally drive bigger trucks. This will help him to increase his business and income in a well-managed way.

He hopes to expand his work and open a wider transportation company in the future.

loans.use: To pay for a new driving license which allows him drive bigger trucks

loans.name: Ernesto Porfidio

texts.es: A sus 63 años de edad Ernesto no se cansa de trabajar puesto que cada año cultiva 3 manzanas de maíz y frijol, de esta forma mantiene a su familia ya que una parte la deja para el consumo y la otra la pone a la venta. Habita en casa muy humilde pero propia junto a su esposa e hijos. Desea dar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales por lo que ha tomado la decisión de reconstruir las paredes de su vivienda las cuales están hechas a base de lodo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo calavera, cemento, arena y hierro para construir las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en: Ernesto is 63 years old, doesn’t tire from working and each year raises three plots of corn and beans.  He supports his family by keeping some of the harvest for their consumption and selling the rest.  He lives in a humble home but one that is his own, along with his wife and children.  He wants to provide better living conditions for his family by rebuilding the walls of his house.  The current ones are made from mud.  He is asking for a loan, through FUSAI, to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron bars, to build the walls.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La Señora Filomena tiene 53  años y es casada con  hijos de las edades de 20 y 23 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa de segunda mano en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la populosa feria de la 16 de Julio ,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Señora Filomena va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción, para la construcción de un cuarto en su casa y así tener ella más comodidad,  la Señora Filomena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas personas  que se dedican a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería por fardos ella va a comprar hasta la Ciudad de Oruro ya que ahí venden por mayor,  se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Filomena is 53 years old, married, and has two children who are 20 and 23 years old. She works selling second-hand clothing from a post she has in the busy market "16 de Julio". This loan is her first with the institution, and she wishes to use it to buy construction materials to add a room to her house. This will make her living space much more comfortable. 

Filomena faces many challenges with her business, such as competition from other people who work selling second-hand clothing. She is going to use her earnings to continue buying bundles of clothes, and she will even go to the city of Oruro where the clothes are sold in bulk. She is very grateful and happy for the opportunity that this loan provides.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Ochgerel

texts.en:
Ochgerel is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband works at a local company part-time. Her older daughter is 16 and a local school student. Her younger daughter goes to kindergarten. 

Ochgerel has been taking care of her younger daughter since she was born and is now starting her business of clothing retail business. She has experience and taste in clothes. She is now requesting loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase clothing inventories to sell at her rental booth in the local market.

loans.use: to purchase clothing inventories to sell at her rental booth in local market

loans.name: Rafael Andrés

texts.es: Rafael, es un joven emprendedor de 24 años de edad, que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una cafetería y salsamentaría que inició luego de haber trabajado con su madre vendiendo tamales y comercializando cerdos por kilos, gracias a esas labores pudo ahorrar y montar su propio establecimiento. Su espíritu de progreso y su pujanza le han permitido llevar a cabo sus proyectos y los ha logrado, obteniendo muy buenos resultados y, con los ingresos que recibe, apoya a su madre con la carga económica del hogar. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, mecato, alimentos fritos, cerveza, entre otros), eso le permite tener variedad de productos disponibles para satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, mejorando notablemente la entrada de dinero que destina para los gastos del hogar. Rafael sólo desea fortalecer y acreditar bien su microempresa, poder generar mejores oportunidades de empleo y así poder gerenciar su propia actividad para disfrutar los frutos de su labor en un futuro a mediano plazo.
texts.en:
Rafael, 24, is a young entrepreneur who works in his own business, a cafeteria and deli that he started after having worked with his mother selling tamales and selling pigs by the kilo.  Thanks to these activities he was able to save up and set up his own establishment.  His spirit of progress and drive have allowed him to carry out his projects and he’s attained them getting very good results. He uses income earned to help his mother with household expenses.

He’s asking for a loan to buy stock at wholesale (soft-drinks, packaged snacks, fried foods and beer, among others) which will make it possible for him to have a variety of products available to satisfy customer wants and needs thereby significantly improving income that will be earmarked for household expenses.

Rafael only wants to strengthen and make his micro business well-known to generate employment opportunities and manage his own enterprise to enjoy the fruits of his labors in the medium run.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a woman and the mother of a three-year-old daughter. She is from Bohol, Philippines. For some time, Jenelyn has run a cell phone reloading business that provides her with the income that she needs. She is a hardworking woman willing to give her best for her family. 

Currently, Jenelyn needs a loan for her business. She is requesting a loan to buy additional electronic reloads for her cell phone business. Jenelyn hopes to make her business a success someday.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic reloads for her cell phone business

loans.name: Benter

texts.en: Benter is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as an honest person. She operates a retail stall where she sells water, juices etc. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation challenges. She will use the KES 13,900 loan to buy a gas cooker to enable her family to cook efficiently. Her business goal is to start a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Daniel Maligie's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from the city of Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. Together, they have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 19,100,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) in order to meet their most immediate and pressing financial needs. Some will use this loan to buy a plot of land for the future construction of a dwelling house, some will use it to buy house building materials, and others will use the loan to invest in business and to pay school fees for their children. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Daniel, who is pictured on the left, is the featured leader of this team of teachers. He was born in the city of Makeni 43 years ago. He is married to a tailor, and the couple has seven children who are attending primary, secondary and tertiary academic institutions. Daniel is a school teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 14 years. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to pay school/college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school/college fees for his children

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo has been engaged in charcoal sales for more than three years. This is the source of his income. He is a married man, has four children and lives in Corella, Bohol. Danilo is asking for a loan to buy more coconut shells for making charcoal.

Through this, he will be able to augment his income and improve his business. Danilo hopes to repay his loan on time, to expand his business in the future, and to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells for making charcoal

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is married with four children, all of whom attend school, which is the reason of her hard work. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Mbeyu has operated a cafe business making consumables like rice, tea, beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as a major challenge.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase a stock of goods including maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business

loans.name: Hallala

texts.en:
Hallala is a 41-year-old mother of four from southern Israel. She was taken out of school after ninth grade but has always been determined to learn and gain skills. Hallala began taking part in a local women’s forum, and through the forum she learned crochet, sewing and jewelry making. She has worked with KIEDF gaining basic business management skills and developed her microenterprise. Hallala took small loans in the past to open and manage her business, always paying back on time. She now needs to expand further and upgrade some of her materials and equipment.

Hallala needed this loan to purchase a sewing machine, specialized equipment, beads, string, wool and other materials.

Hallala’s husband supports her work and believes she is developing a good business, adding to their family’s income. Hallala wants to continue to strengthen her business and provide for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine, specialized equipment, beads, string, wool and other materials.

loans.name: Medelina Emmanuel

texts.en:
Medelina is 29 years of age and a married mother of one child. She knew about Finance South Sudan through another client. She is a business lady who runs a tailoring shop. She has been in this business for four years and has employed two more employees to help her in the work.

Medelina is borrowing a loan worth 3,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSP) to enable her buy more cloth material for making clothes and also more sewing thread.

She plans to pay the loan through her sales profits. The loan will also enable her to pay her employees and buy food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and sewing thread

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Этой молодой женщине 31 год. Ее зовут Наргис. Она замужем. Наргис домохозяйка, она нигде не работает, но очень хочет открыть свой маленький бизнес и стать успешной бизнес леди. Она хочет работать в сфере торговли кондитерских изделий. Наргис решила взять кредит и на сумму от кредита приобретет кондитерские мучные изделия для продажи. Продажа готовой еды, десерта и других продуктов питания на базарах и рынках пользуются большим спросом. Наргис уже успела арендовать точку на базаре и надеется, что в скором времени приступить к работе. Ей будет активно помогать ее мама. Наргис верит, что сможет добиться своей поставленной цели и реализовать задуманное. Наргис очень нуждается в помощи.
texts.en: This young woman is 31 years old.  Her name is Nargis, and she is married.  Nargis is a homemaker and does not work, but really wants to open her own small business and become a successful businesswoman.  She wants to work by selling confections.  Nargis decided to take out a loan and use the money from the loan to purchase confectionery products for sale.  The selling of prepared food, desserts, and other food products in bazaars and markets is very popular.  Nargis has already rented a stall at the bazaar and hopes that she will be able to work soon.  Her mom will be very active in helping her.  Nargis believes that she can achieve her goals and realize all that she has imagined.  Nargis is in much need of assistance.

loans.use: to purchase confectionary products and to establish a business to sell sweets

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the region of Kampala North in Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her salon business, which deals in hair dressing and the sale of braids.

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more braids to sell, and will help Florence to generate greater profits to take care of her children. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to start another business venture.

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more braids to sell

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a 25-year-old single man who is responsible for earning the living of two members of his family. He works selling car spare parts such as car lights, mirrors and many other requested items. He is working hard to keep his business updated and capable of meeting to most of his customers' needs.

Hamza is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with newly released audio systems which are requested by most of his customers. He is sure that they will increase his income and develop his business.

Hamza is well known in his region with his good reputation and hard work. He is working hard to develop his business as much as he can to make sure that he can meet most of his customers' and his family's needs.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with newly released audio systems

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is from the village of Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He operates a general store for a living. For more than ten years in the business, Elmer was able to provide the needs of his four children and the entire family as well. 

In 2010, Elmer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. His previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. He requests a new loan to purchase grocery goods to sell. In the future, he wants to improve the family's general living standard.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
This is Yan. She permanently lives with family in Kampong Thom province. She is now 48 years old and a loving mother of six children, two of whom are married and live independently. Yan has dedicated herself to a farming business, from which she is able to earn approximately KHR 20,000 per day. Her focus crop is rice, which she grows once a year. She has been in this occupation for nearly 25 years and her experience enables her to follow good farming practices and develop a productive business.

Now Yan would like to acquire a loan in the amount of KHR 1,500,000 to buy a piece of land which is sold at a cheaper price. She plans to use this land for housing purposes in the future when she has enough money to make this possible. She expresses her thanks to all kind lenders, who have contributed their funds to allow her to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a piece land for housing purposes.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is a married woman and a mother of three grown-up children. She is from Bohol, Philippines. She has been enaged in a poultry business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of her income.

Generosa is in need of additional capital for the expansion of her business and so is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy animal feed for her poultry.

Generosa dreams of improving her enterprise to generate more income to finance some of the family's expenses, such as food and to pay for the bills.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Kimhour

texts.en:
Kimhour is 29 years old and married. She doesn’t have any children yet and hopes to have one soon. 

She pays much attention to a rice farming business because it’s a main source of income for the family. She also has a small position at a garment factory after she finishes collecting her harvest in the middle of November. Through her effort, she is able to earn approximately KHR 10,000 per day.

Kimhour would like to borrow a loan in the amount of KHR 2,000,000 to buy a motorcycle for the household. In the past, she used to have a motorcycle, but it was too old and unsafe for her family. 

Thanks to all kind lenders for their constant support towards her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for the household.

loans.name: Elinda

texts.en: Elinda is 61 years old, married and the mother of six children who range in age from 31 years to 42 years old. She describes herself as a God-fearing, self-reliant and loving person. She operates a farm where she grows crops and keeps livestock. Elinda says the biggest challenge her family faces is its lack of money to buy a water tank. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan she is requesting here to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future the availability of water will improve her family's living standards. This is her first loan request with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank.

loans.name: Hernan Ismael

texts.es:
Hernán Ismael tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales y granos, comercio y transporte, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda el servicio de transporte en su propia mototaxi, llevando a sus clientes a los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad, también se dedica al comercio de fruta de estación.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar fruta y luego comercializarlo en los mercados de la zona, generándole ingresos adicionales para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hernán Ismael is thirty years old. He lives in the district of Buenos Aires where the people work in industries such as trade, transportation, and the cultivation of grains and fruit trees. It's a community that's known for its haurango forests. It is located on the northern coast of Peru, two hours away from the city of Piura. 
He provides transportation services in an auto rickshaw that he owns, taking passengers to the nearby villages of his community. He also sells seasonal fruit.
He has applied for a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to buy fruit to sell at area markets to earn additional income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell at an area market.

loans.name: A`ahood Group

texts.en:
This group is called A`ahood and is composed of four ladies. They applied for a loan of 140,000 Yemeni Rials (YER). Na`ama lives in Hodeida, Yemen. She is 27 years old and married. She has been selling clothes, perfumes and incense for ladies. She is a professional in this field, and her goods are sought after in the market. 

Na'ama started her business with little capital. She is applying for a loan of 40,000 YER to buy clothes, perfumes and incense for her business. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business and improve the living standards of the family. Her dream is to expand her business in order to sell a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes and incense for her business.

loans.name: Stephen John

texts.en:
Stephen is 30 years of age and married with three children. Two of the children go to school. He learned about Finance South Sudan through friends. He is a businessman who runs a pharmacy in Yei Town, South Sudan. His pharmacy sells different kinds of drugs like painkillers, syrups and ointments. He hopes that after a period of time he will be able to open more branches and even turn his pharmacy into a medical center.

Stephen is borrowing a loan worth 3000 South Sudanese Pounds to enable him to buy more drugs in the pharmacy and expand it. The loan will also enable him to pay school fees and buy food for his family.

loans.use: To buy more medicines such as pain killers, syrups, and ointments

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru: Дилмурод 25-летний молодой человек, занимающийся в своем селе города Конибодом скотоводством. Дилмурод женат и имеет двоих сыновей. Он со своей семьей живет у родителей. Дилмурод вместе с женой разводят коров и бычков в течение 6 лет. Им также помогает отец. А мать занимается торговлей и на местном рынке продает ткани. Дилмурод одновременно работает мастером, предоставляющим услуги по ремонту домов. Сейчас в их хозяйстве осталось считанное количество скота. Поэтому Дилмурод обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить бычка и увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Dilmurod is a 25 year-old young man who works in animal husbandry in his city, Konibodom.  Dilmurod is married and has two sons.  He and his family live with his parents.  Dilmurod and his wife have been breeding cows and bulls for 6 years.  His father also helps them, and his mom sells fabric at the local market.  At the same time Dilmurod works to repair homes.  Dilmurod is now considering the number of cattle in his care and for this reason has asked for a loan in order to purchase bulls to increase his livestock.

loans.use: to purchase and raise cattle

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 47 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the  region of Kampala North in Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 11 years, Francis has been working hard to manage his poultry farm where he sells chickens and eggs. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more birds for egg production, and will help Francis to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his poultry business into a bigger farm. 

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more birds for egg production

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is 52 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the  region of Kampala North in  Uganda. She is married and has four children, with three of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Jalia has been working hard to manage her stationery shop, which deals in photocopying items and selling exercise books. 

To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more machines and exercise books to sell and will help Jalia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Jalia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Jalia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jalia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more machines and exercise books to sell

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 22-year-old single man who has been running his mobile phones-selling shop since 2010. Hassan is a hard worker who puts so much effort into developing his business.

He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with newly released items and to make necessary decoration to his shop to keep it attractive to new customers.

This is his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good standing in paying-back history. His previous loan was invested in increasing his business merchandise with newly released mobile phone accessories.

He is working hard on expanding his business to keep it a good source of income.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with newly released items and to make necessary decoration to his shop.

loans.name: Oumran

texts.en: Oumran is a 28-year-old married father with one child. His coffee shop is located in a very special region in his village, in which there is no competition. The shop belonged to his dad and opened 19 years ago. Oumran has made many needed changes to it, including redecorating and upgrading most of the machines, equipment, chairs and tables. He also added "Hookas" (or bubble pipes) which helped attract new customers and increased his income.  He is requesting a youth loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to buy more items to sell and pay for medication he needs. He hopes to improve his business and open a bigger cafe in the future.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell and pay for medication.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun, aged 36, is an industrious farmer from Kampong Thom province. She has a life partner in her husband who works in the same career. Together they have been blessed with two children, both of whom are attending local primary school. Hun has one hectare and a half of farmland, where she manages to grow rice and cassava to sell. She also works as a paid laborer for additional income. Through her hardships, she is able to earn a normal income of $5 per day on average.

Hun, with her non-stop ambition of wanting to develop her farming business, aims to buy a piece of land to enlarge her farming area and thereby increase her productivity. Due to her shortage of money, she is asking for a loan in the sum of 1,500 US dollars to buy a piece of land for farming purposes. She hopes that the loan will be granted to enable her to further develop her business and is very grateful to all lenders.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for farming purposes.

loans.name: Year

texts.en:
Year is 77 years old and a widowed woman. She currently lives with her children in a rural village of Kampong Thom province. To earn a living, Year is in two business ventures: farming rice and selling Khmer natural medicine. She usually buys the medicine from local suppliers, whose medicines are reliable, and retails the medicine in the local markets and through her region door to door. This business earns her approximately KHR 40,000 per day, which she uses for her daily meals and other commodity costs. She has been in this business for years and has a lot of clients who are using her medicine.

Currently, Year needs working capital to invest into her current business, but she has insufficient money. For this reason, she is asking for a loan in the amount of KHR 3,000,000 to buy natural medicines to sell. This loan will help her to sustain her business and make a consistent income for the household. She thanks lenders for their generosity and goodwill toward poor people like her in improving their business as well as living conditions.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan is a resident living in Prasat Bakong district, a rural part of Siem Reap province. She is engaged in a farming business, primarily growing rice. She has more than one hectare of farmland, where she manages to grow rice once a year. Having been in the business for years, she is able to earn a normal income of $5 per day. She is now 49 years old and married with five children.

At this time, Nan needs to hire laborers to help her harvest and thresh her rice crop, but she has insufficient capital to pay for labor costs. That’s why she is asking for a loan in the sum of KHR 1,600,000 from HKL, one of Kiva partners. This loan will allow her to harvest her rice crop at the right time. She hopes to have an abundant harvest this year. She thanks lenders in advance for the support.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help her harvest and thresh her rice crop.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as a very ambitious person. She operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. 

Eunice describes her family's challenge as living in a place where it hardly rains. She will use the KES 6,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family's living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Paruyr

texts.en: Paruyr lives in Gavar city in Armenia's Gegharkunik region. He has a large family: his wife and their two children as well as his mother and his brother. For several years, he lived and worked in the Russian Federation, where he had a job that provided for his family financially. Now Paruyr and his family work as farmers and have six cows, two heifers and two calves. The family lives on the income it receives from the sale of farm products such as milk, butter, cheese and meat. Paruyr is requesting a loan for 800,000 Armenian drams to enlarge his herd by buying two more cows.

loans.use: to buy two more cows in order to enlarge his farm and earn a good profit

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
Ephraim is a farmer in Nyamizi-Kiyaga-Bumbeire  Bushenyi District and he started farming in 2006 with the  purpose of having a source of income to cater for the needs of his family. He works six days a week and he works twelve hours each day. He works hard on the farm so that he can get enough money to educate his children to the required education standards.

 In an effort to increase his income, he also sells milk to the people around and this gives him additional income which he uses pay school fees for his children. Ephraim’s clients are mainly coffee traders in the area and he says they have supported him so much since they offer a ready market. He has applied for a  loan  of 1,500,000 shillings so that he can buy fertilizers and mulch, all in a bid to improve the fertility of the soil so that he can harvest a lot and hence get increased profits. He is mainly faced with a challenge of stiff competition which he believes can be overcome with better quality coffee which he hopes to get after using fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and mulch

loans.name: Micheal Oliver

texts.en:
Michael is 32 years of age, a married father of two children; one of the children goes to school. He came to know about Finance South Sudan through his friends. He is a businessman who owns a general store that sells items such as milk powder, sugar, salt, flour, and many other retail goods in Yei Town, South Sudan. He has been in this business for close to five years and hopes to open up some shop outlets outside Yei Town.

Michael  is borrowing a loan worth 4000 South Sudanese Pounds to enable him to buy more stock and expand his shop. The loan will also enable him to pay school fees for his child and buy food for his family.

loans.use: to buy goods like powdered milk, sugar, tea leaves, salt and many other mixed goods

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en:
Khachik is 20 years old and lives in Gavar city, which is in the Gegharkunik region. He lives with his parents, sister and retired grandmother. His father sells car spare parts, and his mother works at the orphanage as a mentor. 

Both Khachik and his sister are students, but it does not impede this young man from being engaged in beekeeping. He has 62 beehives. Since Khachik is seriously interested in beekeeping, he reads a lot and asks advice from the people who are already skilled in this activity. Despite his young age, he manages to have very tasty honey of a high quality, which he sells with the help of re-sellers.

Khachik is requesting a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams in order to increase the number of his beehives.

loans.use: to buy more bee hives in order to increase his beekeeping.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit and her family live in Vanadzor city, which is in Armenia's Lori region. She is 56 years old, married and has a daughter who is employed as a journalist. Anahit has received a lot of education and works as a teacher of mathematics. She is much respected in her school and has great experience acquired during 37 years of teaching. She also gives paid private math courses in her home, where she prepares pupils for entrance examinations. She is requesting a loan for 600,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and furnish her work room so that she can work comfortably with her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer and furnish her work room in order to work comfortably with her pupils

loans.name: Andresa

texts.es:
La señora Andresa está casada con Dario desde hace 25 años, tiene dos hijos, uno de 24 años y otro de 16.
Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir desde hace 15 años. Se inicio en el ramo de la venta ambulante debido a la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia, y hoy gracias al trabajo que ella y su marido de manera conjunta hicieron, pudieron criar a jóvenes de bien.
Comenta que ya tiene una clientela formada y que el préstamo que pide a la Fundación Paraguaya y a kiva lo quiere para invertirlo en la compra de jeans, prendas para criaturas, prendas para damas etc, y de esa forma cumplir con todos los pedido de sus clientes. En un futuro quiere seguir ampliando su casa mediante sus ganancias de las ventas y de esa forma tener mayor comodidad e ir ampliando también su clientela todo esto  con la ayuda de Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Sra. Andresa has been married to Dario for 25 years. They have two children, one aged 24 and the other 16. Andresa has earned her living selling clothing for 15 years. She started this work because of the need to help her family get ahead, and today thanks to her and Darii's work together they have brought up two lovely children.

Andresa has a regular clientele. The loan she is seeking from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva will be used to buy jeans, children's and women's clothing etc. and in this way respond to her customers' requests. In the future Andresa wishes to continue expanding her house using the profits from her business to make it more comfortable. She also wishes to grow her business--all with help from Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: Buy jeans and children's and women's clothing

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 51-year-old married father of six children, who has been working as a baker for ten years. He is a hard worker, well known in his region with his good reputation and special products served.

Khaled is specialized in making 'manakish' and special pastries requested by most of his customers. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to continue building his son's house. He wants to make sure that each one of his children will make a small happy family, because he believes that he has to help them in building their future house.

Khaled hopes to stay in good health so as to stay capable of supporting his family as much as he can.

loans.use: To continue building his son's house

loans.name: Kampala Group

texts.en: Adventina, who is in her early 50s, is a widow with three children, one grown and two still in school. She earns a living by selling porridge mix, which she makes from maize, millet, ground nuts and flour. People buy her mix and add water to make a kind of porridge that is normally served to children and people who are sick. She has been in this business for five years and works from 6.00 am to 4.00 pm daily. She earns a small monthly profit and is requesting her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make more mix to sell. She dreams of being an international business woman. Adventina will share this loan with her group, Kampala, which has 11 members who will hold each other accountable for making payments.

loans.use: to buy millet, ground nuts, maize grains, and flour for making porridge mix.

loans.name: Rodas Paz Liler Diovin

texts.es:
Liler Diovin tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en Sorronto Bajo una zona rural de Oyotun, su población se dedica al cultivo de maíz, yuca y arroz, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Con la ayudad de su esposa se dedican a la crianza de animales menores pollos, pavos y cerdos, El se dedica a brindar servicio de labores agrícolas.

Diovin ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Liler Diovin is 32 years old and lives with his wife en the Sorronta Bajo, a rural area of Oyotun. The people here make a living growing corn, cassava and rice. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo along the northern coast of Peru. 

With his wife's help, he raises small animals like chickens, turkeys and pigs. He also provides his services as a farm worker. Diovin has requested a loan from Edpyme  Alternative for 1,000 nuevos soles to buy animal feed for a greater amount of meat to offer his customers so that he can generate greater earnings for his family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti runs a small stall which sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits, and processes bill payments. Siti lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area three hours from Jakarta. She is married and has children.

Siti began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. 

She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, she has had around $30 - $35 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

Recently, she took a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to buy a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Rizal

texts.en:
Rizal runs a small stall which sells mobile accesories, mobile phone airtime credits, and processes bill payments. Rizal lives in Bandung,  a semi-urban area three hours from Jakarta.  Rizal is single.

Rizal began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and serving bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last  month, he has around $ 10 - 15 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, he took a loan from KIVA to get a printer  to support his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payment (household electricity payments).

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en: Eleonora earns a living through selling charcoal. She also makes rice cakes to earn extra income. Eleonora is a married woman with a three-year-old child. She does her best to take care of her family and help provide for their basic needs. She requested a loan to buy more coconut shells, vinegar and ingredients to make rice cakes. She plans to renovate their house in the future. Moreover, she wants to save money for future schooling of her son.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells used in making charcoal

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio tiene 57 años y está Casado con la señora Catalina tienen juntos tres hijas, ellas ya grandes y que son personas de bien gracias al esfuerzo de ambos, y también al buen ejemplo que siempre han sido.
El señor Antonio tiene una despensa en su casa y también un tambo donde vende Leche, por medio de estos trabajos sigue ayudando a su familia pese a toda adversidad.

  Solicita el crédito para poder surtir su despensa de más productos  para poder satisfacer la demanda de su zona, como ser carne, bebidas, gaseosas y demás. Agradece a la fundación paraguaya y kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Antonio is 57 and is married to Catalina. They have three grown-up daughters who are all good people, thanks to the efforts of their parents and to the positive example they have always set.

Antonio has a food-store in his house and he also owns a small dairy farm where he sells milk. Through these jobs he continues to help his family in spite of adversity.

In order to satisfy demand in his area, Antonio is asking for this loan to supply his store with more products such as meat, soft drinks, fizzy drinks and other items. He is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva for this opportunity, which will be of great help to him.

loans.use: to buy meat, soft drinks, fizzy drinks and other things for his food-store..

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula, de 54 años es una mujer sencilla.
