loans.use: to purchase more containers, thus aiding her to increase sales.

loans.name: Louisza

texts.en:
Louisa is single and has no child.  After successfully graduating from senior high school, she is now an established businesswoman. 

She sells cosmetics for a living at Yabiw (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about six years. 

As a single person, Louisa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cosmetics, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Louisa plans to diversify the products she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Nectali

texts.es: Nectali, tiene 22 años de edad, esta soltero y vive en el municipio de Gracias, Lempira junto a su madre. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de tajaditas de platanos y chicharras. Hace 1 año que realiza la actividad de prestar el servicio de mototaxi para transporte de personas de un lugar a otro dentro de la comunidad y sus alrededores. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 8,000 Lempiras para compra de repuestos para su mototaxi. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su unidad de transporte y asi podra brindar un mejor servicio al cliente.Su meta es mejorar su vivienda y poder poner un negocio de verduras, para obtener mas ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nectali is 22 years old, single, and lives in the city of Gracias in Lempira Department with his mother. He worked previously selling  fried plantains and pork rinds, but has been driving a mototaxi for the past year. Nectali takes passengers from around Gracias and neighboring towns. 

Nectali has applied for a loan of 8,000 Lempiras to purchase spare parts for his mototaxi. This investment will improve his vehicle and allow him to provide better service to his customers. Nectali's goal is to make improvements to his house so that he'll be able to set up a vegetable shop in his home. Operating this shop will boost Nectali's income and help him to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the repair of his moto taxi.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old  and married.  She has six children, with ages ranging from 10 years to 25 years. She describes herself as humble and generous. 

She operates a farm where she grows crops to sell to earn a living. 

She describes her family challenge to be a lack of money to buy a water tank and traveling long distance to fetch water. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

She hopes that in the future, the water tank will improve living standards of her family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank for use at home

loans.name: Florisa

texts.en:
Florisa is married and the mother of  two young children, from Bohol, Philippines. 

Florisa operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells basic commodities, like canned goods, soft drinks, and noodles. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, condiments and detergents. 

With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her store, thus attracting more buyers.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods,  noodles, soda and beverages, condiments, and detergents

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 39 years old and married.  She has been running a business making footballs (soccer balls) for the past five years. Her husband is a laborer and does not earn enough to support his family alone.  Razia is the motivated mother of eight and tries to provide them with good-quality food, education, and clothing. 

By this time Razia is famous in her town for providing good-quality footballs. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market.

For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business-development officer for a loan of PKR 25,000. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantities to cater to more customers without delay. She is hopeful of getting an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. 

She dreams of expanding her business and wishes to use it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantities.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 50-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 14 years to 21 years. She describes herself as social. 

She operates a farm where she grows crops and keeps livestock. She describes her family challenges to be a lack of sufficient capital to purchase a water tank and traveling long distances to fetch water. She will use the KSh 15,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

She hopes that in the future, availability of water will save time and improve the standard of living of her family.This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.es:
Wilfrido es de la ciudad de Pilar, se dedica al comercio, donde tiene una casa de venta de repuesto de motos, donde vende todo tipo de repuesto de motos accesorios y lubricante, tiene ya una buena clientela a pesar de que hace un poco más de 1 año que  está en el rubro.
Es una persona joven y trabajadora que está luchando por salir adelante, es por eso que está agradecido por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, de que la fundación paraguaya y kiva apuesten en el y en su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de repuestos para motos, ya que quiere surtir su stock de productos y así seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Wilfrido is from the city of Pilar. He works in commerce. He has a shop where he sells motorcycle parts. He sells every type of part for motorcycles, accessories, and lubricants. He already has a good clientele, in spite of the fact that he has been in this business a little more than a year.

He is a young, hard-working person who is striving to advance. It is for this reason that he is grateful for this opportunity that he is receiving, in which Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva have confidence in him and in his work.

He is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of parts for motorcycles, since he wants to stock his supply of products and thus continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Dinora Elena

texts.es: Dinora de 29 años de edad  se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa desde hace 3 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo  logran cubrir algunos gasto de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad,  Dinora está solicitando un crédito para  la compra de mas mercadería y poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dinora, 29, has had a business selling shoes and clothing for 3 years.  Her business is run from her house, and it is her means of work.  With this business, and the help of her husband, they manage to cover the household expenses.  She lives in her own home with her husband and two children, aged 9 and 3.  Dinora is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise so that she can continue to work, because this is her only source of income.  This way she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes at wholesale

loans.name: Norah Patricia

texts.es: La señora Norah, tiene 41 años tiene dos hijos,  ella se dedica a la venta y cosméticos, por catálogo de una línea de productos nueva, ella vende visitando instituciones públicas y privada de la ciudad ofreciendo su productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Norah  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de cosméticos  al por mayor que se encuentran en promoción ya que tiene muchos pedidos por estas fiestas de fin de año,  la señora Norah a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es  poder abastecerse  de variedad de  producto ya que tiene mucha venta y es donde tiene que aprovechar para así tener más ingresos económicos, es una persona muy trabajadora ya que también es promotora de productos de belleza tiene personas a su cargo que se encargan de vender estos productos.
texts.en: Norah, 41, has two children. She works by selling cosmetics from a catalogue with a new product line. She visits public and private institutions in the city to offer her products for sale. This is her first loan cycle with this institution. Norah is going to use this loan to buy wholesale cosmetics, which are on special offer since she has many orders for the holiday season at the end of the year. She will use her profits to keep improving her business. She wants to stock up her business with a variety of products because she has a lot of sales and she has to take advantage of this to make better income. She is a hard-working person who also promotes beauty products. She is in charge of others who also sell beauty products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale.

loans.name: Ghida Group

texts.en:
This group, called Ghida, consists of 4 ladies. They have been working hard so that their businesses will provide them with the money they need to improve their own living conditions as well as those of their families. They live in Hodeida, Yemen.  

Fatima is 21 years old. She is a very hardworking person who has fought hard for a long time in order to get her family ahead in life. She sells many types of goods such as perfumes and incense. When her dad died, she started her business to provide her family. She has managed to attract a large number of customers. As a result, she enjoys very good sales. 

She is looking for a loan of 30,000 YER so that she can buy incense and perfume to meet the high level of demand that she has for her products. This will enable her to keep making progress in her business and she will be able to make the income she needs to support her household.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfume to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 56-year-old married woman; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier income. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La Sra. Virgina, es casada, tiene una hija mayor y dos nietos. Vive junto con su marido, tienen una despensa hace 15 años, y comenta que empezó este emprendimiento después de haber estado en el rubro de venta de ropa, luego de unos años, varios de sus clientes empezaron a dejar de pagarles en fecha y esto los llevo a quebrar económicamente, posterior a eso y con un pequeño capital prestado de un familiar, la señora invierte en compra de productos varios como arroz, aceite, azucar, leche, huevo y otras de primera necesidad para revenderlos en el barrio. Como les fue bien alquiló un salón cerca de su casa y siguió con su despensa. Gracias a este negocio pudo llegar a hacerle terminar a su única hija la facultad, ahora la hija es licenciada.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de aceite, azúcar, huevo, golosinas, tortas, jabón en polvo, suavizantes, etc. Con lo que podrá seguir con sus ventas y así seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes una buena variedad de productos.
texts.en: Señora Virginia is married. She has an adult daughter and two grandchildren. She lives with her husband. They have had a store for 15 years, and she comments that she began this undertaking after having been in clothing sales. After some years, a number of her customers stopped paying them on time, and this brought them to economic failure. After that, and with a little capital lent by a relative, Señora Virginia invested in the purchase of various products such as rice, oil, sugar, milk, eggs, and other basic necessities to resell them in her neighborhood. As this went well for them, she rented a space near their house and continued with their store. Thanks to this business, she was able to have her daughter complete her studies. Now her daughter has graduated.  She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of oil, sugar, eggs, candies, cakes, powdered soap, fabric softeners, etc. With these items, she will be able to continue with her sales and thus continue offering her clients a good variety of products.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, eggs, candies, cakes, powdered soap, fabric softeners, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mary Ekua

texts.en:
Mary sells pots and bowls in Yabiw (near Takoradi). She is divorced with five children. She has been in business for two years now. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Mary uses her income to provide for the entire family. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of bowls and pots, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

As a middle school graduate, Mary understands the importance of education in improving social conditions. Thus, she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her five children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of bowls and pots, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been running a business selling milk for the past 4 years. 

She has 2 milk buffaloes and sells milk to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase one more buffalo. 

She hopes to get an increase in the capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Cindy is married to a carpenter. She has two children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. 

As a junior high school graduate, she currently operates a sewing business in Yabiw (near Takoradi). With over five years of experience in this trade, Cindy sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. 

Thus her loan will be used to set up her own shop, indirectly helping her boost her overall sewing business sales. 

Cindy wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her sewing business enterprise.

loans.use: to set up her own shop and boost her overall sewing sales.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married with five children. She has received some schooling (to the end of middle school). Currently, she sells palm oil in Yabiw (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this industry for about twenty years now. Her husband is a security officer. Her income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Agnes will use the loan to buy more palm fruit to process, thus increasing her existing business capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, she plans to develop her business further by venturing into new markets.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruit to process, thus increasing her business capacity.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a small-scale food vendor in Yabiw (near Takoradi). She has had some formal education as a junior high school one leaver. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. 

Rita has been working as a food vendor for close to ten years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of rice, oil, tomatoes, etc., thus allowing her to meet customers’ rising demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of setting up a fast food shop, helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of rice, oil, tomatoes etc. to meet customers' rising demands.

loans.name: Sahiba

texts.en:
Sahiba is 48 years old and married for over 25 years.  She has five children. Now she lives with husband, little daughter, and two sons in the Binaqadi village of the Abseron region. Her other two daughters are married. Her family has been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from the Xodjavand region for 20 years.

Sahiba rents a shop where she sells food products. She has been at this business for five years. 

Today Sahiba is planning to increase her business. She needs AZN 1,500 to buy a fridge for meat and dairy products.

She thanks Komak and the Kiva organization for the loan. In the future she wants to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her shop

loans.name: Maqsooda

texts.en:
Maqsooda is 37 years old and married, the mother of five children. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. 

She has three years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. 

She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. 

She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 42 years old and married.  She has run a business selling milk for many years. She has two buffaloes which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Kousar has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

In order to cope with increasing demand of her customers she requested a loan of PKS 20,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy another buffalo. 

She expects a boost in her earnings through her larger sales and wishes to spend it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana is 27 years old and married, the mother of three children.  

Five years ago she initiated her business of selling milk to contribute to the family income. By this time she has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of the Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.  Currently she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase another cow. 

This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy another cow.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 26-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She has been selling milk with her husband for the past two years. She has one cow and buffalo, which she uses to sell milk to the people of her community. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit.

Shazia has become famous for providing good-quality milk. She makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. She is currently in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. It will help her to purchase one more cow. Shazia is hopeful that this loan will be productive and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Saheen

texts.en: Saheen is a 32-year-old married woman who has been doing hand embroidery for about ten years. She is proud to be famous in her community, as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads.  Her designs are in much demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.  She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy raw materials.  These include large quantities of thread, sequins, and pearls to meet the increasing demand.  This is her third year and she has shown an excellent repayment behavior.  She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use a portion of profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as thread, sequins, and pearls.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 51-year-old married father of three children. He has been selling fresh chicken since 2001. He is a man with a very good reputation in his region and is well known for his special prices.

Mohamad is acquiring his second loan cycle from Al Majmoua. With the loan, he plans to make necessary maintenance on his car and to pay for his son's wedding expenses. Mohamad is very happy that his son is going to get married, which is why he is working hard to help with wedding expenses. He hopes to stay in good health and to provide his family with everything they might need.

loans.use: to pay for car maintenance and for his son's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Chiru

texts.en:
Chiru is married with four children, two in school and two underage. They live in their own house without electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Chiru has operated a fruit and vegetable stall for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors and dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future. With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 43-year-old woman who sells animals as a business. She buys baby goats & calves at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices.  She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She is the mother of seven children and is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, a good education, food, and clothing.  She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses.  For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another calf.  She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market.  With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children. She has been running a business selling milk. 

She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only breadwinner at that point in time. 

With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 35,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her second loan cycle with a good credit history

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Karista

texts.en:
Karista is a 38-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of animal sales and purchases for many years. She buys animals such as baby goats at low prices, brings them up and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; at present she has four goats. Now she requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase two more baby goats. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats

loans.name: Blas

texts.en: Blas is a carpenter from Albur, Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the carpentry business for more than ten years. Blas is requesting a loan to buy materials such as saws, nails, hammers, a measuring tape, and other items. He will use his loan to improve his business and augment his income. In the future, Blas would like to expand his business and explore other business ventures to augment his income.

loans.use: to buy materials such as saws, nails, hammers, a measuring tape, and other items

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She has expertise in embroidery and is using her skill to provide for her family.  

During initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. 

Now, she has requested for another loan worth 30,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase spools of threads along with packets of the latest beads and pearls in different colors. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers consistently. 

She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history. Shakeela wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads along with packets of the latest beads and pearls in different colors

loans.name: Peter Stephen

texts.en:
Peter is a 35-year-old father of 4 children, 3 of whom attend school. He knew about Finance Sudan through staff marketing. He is a businessman who operates a merchandise shop. In his shop he sells different types of household goods, like salt, sugar, rice, soda, water, powdered milk, and many other items. He has been in this business for about 7 years now and has one employee.

Peter is borrowing a loan, worth 3,000 South Sudanese Pounds, to enable him to buy more stock for his shop. He will repay the loan through the business profits. The loan will also enable him to pay school fees, medical fees, and food for his family.

loans.use: to buy items like soda, wheat, sugar, rice, and other household items.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 29-year-old woman who sells animals as a business.  She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices.  She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.  She is a mother of two children, both of whom are attending school.  She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses.  For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for her second loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another calf.  She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market.  With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a widowed woman with five children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that is without electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk from which she sells to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana, age 21, is a young, single lady; she has been running a business of animal sales and purchases for many years to contribute to her family income. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase two more calves. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Eliphaz

texts.en:
Eliphaz is a hardworking cattle trader. He started trading in cattle in 1988 with a purpose of getting a steady source of income. He works seven days in a week, and he also buys and sells hides and skins, which gives him additional income that he uses to buy the required items for his family. His business is located in Igara county in Bushenyi District, and his clients are cattle traders in his home area and nearby places. 

He applied for a loan of 1,500,000 shillings so he can buy cows for trade so that he gets more profits in the month of December, which is a festive season. Lack of enough capital is his major challenge, but he hopes that it will be overcome if he gets the loan. He believes that he will be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 50 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the  region of Mubende in Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past eight years, Lawrence has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells home products. 

To help expand his business, Lawrence has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase his stock through buying more items, and will help Lawrence to generate greater profits and pay his family's bills. Lawrence hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business. 

Lawrence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lawrence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase his stock through buying more items.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 33-year-old single man who is responsible for the living of five members of his family. He has been working in his bakery since 2010, and he is specialized in preparing, baking and selling croissants. He has a very good reputation in his domain with the special taste and ingredients he provides.

Saleh is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to expand his business through opening a new branch that will support him more in providing his family members with all the necessary things.

He is working hard to keep on expanding and developing his business to provide his family with a secured living.

loans.use: to expand his business through opening a new branch of his croissant bakery.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Comfort did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming self-employed. Currently, she sells cooked corn served with groundnuts in Agona, Takoradi. She has been doing this for about 10 years now. She is married to a driver and has one child. Comfort uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize and groundnuts, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Comfort wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that her child is able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize and groundnuts, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 48 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She has eight children between 6 and 20 years old, six of whom live at home and are in school, while the oldest ones are out of high school and living on their own. Her husband is a local businessman. For 15 years she has been selling oil and dried pepper in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil and dried pepper for her business. Her plan is to see all her children in college.

loans.use: to purchase more oil and dried pepper for her business.

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus is 23 years old and single. He does quarry work apart from buying and selling cattle for sale. He has been in business for four years now. His monthly income is 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). He has borrowed a loan to buy more cattle.

He will use the anticipated profits from the business to expand the current business. This is his first loan with KADET LTD.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for sale

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the region of Mubende in Uganda. He is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Nathan has been working hard to manage his garments shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Nathan has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes, and will help Nathan to generate greater profits and pay his family's bills. Nathan hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business. 

Nathan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nathan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Noel Oliver

texts.en:
Noel is 28 years old and a married father of two children. One of the children goes to school. He learned about Finance South Sudan through staff marketing. He is a businessman who runs a retail shop that sells mixed household goods like powdered milk, sugar, soaps, salt and many other household goods. He has been doing this business for about four years now and has employed one staff member to help him. Besides the business, Noel is also employed and earns a monthly salary that gives him additional income.

Noel is borrowing a loan worth 3,000 South Sudanese Pounds to enable him to add to his stock by buying more items like milk, sugar, salt and many other items.

He will repay the loan with business profits. The loan will also help him pay his employee and school fees for his child.

loans.use: to buy items like powdered milk, sugar, soaps, powdered juices and cosmetics.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is married with a 4-year-old child. She lives in Gyumri town with her baby as her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian federation, where he works for being able to sustain his family. Laura has been engaged in the reselling of the cosmetics for already four years. She orders and purchases cosmetics supplies from different firms, and resells them to her local clients. The income from this business is very important for this family, as this way, Laura is able to cover basic costs and help her husband in sustaining the family's living. 

Currently, by applying for this loan, Laura needs to purchase new stock of products for reselling. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan will be a great support for this young woman for increasing the business activity that she is involved in and gathering better income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of products for reselling.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the region of Mubende in Uganda. She is married and has three children; none are currently in school. For the past three years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her salon business, which deals in hairdressing and sells cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and increase sales. Juliet hopes that in the future, she will be able to have a bigger salon. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Juliet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is married and has three children; two in school and one underage. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women, and curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella, a married mother of four from Embu, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She is married to Samuel, who is a mason. Their children are aged 18, 14, 10 and 8, respectively. She also sells second-hand clothes to supplement her income. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES [Kenyan shillings], which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her first loan term from KADET LTD after she was introduced by an existing client. With the loan she has applied for from KADET LTD, she will be able to purchase poultry feeds and a dairy cow. Additional income created will allow her to educate her children. 

She hopes to run her business successfully and have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo appreciates her previous loan that enabled her to improve her living standards. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES [Kenyan shillings] to purchase more stock of tomatoes, onions and vegetables for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of tomatoes, onions and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Evgeni

texts.en:
Evgeni, age 29, is from the village of Gorelovka. He is married and lives with his wife, three children and mother. Evgeni, his wife and mother are employed at the local dairy farm as dairy persons and get monthly salaries. The family members work hard, but their earnings are hardly enough for the family of six.

Evgeni is requesting the loan to purchase three milk cows and start his own dairy farm. He will buy a stock of hay as well to feed his livestock in wintertime. The women will make cheese with the received milk, for selling as well as family consumption. Evgeni plans to increase the number of cows in the future and breed them. He hopes his initiative will be lucrative, as he is skillful in farming. 

Evgeni believes that the Kiva loan will be helpful for his family.

loans.use: to purchase three cows and start dairy farming.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia de 38 años, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos. Posee una vivienda construida a base de material noble donde comparte sus vivencias familiares. Al igual que muchas personas en su localidad se inició como agricultora de los productos más rentables de su zona como el cacao orgánico y otros. Años después y por recomendación de sus familiares optó por incursionar en el comercio de abono orgánico. Lleva 6 años en el rubro y desde entonces con el paso de los años ha logrado consolidarlo como un buen negocio gracias a la comercialización de guano de aves y otros fertilizantes. Le agrada su labor puesto que es un trabajo algo más sencillo que el campo pero con mucha entrega de por medio puesto que debe en ocasiones viajar personalmente  a la capital para  supervisar el traslado de su pedido. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 500.00 nuevos soles para contratar una movilidad y realizar el reparto de abono orgánico a los anexos de su localidad.
texts.en:
Antonia is 38 years old, married, and has three children.  She has a house made of solid materials where she lives with her family.  Just like many people in her area, she became a farmer of the most profitable crops, such as organic cacao and other things.  Years later, on her family’s recommendation, she decided to sell compost.  She’s been doing this for six years and since then she has been able add bird guano and other fertilizers, and consolidate it into a good business.

She likes her work because it’s simpler than working in the fields but a bit more difficult because she must personally travel on occasion to the capital city to supervise transportation of her orders.  This will be her second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving.  She also promises to make her payments on time and is asking for 500 Soles to hire a vehicle to deliver compost to local annexes

loans.use: to hire a vehicle.

loans.name: Marío Alfredo

texts.es:
Mario de 35 años de edad, solo estudio hasta el sexto grado, actualmente vive junto a sus compañera de vida y sus tres hijos. Desde hace 10 años, su esposa también se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y andan juntos vendiendo, su  hija mayor estudia segundo grado y el menor todavía no.   

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la venta de casa en casa de controles de televisión, películas, ropa interior;  ya tiene 5 años de estarse dedicando al negocio, trabajo por iniciativa propia, ya que no lograba conseguir trabajo.

El préstamo será utilizado, para la compra de mercadería para comenzar a ampliar el negocio, como ropa interior, camisas de vestir para hombre y mujer, controles de televisión y comprar antenas de televisión.


A futuro quiere, instalar  un negocio fijo, ya que menciona que se siente cansado de los viajes que realiza, de andar vendiendo casa por casa, y que sus hijos se logren superar educativamente y puedan ser todos unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mario is 35 years old and has a sixth grade education.  He lives with his life’s partner and three children.  For the past 10 years his wife have been selling clothing together.  His oldest daughter is in second grade and the youngest does not attend school yet.

He and his wife sell TV remote controls, movies, and undergarments door to door and have been doing this for five years.  He started this on his own initiative because he was not able to find work.

He will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise, such as undergarments, men’s and women’s dress shirts, TV remotes, and TV antennas, to begin expanding his business.

In the future he wants to open a shop because he says that he is tired of the long trips he has to make to sell door to door.  He also wants his children to finish school so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Juan Humberto

texts.es: Juan de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 30 años, comercializa sus productos en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gasto de su hogar, Juan está solicitando un crédito para la compra de trasmallos para poder seguir con su pesca y así poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 53-year-old Juan lives in his own house with his wife and his four children. He has made a living from artisanal fishing for thirty years. He sells his products in the markets near his home. He manages to settle some of his household expenses with the money from his sales. Juan is requesting a loan for purchasing driftnets so he can continue fishing, obtain better profits, and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase driftnets for fishing

loans.name: Denise Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Denise de 28 años no vive con su esposo y mantiene a su hijo de 8 años sola, se dedica a la actividad del comercio, vende envases de plástico y plastoformo. Vive en alquiler y su actividad económica la realiza desde su misma vivienda ya que el depósito de su mercadería se encuentra ahí, ahora solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería ya que para fin de año suben sus ventas y desea cubrir toda la demanda para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Denise is 28 years old. She lives apart from her husband and cares for her 8-year-old son alone. She works in trade, selling plastic and polystyrene containers. She lives in rented accommodation and carries out her business from her home, where she maintains her store of goods. She is seeking this loan in order to buy merchandise, as sales increase over the festive season and she wishes to meet this extra demand and so increase her income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida, 31 years old, is a housewife and lives with her husband Ajij and her two children.  Her husband is a farmer who is 44 years old.  Farida is illiterate and can only sign her name.  Ajij received an education up to class IV (Grade 4). One of their children goes to school and reads in class VIII(Grade 8).  The second one receives no education and does household work.

They live in their own small kachha (mud and straw made) house at West Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri .

Farida, though a housewife, helps her husband in cultivation.  She is a very hard-working woman and works from dawn to dusk for the betterment of her family, yet she is unable to give enough financial support to her family. Then she decided to do something to help her husband in their existing business. She learned about BJS and has taken a loan to buy potato seeds and good quality fertilizers for cultivating potatoes in their own land. She hopes that it will help her to earn more money, since there is a huge demand for potatoes in the local market. The profit generated from this business will enable Farida to give additional financial support to her family.

Farida dreams of giving a good future to her children and upgrade their house to a pacca (brick-built) one.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate potatoes

loans.name: Tafina

texts.en:
Tafina is a woman of 34 years. She is a housewife. She did not receive any education and can only sign her name.  Her husband, Habibul, is 40 years old. He did not complete his primary education. Tafina is blessed with five children. They live at West Magurmari in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. They have their own small kachha (mud and straw made) house.

Four of their children go to school and are in class VIII (Grade 8) , class V (Grade 5) , class III (Grade 1) and class I (Grade 1), respectively. The fifth one is a mason.

Tafina's husband is a farmer. Tafina also helps him in cultivation. It is very difficult for them to earn money to meet the expenses of their family and the educational expenses of their children.  So, Tafina decided to start a business so that their children don't have to leave school, they can have a better lifestyle and they don’t have to go through such a difficult situation. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan, which will enable her to buy a cow and start a business selling milk.

She hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy more cows with the profit earned and make a cowshed near their house.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali is 27 years old.  She is a housewife. She has completed her primary education. Her husband Sanjit, age 29, earns money by driving a cycle-van, which is not his own. It is a rented van. He received an education up to class V (Grade 5). They have two children. Only one of them is receiving an education and in class II (Grade 2).  The other one is only three years old.

They have a small kachha (mud and straw made) house of their own at West Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Her husband's earnings are very low and it is difficult to maintain the family. Both of them decided to buy a van of their own. Anjali learned about BJS and applied for a loan to help her husband to purchase a cycle van. A van is a type of carriage using a bicycle, which usually carries passengers as well as vegetables and bulky items from one place to another.  She hopes that her husband will earn more by driving his own cycle van to carry people and goods since he will not need to pay rent.

Their plan is to buy more cycle vans to use on a hire basis with the profit generated from this income. The profit will also upgrade their financial condition and will help them to give a better education to their children.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for carrying people and goods

loans.name: Tinh's Group

texts.en:
Tinh was born in 1962. She is now living with her family in Bac Ninh. She has three children; all of them have gotten married. Her husband is a construction worker and she is a carpenter. She has done this job for six years and earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is lacking capital to buy wood for doing carpentry. Her dream is to expand her business and have enough money to build a new house. This loan is one of the steps to help her achieve this dream.

Tinh is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She also has a passion for her job. She said that this job is flexible and helps her earn more money to pay for living. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 10,080,000 VND and repaid on time. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 10,976,000 VND to buy wood for carpentry work. She wants to expand her woodshop and save the profits to build a new house.

Other members of Tinh's group include the following:

- Nguyen is 29 years old and has three children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND for doing carpentry.

- Hanh is 30 years old and has three children. She has a grocery store. She wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to do carpentry work.

- Ha is 29 years old and has two children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 10,080,000 VND to do carpentry work.

- Hang is 44 years old and has two children. She sells food to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to sell food.

loans.use: to buy wood for carpentry work.

loans.name: Abdurozik

texts.ru: Абдурозик родился в 1994 года. Он умный и жизнерадостный молодой человек. Абдурозик учится в Национальном Университете Таджикистана. Абдурозик учится на втором курсе в очное отделение. Он после окончания университета будет экономистом, так как он учится в факультете Экономика и финансы. Абдурозик должен оплатить за учебный договор, но его родители не имеют денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abdurozik was born in 1994. He is an intelligent and cheerful young man. Abdurozik studies at the Tajik National University. Abdurozik is in his second year of a full time degree. When he finishes university he will be an economist, since he studies in the faculty of Economics and Finance. Abdurozik must pay his tuition fees but his parents do not have any money. He is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to pay for his fees. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастуре 39 лет. Она опытная портниха. Мастура в течение 7 лет работает в ателье как швея. Она старается предоставить свои услуги на высшем уровне. Мастура общительная женщина и умеет делать индивидуальный подход каждому клиенту. Мастура замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Она заботливая мать и любящая жена. Мастура должна провести свадебное торжество своего ребенка, но не имеет денег. Ее муж тоже не имеет денег. Мастура запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mastura is 39 years old. She is an experienced dressmaker. She has been working in a parlour as a dressmaker for 7 years. She is trying to provide her services at a higher level. Mastura is a sociable woman and is able to take an individual approach to each different client. 

Mastura is married and is raising one child. She is a caring mother and loving wife. Mastura must organise her child's wedding ceremony but she has no money. Her husband also had no money. Mastura is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to organise and pay for the wedding ceremony. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her child's wedding

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Фируза имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она уже много лет работает в средней школе учителем младших классов. Она любит свою профессию и с душой преподает своим ученикам. Она старается дать хорошее образование своим ученикам. Фируза замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ее муж работает в аэропорте. Фируза и ее муж получают маленькую зарплату и не в состоянии купить мебель и улучшить условию домохозяйства. 
Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Firuza has a teaching degree. She has spent many years working in a secondary school as a teacher for the younger years. She loves her profession and  invests her soul in teaching her students. She is trying to give a good education to her students. 

Firuza is married and has 3 children. Her husband works at the airport. Firuza and her husband receive very small wages and are not in a position to buy furniture and improve their living conditions. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to buy furniture. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BEN ont en moyenne  30 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KORO dans le cercle  de SAN   dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de condiments et d’articles divers.
 Apres avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BEN sont à leur 6 eme   prêt solidaire. MATTA 2 eme   femme de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  15 kg de poissons fumés, vingt kg d’oignons, dix kg d’épices (laurié, fiè fiè), deux paniers de tomates, quinze cartons de cube Maggi, des poivrons et des piments.  Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en: The women in BEN Group have an average age of 30 and three children. They all live in traditional, extended families in Koro, in the San area, in the fourth largest administrative region of Mali.  These women know each other through family ties and are in the business of selling condiments and other assorted items.  After fully repaying their prior loans, the women of Ben Group are on their sixth group loan.  Matta, the second woman from left to right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 15 kg of smoked fish, 20 kg of onions, and 10 kg of spices (e.g. laurie, fie fie), 2 baskets of tomatoes, 15 boxes of Maggi cubes, some bell peppers, and some chili peppers.  She stocks up in San. She sells to a clientele of women and men for cash and often for credit.  She plans to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA that will be used to pay for medical expenses, food, clothing, and school fees. The remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Sara Esperanza

texts.es: Sara de 42 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su hijo en casa propia, desde hace 13 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, lo hace de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de sus productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene logra solventar los gasto de su hogar, Sara está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor, y así darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Sara is 42 years old and the single mother of one son.  She lives in a home of her own and has been selling clothing for 13 years on foot in the different markets near her home.  She has many customers because of her good quality products and good prices.  She covers her household expenses this way.  Sara is asking for a loan to buy clothing in quantity so that she can provide for her family without limitation.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Мухаббат сельская женщина в возрасте 40 лет. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. У нее четверо сыновей и одна дочь. Старшему сыну 20 лет и он в данный момент работает в России. Второй сын выпускник школы, а остальные дети еще учатся в школе. Мухаббат является членом дехканского хозяйства. Она в течение 7 лет занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры. Ей помогают муж и дети. Сейчас Мухаббат усердно готовится к зимнему посеву и вспахивает землю. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить семена, минеральные удобрения и топливо. 
Мухаббат построила новый дом и планирует за счет прибыли с деятельности провести ремонт в доме и покрыть крышу дома качественным материалом. Также она хочет женить своего старшего сына.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a village woman of the age of 40. She is married and has five children, four sons and a daughter. The eldest son is 20 years old and he is currently working in Russia. The second son is in graduate school, and the remaining children still go to school. 

Muhabbat is a member of a dekhan farm. For a period of 7 years she has worked with growing agricultural crops. Her husband and children help her. Currently Muhabbat is preparing diligently for winter sowing and is plowing the land. She requests a loan in order to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer and fuel. 

Muhabbat built a new house and plans to carry out repairs on the house and cover the roof with quality materials on account of the income from the business. She also wants to marry away her eldest son.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Takhmuras

texts.ru: Тахмурас житель района Яван. Он начинающий предприниматель. Ему 22 года. Он хочет заниматься продажей корма для домашних скотов. Тахмурас расчетливый молодой человек и успел найти помещение для продажи. Помещение находиться не далеко от дома Тахмураса. Тахмурас планирует закупить корм от завода своего района и перепродать его в своем магазине. Корм для домашних скотов является востребованным для жителей Явана, потому что около половины населения занимаются животноводством. Тахмурасу не хватает средств на сумму 2000$, чтобы совершить покупку корма и открыть свой магазин. Он просит Вас помочь. Тахмурас надеется, что он сможет открыть свой маленький бизнес и в будущем расширить его.
texts.en:
Takhmuras is a resident of the Yavan region. He is an aspiring entrepreneur. He is 22 years old. He would like to work with selling fodder for livestock. Takhmuras is a prudent, young man and managed to find premises for the sale. The premises are not far from Takhmuras' home. 

Takhmuras plans to purchase fodder from a factory in his region and sell it at his store. Fodder for livestock is necessary for the Yavan residents, as around half of the population work with livestock breeding. 

Takhmuras does not have the 2000 dollars he needs to purchase fodder and open his store. He requests your help. Takhmuras hopes that he is able to open his small business and in the future expand it.

loans.use: to start a business of selling fodder for livestock

loans.name: Sani

texts.fr: Sani  est marié à une revendeuse et a des enfants en charge. Pour répondre aux besoins de ces derniers, il exerce comme activité la vente de la viande de bœuf. Avec cette activité, il a remboursé un bon nombre de crédits et sollicite son prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises. Il souhaite à l'avenir développer son activité et assurer une bonne éducation à ses progénitures.
texts.en: Sani is married to a retailer and has dependent children.  To take care of the children's needs, Sani makes his living selling beef. With this business, he has repaid many loans and is asking for another loan to buy more merchandise.  He wishes to expand his business in the future and provide a good education to his offspring.

loans.use: to buy beef.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet used her previous loan to buy groundnuts to sell. She is a hardworking woman with five children and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. Annet deals in produce, and specifically sells groundnuts. She also practices subsistence farming and sometimes sells the surplus, depending on the season. Price fluctuations and limited capital affect her business profits. Her dreams are to own a sustainable food store and to educate her children so they can earn degrees as a minimum qualification. Annet intends to use this loan to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Tujinama Group

texts.fr:
J de Dieu fait partie du groupe  Tujinama et  habite à Cibitoke. Il  a 26 ans et est marié à Emelyne. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant  de 3ans.
Il a sous sa charge 3 membres de sa famille élargie, qui étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de jus de banane   depuis 1 an. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes pour produire beaucoup de litres de vin de banane à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait avoir une boutique comme une deuxième activité et voir ses enfants continuer les études.
texts.en:
J de Dieu is a member of the Tujinama Group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 26-years old and married to Emelyne. Together, they have one 3-year old child.
He is also responsible for three other extended family members who are in school.  J de Dieu has been selling banana juice for one year.

This is his first loan via Turame. With this Kiva loan, he will increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to make many liters of banana wine that he will resell to earn more money.  

In the coming years, he would like to have a store as a second business and see his children continue their schooling.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Fatima 2 está en el  ciclo número 2do del programa de comités de mujeres, donde también forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, haciendo a la vez la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra Mirna quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir, con buenos ingresos, pero el mayor desafío que tiene es poder mantenerlos, ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de las ventas que hace en su propia despensa, está mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
La Sra.  Mirna  Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos varios, como ser verduras, bebidas, carnes, panificados, etc  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fatima 2 group is in its second cycle of the women's committees program, where they also participate in the poverty elimination program, and each complete poverty elimination questionnaires to establish their circumstances.

Mirna is one of the members. In her last questionnaire she identified as having a poverty level of three. This means that she has a good income, but her main challenge is to maintain her income. Through her efforts and continuous hard work, via the sales she makes in her small grocery store, she is improving her and her family's living conditions.

Mirna is seeking this loan in order to buy various products, such as vegetables, beverages, meats, and baked goods, which will help her to realise her business plan, and so improve her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, beverages, meats, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Shohista

texts.ru: Шохиста добрая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 38 лет. Она на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Шохиста как заботливая мать 4 детей 10 лет назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей овощей и фруктов. Ее лавочка находится близко к ее дому. Она покупает оптом с местных жителей и продает в розницу. Шохиста этим бизнесом занимается уже давно и знает все тонкости своего дела. Ее рабочий день начинается рано утром, когда она идет покупать оптом товар из местных жителей, которые занимаются выращиванием овощей и фруктов. Она основная кормилица своих детей и поэтому должна зарабатывать больше денег. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и поэтому обратилась за займом уже 5 цикл. Ранее займы она погасила вовремя. Она запрашивает займ для покупки овощей и фруктов для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shohista is a good and cheerful woman. She is 38 years old and raising four children. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. Shohista, as the loving mother of four children, started her business of selling vegetables and fruit 10 years ago. Her store is close to her home. She purchases wholesale from the local residents and sells them as retail goods. 

Shohista has had this business for a long time already and knows all details of her business. Her working day starts early, when she makes wholesale purchases from the local residents, who work with growing vegetables and fruit. She is the main breadwinner for her children and therefore needs to earn more money. She would like to increase her working capital and therefore applied for a loan five times already. She repaid her previous loans time. 

Shohista requests a loan for purchasing vegetables and fruit for increasing her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase fruit

loans.name: Zaynabjon

texts.ru: Зайнабджон добросовестная женщина. Она живет и работает на севере Таджикистана. Зайнабджон очень любит свою страну и старается работать на благо своей Родины. Она имеет высшее образование. Зайнабджон более 18 лет работает в колледже преподавателем. Она очень любит свою профессию и имеет много учеников. Зайнабджон наставник молодежи. Она имеет маленькую зарплату, и эта зарплата не хватала для обеспечения 3 детей. Она одна вырастила своих детей, так как ее муж умер рано, и она осталась вдовой. Зайнабджон 9 лет назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов. Она параллельно введет свою педагогическую деятельность со своим бизнесом. Она планирует пополнить свой оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ для покупки сухофруктов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zaynabjon is a conscientious woman. She lives and works in the north of Tajikistan. Zaynabjon loves her country very much and tries to work for the benefit of her native land. She has higher education. 

Zaynabjon has worked as a college teacher for more than 18 years. She lives her profession very much and has many students. Zaynabjon is youth mentor. She has a small pay and this pay was not enough to provide for three children. She raised her children alone, as her husband died early, and she was left as a widow. 

Zaynabjon started her business of buying and reselling dried fruits 9 years ago. She manages her pedagogical work and her business in parallel. She plans to replenish her working capital. She requests a loan to purchase dried fruits. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира жизнерадостная женщина, которая родилась в 1968 года. Она всю свою жизнь старалась во благо своей семьи. Она воспитала своих детей в духе патриотизма. Она более 8 лет работает в колледже уборщицей. Так как она чистоплотная женщина, она с удовольствием делает свою работу. Замира имеет свой бизнес, так как у нее маленькая зарплата. Она параллельно введет своё дело. Замира занимается купле продажей сухофруктов. Она торгует на местном рынке в Субботу и Воскресенье. Она покупает свой товар оптом и реализует в розницу. На местном рынке она имеет свою торговую точку. Замира хочет пополнить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. Она запрашивает займ для покупки сухофруктов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zamira is a conscientious woman, who was born in 1968. Her whole life she has worked hard for the benefit of her family. She raised her children in a patriotic manner. For more than 8 years she has worked as a cleaning woman at a college. As she is a neat woman, she enjoys her work. 

Zamira has her own business, as she has a small salary. She manages her work in parallel. Zamira works with buying and reselling dried fruits. She trades at the local market on Saturdays and Sundays. She purchases her goods wholesale and sells them as retail. She has her own sales points at the local market. 

Zamira would like to replenish her working capital and this way increase her income. She requests a loan for purchasing dried fruits. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: Vilma de 37 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella posee una tienda desde hace 5 años donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren y la mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, como toda buena comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. Vilma tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Vilma is 37 years old and a single mother.  She has three children and lives in a home of her own.  She has had a store for five years, where she sells primary needs products such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other things.  She has been doing this for many years and this has provided her with experience that allows her to have many customers.  Her store is the best stocked and people prefer to buy from her and they keep her ahead of the competition because she always has what they need, at good prices and with unequalled service.  As a good businesswoman she wants to grow her business, but needs working capital, so she is asking for a loan, through INTEGRAL, so she can buy basic grains, snacks eggs, bread, drinks, etc.  Vilma comes with good credit references and is certain that she can repay the debt and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales, es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos  y sus padres,  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y también lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, pollos, verduras, tomates, etc. para seguir produciendo mas tamales y así generar más ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: She makes tamales, is a single mother, and lives in a home of her own with her two children and her parents.  Her business is located in her home and she also sells on foot within the various neighborhoods near her home.  She is able to pay her household expenses with her earnings and is asking for loan to buy corn, chicken, vegetables, tomatoes, etc. so she can continue making tamales and generate income to provide her family with better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es:
Las Exitosas está en su décimo ciclo, donde todas y cada una está poniendo lo mejor de sí para poder seguir creciendo. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde ellas a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, y de todo tipo. Comenta que se esfuerza mucho por poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia por medio de su trabajo y su esfuerzo. Ella sueña con poder tener un salón comercial donde poder ofrecer cómodamente a sus clientes sus productos.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, como ser shorts, remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Las Exitosas [The Successful Women] group is in its tenth cycle, and each and every member is striving as diligently as she can in order to keep making progress. The members are part of the poverty elimination program, and are rising out of poverty because they work and strive continuously and adopt the essential practices of successful women.  

One member who deserves special recognition is Doña Maria, who sells all types of clothing. Doña Maria observes that is conscientious about making her best efforts as she works so that she can improve her life and that of her family. She hopes to have a location for her shop where she'll be able to offer her merchandise to customers in comfort. 

Doña Maria is applying for this loan so she can purchase various types of merchandise, such as shorts, t-shirts, shirts, pants, and other items. She is grateful for this opportunity and the fact that it will allow her to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase shorts, t-shirts, shirts, pants, and other clothing items.

loans.name: Koeju Group

texts.es:
El grupo Koeju está en su 1º ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida que cada una tiene.
Liduvina una de ellas vende cosméticos, y cuenta que este es su medio de procurar los ingresos para su familia, ella es una persona con gran ansia de crecer y salir adelante, es por eso que quiere capacitarse y seguir creciendo. Ella pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos variados, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus venta y procurando un mejor ingreso y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Koeju group is in the first cycle of the Women's Committee Program, which requires a commitment to work and support other group members so they can make progress. The Women's Committee is part of the poverty elimination program, which seeks to understand the circumstances of each member's life.  

Liduvina sells cosmetics and says that this is how she earns income for her family. Liduvina is a woman with strong ambitions to grow and succeed, which is why she wants to undergo training and keep making progress. She is applying for this loan so that she can purchase a variety of cosmetics that will allow her to continue her sales, earn a higher income, and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали 31 год. Он мастер, предоставляющий услуги по ремонту машин. Он живет со своей семьей в Яванском районе и там же у него мастерская. Шерали в данный момент планирует открыть еще один бизнес. Он хочет продавать запасные части автомобилей. Он уже арендовал помещение для магазина и закупил половину товара. Для полного открытия магазина ему еще не хватает 2000 долларов США, чтобы купить остальные части запасных частей машин и заполнить товаром свой магазин. Он будет привозить свой товар оптом с города Душанбе. Благодаря кредиту у Шерали появится еще один источник дохода и жизненные условия семьи улучшится.
texts.en:
Sherali is 31 years old. He provides a service of repairing vehicles. He lives with his family in the Yavan region and also has his workshop there. 

Sherali currently plans to open another business. He would like to sell vehicle spare parts. He already rented premises for a store and has purchased half of the items. To fully open his store, he is still missing 2000 US dollar to purchase remaining vehicle spare parts and fill his store with goods. He will bring his goods wholesale from the city of Dushanbe. 

Thanks to the loan, Sherali will have another source of income and this will improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Ziyodullo

texts.ru:
Мужчину на фотографии зовут Зиёдулло. Он общительный и миролюбивый человек. Зиёдулло женат и имеет троих детей. Его жена занимается продажей молока. У них дома имеется корова. У Зиёдулло две дочки и сын. Они еще маленькие и не ходят в школу. Весь доход, который имеет Зиёдулло идет на обеспечения своей семьи.
  Зиёдулло занимается продажей продуктов питания в маленьком магазинчике. Свой магазинчик он открыл 5 лет назад. И с тех пор занимается продажей. Ассортимент его продукции включает в себя кондитерские изделия, печенье, конфеты, шоколад, консервы, приправы и многое другое, которое вы видите на фотографии. Зиёдулло очень вежливый, общительный и честный мужчина.
