   На данный момент у Зиёдулло мало средств, чтобы привести новые продукты и увеличить различность товаров. По этой причине он просит взаймы. Зиёдулло считает, что с увеличением ассортимента товара увеличиться и прибыль.
texts.en:
The man on the photo is called Ziyodullo. He is a sociable and peaceful man. Ziyodullo is married and has three children. His wife works with selling milk. They have a cow. Ziyodullo has two daughters and one son. They are still small and don't go to school. All of Ziyodullo's income goes to providing for his family. 

Ziyodullo works with selling food products in a small store. He opened his store 5 years ago and still works with sales. His product assortment includes confectionery, cookies, candy, chocolate, canned food, spices and more, as you can see on the photo. Ziyodullo is a very polite, sociable and honest man. 

Currently Ziyodullo has little money to bring in new products and increase the sale of goods. For this reason he requests a loan. Ziyodullo thinks that increasing the assortment of goods also will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy new food products and increase his assortment

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita es una mujer de 50 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco y cada día se esfuerza mucho para poder salir adelante, es por ello que luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logró iniciar su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, con lo cual tiene un ingreso para poder salir adelante.

Felicita esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una vitrina para poder exhibir sus productos y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Felicita is a 50 year old woman and lives in the city of Pisco.  Each day she works hard to be able to get ahead, and her efforts allowed her to start her business of selling beauty products so she can generate an income with which to get ahead.

Felicita is grateful to the Kiva lenders, whose help has allowed her to buy a display case to show her products, increase her income, and continue working hard to realize her great dream, “To build a home out of solid materials.”

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза молодая и энергичная девушка. Ей 21 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Шахноза занимается купле продажей женской одежды. Она открыла свой бизнес с помощью своей двоюродный сестры. Шахноза данное время самостоятельно введет свое дело. Она справляется успешно. Шахноза как многие молодые люди имеет большие планы на будущее. Она хочет быть успешной бизнес леди и зарабатывать больше денег. Она еще мечтает быть счастливой и найти хорошего спутника жизни, чтобы он поддержал ее бизнес деятельность. Шахноза должна обновить товар на новый сезон. Она запрашивает займ для покупки женской одежды. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a young and energetic girl. She is 21 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Shahnoza works with selling women's clothing. She opened her business with the help of her cousins. Shahnoza currently manages her business alone. She handles it successfully. 

Shahnoza has big plans for the future, like many young people. She would like to be a business woman and earn a lot of money. She already dreams of becoming happy and find a good life companion, and for him to support her business. 

Shahnoza should renew her goods for the new season. She requests a loan to purchase women's clothing. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy women's clothing for the new season

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Don Pedro, tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado, tiene cinco hijos y vive en el municipio de La Masica, Atlántida junto a su esposa e hijos. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la ganadería  y hace 10 años empezó a dedicarse a la agricultura de cultivo de palma africana (producción de aceite).  La producción de fruta de palma es vendida en las procesadoras de aceite vegetal.  Esta solicitando un segundo ciclo de préstamo que es por 22,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes para el abono y mantenimiento  de la finca de palma. Con esta inversión asegura el cultivo y su volumen  aumenta, por lo tanto las ganancias serán mayores. Su meta es sacar adelante a su familia, darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Pedro is 48 years old, married, has five children, and lives in the town of La Masica, Atlántida with his wife and children.  He used to raise livestock and 10 years ago he decided to begin raising African palms (palm oil producer) and sells the fruit to vegetable oil processors. He is asking for a second loan of 22,000 Lempiras so he can buy fertilizer to maintain his palm farm.  He knows that his crop and volume will increase and his income will improve.  His goal is to get his family ahead and provide an education for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль, 29 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. Образование-высшее, окончила педагогический техникум, работала преподавателем в местной школе, но после родов в данный момент сидит дома, занимается воспитанием детей. Очень пунктуальная и аккуратная. На протяжении 10 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль 12,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день она смогла развить животноводческую и полеводческую деятельность и супруг активно помогает ей в этом. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, а также имеется земельный надел мерою 2,40 ГА на котором она ежегодно выращивает перец, фасоль и клевер, а также другие овощи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства и полеводства Айгуль обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели. Доходы от кредита Айгуль планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота, и в будущем хочет дать достойное образование своим детям. Айгуль можно считать примерной супругой и счастливой мамой 2 малышей.
texts.en:
Aigul is 29 years old, married and raising two children together with her husband. She has higher education and achieved a pedagogic degree. She worked as a teacher at the local school, but after giving birth she now stays at home, raising the children. She is very punctual and accurate.

For a period of 10 years, she has worked with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding, after having started this business with an amount of 10,000 som (KGS). The monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). She has been able to expand the livestock breeding and agricultural business and her husband actively helps her with this. Her farm currently has two dairy cows, two calves and also a plot of land of 2.40 hectares, on which she every year grows peppers, beans, clover and other vegetables. 

With an aim to further develop her business and field crop cultivation, Aigul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of heifers. Aigul plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of cattle and in the future she would like to give her children a respectable education. Aigul can be considered an exemplary wife and the loving mother of two small children.

loans.use: to purchase heifers

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa de de 53 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su hijo quien estudia actualmente, ella posee una tienda en su lugar de habitación desde hace 4 años, posee mucha clientela que la prefieren por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir los gastos que se le presenta en su hogar, Teresa está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, aceite, golosinas, refrescos, etc. y así poder surtir con mas productos para obtener mas ganancias y darle a su hijo una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Teresa is 53 years old and lives with her son who attends school.  She has had a store in her home for four years and has many customers who prefer to buy from her because of her good prices and friendliness.  She is able to pay her household expenses with the income she obtains from her work.  Teresa is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, cooking oil, snacks, soft drinks, etc. and be able to stock her store to obtain greater income and provide better financial stability for her son.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: El Señor  Omar  tiene 22 años, es casado con hijito de la edad de 3 años, él se dedica fabricación de artesanías hechas de totora un materia que usaban desde la época incaica ya que hacían barcos de totora con las que navegaban por el lago Titicaca,   el Señor  Omar  aprendió esta actividad de su padre que también realiza artesanías de totora,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Señor  Omar  va a usar este préstamo para compra de material de construcción para hacer construir un cuarto en su vivienda él vive en la localidad de Chilaya cerca del  lago Titicaca en esta comunidad la mayoría de los pobladores se dedica a la pesca y a la elaboración de artesanías ya que tiene la visita de muchos turistas, el Señor  Omar  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar la calidad de sus artesanía que con el tiempo las hace mejor,  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar de material para la realización de su trabajo, el Señor  Omar  es una persona con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos ya que es un joven Emprendedor.
texts.en: Omar is 22 years old, married, and has a three year old son.  He makes handicrafts from reeds, a material that has been used since boats were made out of reeds, which were used to navigate Lake Titicaca.  Omar learned this from his father, who also makes handicrafts from reeds.  This will be his first loan through the institution, and Omar will use the money to buy building materials, so he can build a room onto his home in Chilaya, near Lake Titicaca.  Most of the people in this community are fishermen and artists, since many tourists visit here.  Omar has challenges in his business, such as improving the quality of his art form.  He will use the benefits to buy supplies for his work.  Omar is a person with a desire to get ahead and he is happy about the opportunity to improve his business and income, because he is a young entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Nicolás es de Chuquisaca, tiene 25 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta nivel primario, hace 8 años trabaja como moto taxista y está afiliado a la asociación de transporte de moto taxi hace 5 años, pero su motocicleta actualmente tiene algunas dificultades que no le permiten prestar su servicio con eficiencia, por ello requiere un crédito para adquirir una motocicleta nueva  y seguir trabajando con una mejor herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en: Nicolás is from Chuquisaca.  He is 25 years old, single, and has no children.  He has an elementary school education and has been working as a taxi driver for eight years.  He has been a member of the Moto-Taxi Transport Association for five years, but his motorcycle has some problems that prevent his offering efficient service, so he needs a loan to buy a new motorcycle and continue working with better tools.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынаре 26 лет, замужем, счастливая и добрая мама 2 детей, дети маленькие: сыну 3 года, а дочь родила в этом году в 2013, ей нет еще и годика. У Чынары - среднее образование, сразу же после окончания школы она вышла замуж, совсем в юном возрасте. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Чынара и ее семья занимаются животноводством и полеводством, как и другие местные жители, проживающие в одном селе с ними. Стартовала Чынара 3 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чынары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 лошадь, 20 овец, а также имеется земельный надел мерою 0,57 ГА на котором она ежегодно выращивает софлор и клевер. Также дополнительным доходом является небольшая зарплата супруга, который работает чабаном и пасет лошадей- жителей своего же села за определенную цену. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей. (на фото Чынара с лошадьми, который пасет ее муж. лошади являются собственностью жителей села)
texts.en:
Chynara is 26 years old, married and the loving and good mother of two children. The children are small: Her son is 3 years old and the daughter was born this year (2013); she is not even one year old. Chynara has secondary education. Soon after finishing school she got married, at a very young age. 

As a main source of income for her family, Chynara and her family work with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, just like the other people who live in the same village as them. Chynara started three years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). 

Thanks to Chynara's persistent work, her farm currently has one horse, 20 sheep and also a plot of land of 0.57 hectares, on which she every year grows safflower and clover. An additional income is also her husband's small salary, which he gets form working as a shepherd, tending the horses of the inhabitants of their village for a certain price. Their total monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop their business, Chynara turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep for increasing the number of livestock. Chynara plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for the future education of her children. 

On the photo, Chynara is with the horses which her husband tends to. The horses are owned by inhabitants of their village.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Mnarani Group

texts.en:
Ermanilde, who is in her mid 40s, is married with three children who are still at school. She has been running a business selling clothes on market days which falls on every Saturday in different areas. She normally works from 5.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Ermanilde's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the stock of clothes. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is really happy with the loans and appreciates whoever has supported her group with a loan. She used the profit to pay for school fees and helped the husband to cover household expenses. She will use this loan buy more stock of clothes to resell on market days. She dreams of building her own house.

Ermanilde will share this loan with her loan group, Mnarani ,which has twelve members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to resell on market days.

loans.name: Ushirikiano Kiburugwa Group

texts.en:
Moshi, who is in her mid 30s, is married with five children; four of them are still at school and the fifth one is still small. She has been running a business selling CDs and DVDs and providing entertainment like showing football matches. She has been in this business for three years now. She works from 9.00 am to mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Moshi's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more and up-to-date CDs and DVDs and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, covered household expenses and has started building her house. She is really happy with the loan and appreciates everybody who has supported her group. She will use this loan to buy more CDs and DVDs to sell and to show - the ones she shows are mostly football matches. She dreams of finishing her house.

Moshi will share this loan with her group, Ushirikiano Kiburugwa, which has only two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more CDs and DVDs to sell and show.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margret is a single lady of forty-one years; she has three children. She has rental houses, keeps pigs and is also a dairy farmer, she has been in this business for twelve years now and gets monthly income of thirty-seven thousand shillings.

This will be Margret's third loan with KADET Ltd., she plans to use the entire amount to channel water to the rental houses and also buy feed for her cows and pigs.

loans.use: To pay to channel water to her rental houses and buy feed for the cows and pigs.

loans.name: Stefanos

texts.en:
Stefanos is 56 years old from Olkalou. He is married to Rosemary and they are blessed with four children aged 18, 16, 14 and 12 years old.

He is a farmer who has been practicing mixed farming for the last eleven years and to enable him buy two heifers and animal feeds, he has applied for his third loan of KES 100,000 from KADET Ltd.

His monthly income right now is KES 30,000 and his intention is to use the anticipated profit from his expanded business to educate his children, pay back his loan to KADET Ltd. and to buy more dairy cows. In the future, Stefanos hopes to buy a plot and build some rental houses and for his children to be well-educated.

loans.use: To buy two heifers and animal feed.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es: Olga, tiene 47 años de edad,  esta casada, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Tiene  4 años de dedicarse  a la venta de ropa usada como vestidos, jeans, blusas, ropa de niño  etc. y  también calzado usado. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende en la misma comunidad.  Ha solicitado un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras  para comprar mas mercadería como ser jeans para dama, short, blusas, camisas, jeans para caballero,camisas y ropa de niño de segunda mano y va comprar calzado para la venta, con el fin de aumentar  ventas y ganancias. Su meta es que su negocio crezca  y su familia pueda tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Olga is 47 years old, married, has four children, and lives in the town of Esparta, Atlántida.  She has been selling used clothing such as dresses, jeans, blouses, children’s clothing, shoes, etc. for four years.  She runs her business from her home in the same community and is asking for a loan of 15,000 Lempiras to buy more merchandise such as used women’s jeans, shorts, blouses, shirts, men’s jeans, shirts, children’s clothing, and shoes to sell so she can increase her income.  Her goal is to grow her business so that her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Yamah

texts.en:
Yamah lives in Kakata Town. She is 48 years old, she did go to school, and she is married with four children between 17 and 25 years old, who are in school and live at home. Her husband is a local business man. 

For ten years now, she has been selling rice, palm oil, and pepper in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, and pepper for her business. She started her business with money given to her by husband. She is happy with her business because of the profit she makes per day. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the region of Mubende in Uganda. She is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Gertrude has been working hard to manage her boutique, where she sells clothes and shoes. 

To help expand her business, Gertrude has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, shoes and bags. This will help Gertrude to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Gertrude hopes that in the future she will be able to enlarge her business. 

Gertrude is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gertrude who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, shoes and bags.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a thirty-five-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She sells clothes and also practices farming in order to raise money to support her family. Ever-changing customer preferences and inadequate capital affect her business growth while her dream is to own a modern boutique.

As the good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to University, and also set up other income-generating activities to secure her children's future.

Jane is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 38-year-old married father of three children. Hassan works selling candies and has done this for ten years in a popular market in his town. He is well known as a hard-working man.

His requested loan will be invested in paying for his children increased school tuition fees. Hassan's main aim is to provide his children with the best education and living. He is looking forward to open a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his children school tuition fees.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Satta is 46 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She is married and has three children between 12 and 20, who are in school and live at home. She did not go to school. 

She got a little capital from her husband to start her business. She has been in this business for ten years now, and she enjoys the flow of her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter ball, okra, pepper, rice, and oil for her business. Her dream is to become an house-owner and see her children in college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball, okra, pepper, rice, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with three children. She is a junior-high school graduate. Currently she sells cleaning detergents at Agona, near Takoradi. She has been involved in this business for about five years now. Her husband is a driver. Her income goes towards paying her children’s school fees, feeding, paying utility bills and other expenses.

Veronica will use the loan to increase her existing cleaning inventory of detergents. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to pay her children’s school fees and develop her business further in future.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of cleaning detergents.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 28 years old. She is married with three children aged between seven and ten. She sells vegetables and has been in the business for the past seven years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more fish and tomatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more fish and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 25 years old from Olkalou. He is married to Ann who is a farmer and they are blessed with one child aged eight years old.

He is a farmer who grows and sells snow peas, potatoes, wheat and maize, a business he has been running for the last three years. Anthony needs some money to buy snow pea seeds and to hire laborers to prepare his land for the next planting season. To enable him do this he has applied for his first loan of KES 100,000 from KADET Ltd.

His monthly income right now is KES 30,000 and his intention is to use the profits realized from his expanded business to educate his child and to pay back his loan to KADET Ltd. He hopes to be a very successful farmer in his region in the future and for his family to be happy and united.

loans.use: To prepare his land and to buy snow pea seeds for the next planting season.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 28 years old. She sells milk and has been in the business of selling milk for the past seven years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more milk to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the children.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Agil

texts.en:
Agil is 52 years old, married and has three children. His elder son is married, the little son is studying at his first course of college and the daughter goes to 10 class. Parvana is Agil’s wife; she is a housewife. Agil’s family has been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Füzuli city already 20 years, and now they live in a hostel which is located in the Absheron region.

Agil has a car and for ten years he has been a taxi driver. He transports passengers between different areas of the Absheron region. Today his car is damaged and Agil can’t support his family. He wants to repair the car and restore his monthly income. Therefore he applied for a loan of 400 AZN. With this loan he wants to buy a new motor for his car.

He thankful for this loan from Komak and the Kiva organizations. In the future he wants to open a car repair salon.

loans.use: to buy a new motor for his car.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ernestina is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fruit in Effia Kuma (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. 

Ernestina is married and has two children. Her husband is unemployed. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Ernestina wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of fruit. In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of fruit.

loans.name: Sania

texts.en:
Sania is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the region of Kampala north in Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past 7 years, Sania has been working hard to manage her Garments shop, which sells clothes and garments. 

To help expand her business, Sania has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help Sania to generate greater profits and increase her capital. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

She is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sania who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 28 years old. She is married with three children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide for the family.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah is a single lady of twenty-four years, and she is a mother of one child. She runs a business of making earrings, bangles, rings, etc. She has been in this business for four years now and gets an approximate monthly income of eleven thousand shillings.

This will be Eddah's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy materials for making ornaments. In the future she wants to be a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy materials for making earrings and bangles, etc.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is from the city of Batumi. He is 31 years old, married and lives with his wife, school-age son, student sister and parents. The only one who is employed in the household is Mamuka’s father, who is a furniture manufacturer and works at a shop in return for a small monthly salary. 

Mamuka started a brick factory. He has already purchased all the needed equipment for making bricks and now is requesting the loan to buy raw materials for doing this. He hopes his business will be successful, as there is high demand for construction materials on the market. 

This initiative will significantly increase the family income and Mamuka will be able to improve their standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his newly started bricks factory.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de las Mercedes está dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de poder conocer la vida de cada una y poder ayudarlas.
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Soledad, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y joyas como medio de poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy luchadora, que con esfuerzo y sacrificio está creciendo y saliendo adelante, y comenta que gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe está mejorando.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas, ya que así podrá seguir con sus ventas y seguir invirtiendo en sus negocios, ya que es su medio de vida. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le permitirá crecer.
texts.en:
The "Virgen de las Mercedes" group is part of the poverty elimination project.  All the group's members are undergoing the poverty elimination survey in order to determine exactly what situation each member is living in and to help them.

One member of the group is Soledad.  She is very dignified and makes a living selling fruits and jewellery in order to help her family.  Soledad is a very plucky woman and, with effort and sacrifice, she is growing and prospering.  She tells us that, thanks to training, she is improving her business.

Soledad is applying for this loan in order to invest in buying more fruits.  This way she can continue with her sales and continue to invest in her business, as the business provides her with an income.  Soledad is grateful for this opportunity, which will allow her to grow.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Siifa

texts.en:
Siifa is 43 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the  region of Masaka in Uganda. She is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Siifa has been working hard to manage her cosmetics shop, which sells cosmetic products. 

To help expand her business, Siifa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more relaxers, cosmetics and all varieties of shampoos, and will help Siifa to generate greater profits and buy materials for the family. Siifa hopes that in the future she will be able to have a wholesale cosmetics shop. 

Siifa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Siifa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more relaxers, cosmetics and all varieties of shampoos.

loans.name: Nancy Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Nancy se encuentra realizando su primer crédito a lado del grupo de crédito Yanbal, espera que los créditos le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica. Vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad esta bañada por 4 ríos, su centro histórico guarda celosamente su historia, esta ciudad tiene una amplia gastronomía, a más que es cuna de grandes poetas y deportistas. 
La Señora Nancy tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de 4 años de edad, su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de un familiar.
Doña Nancy se dedica al cuidado de su hogar, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar, trabaja de lunes a sábados en el área de la costura, esta actividad lo aprendió trabajando. 
El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de ropa para iniciar con este negocio. Su meta es  crecer en el negocio que va a iniciar y llegar a tener su boutique.
texts.en:
Nancy is applying for her first loan with the Yanbal group.  She hopes that the loan will help her to improve her financial stability.  Nancy lives in the city of Cuenca, with four rivers and with its past preserved in the historic centre.  Cuenca has a strong gastronomical culture and produces great poets and sportspeople.

Nancy is 24 years old and lives with her partner.  She has one son, who is four years old, and her husband works as a labourer in the building trade.  The house where they live is owned by a relative.

Nancy looks after the home but, in order to bring in an income, she works Monday to Saturday as a dressmaker.  She learned this trade on the job.

This loan will be used to buy clothes to start her business.  Nancy's goal is to expand her business and to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Ruth  Vanessa

texts.es:
La Señora Ruth forma parte del grupo de crédito Yanbal desde hace 2 años y medio, tiempo en el que ha logrado mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar y en las reuniones sale de su rutina diaria. Vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad esta bañada por 4 ríos, su centro histórico guarda celosamente su historia, esta ciudad tiene una amplia gastronomía y es cuna de grandes poetas y deportistas. 
La Señora Ruth es profesional en la rama de contabilidad y ofrece servicios contables a varias empresas, se encuentra en el negocio desde hace 4 años y labora de lunes a viernes. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en el pago de una letra de su vehículo que es para su trabajo. Su sueño es que su hija se pueda especializar en el extranjero.
texts.en:
Ruth has been part of the Yanbal loan group for two and a half years.  In this time she has managed to improve her household's financial stability and, in the meetings, she is able to leave her daily routine. Ruth lives in the city of Cuenca, with four rivers and with its past preserved in the historic centre. Cuenca has a strong gastronomical culture and produces great poets and sportspeople.

Ruth is a professional in the accounting trade and offers her services to various companies.  She has been working with her current employer for four years and works from Monday to Friday.  Ruth will use this loan to pay an installment on her vehicle, which she needs for work.  Ruth's dream is for her daughter to study abroad.

loans.use: to pay an installment on her vehicle.

loans.name: Kuma

texts.fr: Mr Kuma cordonnier de profession a ouvert son atelier en 2006. Il fabrique des chaussures et rencontre par moment des mévente au cours de l'année. Sa seconde demande lui permettra d'acheter des matières premières(peau, colle, semelle) pour la fabrication de chaussures. Son souhait est d'assurer l'éducation de ses enfants tout en rendant pérenne son activité( Il est marié et père de 02 enfants).
texts.en: Kuma is a cobbler by trade and opened his workshop in 2006. He makes shoes and at times during the year experiences a slump in sales. His second loan will enable him to buy raw materials (animal hide, glue, soles) to make shoes. He would like to be able to provide for his children's education while at the same time being able to carry out his business in the long term (he is married and father to two children).

loans.use: to buy raw materials (animal hide, glue, soles)

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is 48 years old, married, and supports a family of nine. Her spouse, Michael Kemboi, helps in fending for the family, too. Priscah is into a mixed farming business in the Chemundu location served by the KADET Kapsabet office. This has been her income generating business for the last four years. She gets an average monthly income of Kshs 30,000.

She plans to use the amount borrowed, Ksh100,000, to purchase a dairy cow and dairy feeds. Her dream is to educate her kids and to set up a zero grazing unit in the village.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Juliana did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming self employed. Currently, she sells roasted corn with groundnuts at Agona, Takoradi. She has been in this business for about 10 years now. She is married to a driver and has four children. Juliana uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize and groundnuts, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Juliana wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize and groundnuts, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Joseph Christian

texts.fr: Christian est un homme âgé de 26 ans, marié et père de famille. Il a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 5 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son accueil chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'il a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail. Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale, cartons de sucres, des friandises,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Christian is a 26-year old man, who is married and a father. He opened a grocery store in one of the capital's districts and has been managing it for five years now. His small business works due to the warm welcome he gives to his customers, his experience in the field and the customer base that he has built up over the years. The latter is becoming so significant that he can no longer meet customer demand because his capital is too small and he is obliged to buy in his goods on a retail basis. He is requesting this loan so that he can boost his capital and diversify his goods (rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar, candy..) to increase his profit margin. He will reinvest part of his profit in the business to be able to cover its needs, and the remainder will allow him to provide for his daily needs and those of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of basic products.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a widowed woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 Mejukmaa wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 30 years old and lives in the area of Kakata Town. She’s married and did not attend school. With little income from her husband, she is determined to make their lives a better one by getting engaged in a small plantain and eddoes business. (Eddoes are small root vegetables similar to taro.) Esther has been in this business for 6 years now, and she enjoys the flow of her customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantain and eddoes to sell, so as to enable her to build a shop for her business. Esther's dream is to become an owner of a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more plantain and eddoes to sell.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married woman with seven children, six of whom attend school and one who is under-age. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen del Carmen; está en su ciclo número 2  del programa de comité, quienes además están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, trabajando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de ellas es Dominga, quien hace venta de comidas en su casa, y comenta que le está yendo muy bien, ya que a sus clientes les gusta mucho las comidas que hace, así poco a poco está creciendo y también comenta que gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe le va mejor. 
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de los ingredientes para la elaboración de las comidas carne, pan para hamburguesas, entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named Virgen del Carmen is in its second cycle with the communal bank, besides being part of the elimination of poverty program, working to improve their living conditions.

One of them is Dominga, who sells food in her house.  She says that it is going very well for her, because her customers really like the food she makes, and so little by little her business is growing.  She also comments that thanks to the training she receives, things are going better for her.

Dominga is asking for this loan to buy the ingredients needed to prepare the food: meat, and hamburger buns, among others. This will help her to firm up her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy meat and buns for hamburgers, among other things.

loans.name: Cyrille

texts.fr: Cyrille est un homme âgé de 32 ans, célibataire et père d'un enfant de 10 ans. Il a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 5 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son accueil chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'il a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail. Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale, cartons de sucres, des friandises,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Cyrille is a 32-year old man, who is a bachelor and father to a 10-year old child. He opened a grocery store in one of the capital's districts, which he has been managing for five years now. His small business works well thanks to the warm welcome he gives to his customers, his experience in this field and the customer base which he has built up over the years. The latter is becoming so significant now that he cannot meet customer demand because his capital is too small and he is obliged to buy his products on a retail basis. He is requesting this loan to increase his capital and diversify the goods he buys and sells (rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar, candy,...) so that he can increase his profit margin. He will reinvest part of his profit in his business to cover its needs, and the remainder will allow him to provide for his daily needs as well as those of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of basic products.

loans.name: Marie Conception

texts.fr: Marie Conception est une jeune femme de 44 ans célibataire et mère de cinq enfants dont l'âge vari entre 19 et 3 ans. parmi ses enfants, deux vont encore à l'école. Marie est une commerçante dans un marché de la capital depuis sept années et détient un comptoir sur lequel elle commercialise des vivres frais et secs( tomates, pommes de terre, légume, arachide, etc.)Son activité se déroule bien, mais elle est très souvent confrontée aux problèmes de rupture de stocks de marchandises. Elle désire ardemment agrandir son activité pour pouvoir répondre dans les délais aux attentes de sa clientèle qui va grandissante de jour en jour. D'où la nécessité pour elle d'obtenir ce crédit. Les bénéfices qui en résulteront seront d'une part réinvestis dans l'activité et l'autre partie lui permettra de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Marie Conception is a 44-year old woman, who is single and mother to five children, whose ages range from three to 19 years old. Two of her children still go to school. Marie has been a trader in one of the capital's markets for the past seven years and has a stall on which she sells fresh and dried food (tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables, groundnut, etc.). Her business is going well, but she often faces the problem of a shortage of stock. She would really like to expand her business in order to respond on a timely basis to the demands of her ever-increasing customer base. It is for this reason she is getting a loan. The profits she makes as a result of the loan will be partly reinvested in the business and partly to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy goods (fresh and dried food).

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is from Dashtavan village of Ararat region. He lives with his mother, father and sister.

Artur has been providing dental technician services to locals for three years. Due to his tireless and hard work, Artur has a lot of clients from the region. Now, in order to be able to purchase tools that he needs for his work, Artur has applied for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Because of family's poor conditions Artur isn't able to save money to invest in the dental service, so the loan is very important for him.

loans.use: to pay for tools needed to provide dental services.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 47 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the region of Kampala North in Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Francis has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells groceries of different kinds. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goods to sell, and will help Francis to generate greater profits and increase his capital. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Even though Elizabeth grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She sells yams and onions in Effia Kuma (near Takoradi). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began three years ago. 

Elizabeth is married and has eight children. Her husband is a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses, and pay their children’s school fees. 

Elizabeth wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of yams and onions. 

In the long term, Elizabeth plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the need of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of yams and onions.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the region of Mubende in Uganda. He is married and has three children; one is currently in school. For the past two years, Moses has been working hard to manage his boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and shoes, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and serve the increased demand. 

Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to have a bigger, well-stocked shop. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Fred, is a father of six with a wife. He is an agriculturalist, who rears mainly cows, a skill he gained from his father who was a predominant cattle-keeper.

He sells some of the cows that are no longer strong enough to give birth as well as the young bulls. 

He is applying for a loan so that he will buy good cows and later sell the old and ill-looking ones in his stock. He is hard-working and resilient. He is excited about the partnership with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia lives in Kakata town,  is 28 years old, and has two children, ages 1 and 13.  They all live at home, and one attends school. 

For the past eight years she has been running a table, where she sells fresh fish in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother, and learned this way of selling from her friends. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish for her business.  

Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is from Vanadzor town, where he lives with his wife and son. 

For over 45 years, Gagik has been earning his living by providing different types of construction services to locals. He works hard to be able to gather enough income and cover the family's basic needs. Gagik receives many orders from people due to his attentive and high quality work. Realizing the importance of the income that he gets from the construction business, Gagik wants to enlarge it. 

He has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase the tools that are needed for construction work, and be able to increase the quality of the work he does.

Gagik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

This loan will greatly help Gagik, and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tools for providing construction services

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a Kiva borrower; she describes herself as innovative. 

She operates a retail business, where she sells books, printing papers, and other stationery. 

She will use the Kes 13,440 loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting her house; this will benefit five people. 

She hopes that in the future she will become a wholesaler of stationery.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señoras. Gladys  está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañera del grupo de crédito Feria Libre, vive por la parroquia de Sidcay en Cuenca, lugar que goza de paisajes que nos brindan su geografía accidentada, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y comercio, son personas solidarias que aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora. Gladys tiene 52 años de edad, está divorciada y ha concebido 4 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijos solteros uno trabaja y la otra está estudiando en el colegio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Doña Gladys labora en los quehaceres de su hogar y desde hace 3 años se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos, los que vende en pie y por libras y poco a poco va obteniendo clientela. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos para la venta. Su meta es crecer más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys is taking out her second loan with her friends and companions from the Feria Libre group. She lives in the Sidcay parish in Cuenca, a place with hilly landscapes. Its people work raising animals, farming, and as merchants. They are supportive people who still maintain their culture and traditions. 

Gladys is 52 years old. She is divorced and has 4 grown children. Two of them are married and live on their own. Of her two single children, one works and the other is in high school. They don't own their own home and are renters. Gladys does housework and for the last three years has worked buying and selling chickens. She sells them live or by the pound. little by little she has gained customers.  

The money from the loan will be invested in buying chickens to sell. Her goal is to grow more in the business.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: La Fortuna Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Fortuna” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, ellas mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras que quieren dar a sus familias todo lo no pudieron tener. Son de una zona rural, aun en crecimiento, luchando por mejorar y crecer.
Sulema es una de las integrantes, quien tiene una pequeña peluquería, y por medio de su negocio está dando un excelente servicio a sus clientes y su comunidad entera, es una persona muy trabajadora, que sueña con poder mejorar su negocio y poder dar trabajo a las demás personas que como ella quieren crecer.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de shampoo, enjuagues tintes, enjuagues y demás, y así seguir trabajando y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “La Fortuna” committee was formed when several residents of the city of Santaní got together. She are enterprising women who are fighters that want to give their families everything they weren't able to have. They are from a rural area that is still growing, fighting to grow and improve.   

Sulema is one of the members. She has a small hair salon and with her business is giving her customers and the whole community an excellent service. She is a very hardworking person who dreams of being able to improve her business and give work to other people who want to grow like she does. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying shampoo, color conditioners, conditioners and more so that she can continue to work and give her customers good service.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, color conditioners, conditioners and more.

loans.name: Kusemererwa

texts.en:
Kusemererwa is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende District of Uganda. He is married with four children, three of them in school. For the past three years, Kusemererwa has been working hard to manage his salon, where he does hairdressing. 

To help expand his business, Kusemererwa has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair-cutting machines and mirrors. This investment will help Kusemererwa generate greater profits and offer better services to people.

Kusemererwa hopes that in the future, he will be able to enlarge his salon. 

Note: Kusemererwa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kusemererwa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hair-cutting machines and mirrors

loans.name: Shabnum

texts.en:
Shabnum is a 34-year-old, married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community and makes enough through business to contribute to the family income. 

Shabnum requested a loan of 35,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Guapa” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de Santaní, una zona bastante alejada de la zona céntrica, eminentemente rural, y donde todas las integrantes se dedican a actividades rurales.
Raquel, una de las integrantes, se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, y por medio de su trabajo día a día lucha por dar a su familia lo que necesitan para una vida mejor. Es una persona muy luchadora, que quiere salir adelante. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y así seguir criándolos para la venta.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa communal bank is made up of a group of neighbors in Santaní, an area that is pretty far from the heart of things and is especially rural.  All the members work in rural activities.

Raquel, one of the members, works raising and selling barnyard animals. Through her work she fights from day to day to give her family what they need for a better life.  She is a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead.  She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals, and in this way to keep raising them to sell.

loans.use: Comprar balanceados para animales.

loans.name: Santa Clara 2 Group

texts.es:
Santa clara 2 es un grupo nuevo, que forma parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, que lucha por una vida mejor, para poder salir de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ursulina, quien se dedica a las ventas, tiene un pequeño negocio que es una despensa, que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio monto, y comenta que al principio le fue muy difícil poder empezar, pero que hoy ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Por medio de su negocio da a su familia lo que necesitan y no pasan por necesidades.
Pide este crédito para comprar insumos para poder surtir su negocio, y comprar verduras, carne, leche, panificados y demás. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Santa Clara 2 is a new group. It is a part of the poverty elimination program that is fighting for a better life to be able to get out of poverty. 

One of the members is Ursulina, who works in sales. She has a small business which is a convenience store that she opened with much hard work and sacrifice. She says that at first it was difficult to be able to start it, but today she has a good clientele. Through her business she gives her family what they need and they don't lack anything.

She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients to be able to stock her business. She will buy vegetables, meat, milk, baked goods and more. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, milk, baked goods and more.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende District of Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of them currently in school. For the past five years, Jackson has been working hard to manage his retail shop. 

To help expand his business, Jackson has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more products and will help Jackson increase his sales and generate greater profits. Jackson hopes that in the future he will be able to have a supermarket. 

Note: Jackson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
After graduating from middle school, Stella decided to set up her own shoe business in Effia Kuma (near Takoradi). 

With over eight years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale. 

She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a driver) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is married with no children.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Ega has operated a cafe business making rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors.  She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business.  She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a small scale provision seller in Effia Kuma (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education as she has graduated from Junion High School.  She is married and has three children. Her husband works at Electricity Company of Ghana.  Beatrice has been working as a provision seller for close to seven years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of provisions, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a provision stand which would help her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of provisions, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman and has 5 children. She describes herself as an ambitious person. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Mary will use the KES 13,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit 8 family members. She hopes that in the future, she will have a healthy family. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka District of Uganda. He is married and has six children, four of them currently in school. For the past six years, Matia has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells home products. 

To help expand his business, Matia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items, such as bread and sugar, for resale. This investment will help Matia generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. 

Matia hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Note: Matia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Matia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items, such as bread and sugar, for resale

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer es un grupo unido que trabaja y está luchando por salir adelante, está en su ciclo 16 del comité de mujeres, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sara quien tiene un copetín bien surtido donde tiene venta de todo tipo de insumos, y con lo cual está saliendo adelante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que por medio de su esfuerzo pudo brindar a su familia lo que necesitan.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su copetín, como ser bebidas, golosinas, comestibles y demás, con lo cual podrá dar a su clientela todo lo que pide. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de seguir trabajando
texts.en:
The Renacer [Rebirth] group is in its 16th Women's Committee Program cycle and is part of the Poverty Elimination Program. The members of Renacer have a strong work ethic and solidarity, and each woman strives diligently to make progress. 

Doña Sara is one of the Renacer members. She runs a small, well-stocked restaurant that sells all kinds of goods and that is helping her achieve progress. Doña Sara is a very hardworking woman whose diligent work ethic allows her to meet her family's needs.  

Doña Sara is applying for a loan to purchase supplies for her restaurant, such as drinks, snacks, and other food items. This inventory will allow her to meet all of her clients's needs. Doña Sara is grateful for this opportunity that allows her to keep working.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, snacks, foods, and other goods.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina sells second hand clothes in Agona, Takoradi. She has been in this business for 5 years. She is married with three children and is a junior high school graduate. Her income mostly goes into supporting her husband (who is a driver), paying her children's school fees and paying utility bills. Amina will use her loan to buy more clothes in order to expand her business thus allowing her to meet a rising amount of customers. Her new profits from the expanded business will be used to assist in paying her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more clothes in order to expand her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a divorcee, aged forty nine years with three children. She lives in a rural setting with her family, and one of her children is still attending school. Her children are aged 17, 20 and 23 years respectively.

She is a farmer who deals in agriculture, especially bananas and coffee growing. Jane is also a cattle keeper and rears cows and goats. Jane has been in this business since 1990. She works six days a week and each day she works for eight hours. Jane also operates a small retail shop which supplements her family income.

Jane started these businesses in order to earn a living and be able to care for her children since she is a single mother.  She has acquired this loan so that she can buy manure and pesticides for manure plantation. Jane sells her agricultural products to traders from the city.      
      
Her dream is to educate her last born who is still attending school but her main challenge is unpredictable weather changes and lack of enough capital. She is hard-working.

loans.use: To buy manure and pesticides

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past year, she has operated a kiosk shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres son las que integran este grupo, todas ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde se están esforzando por dar a sus familias unas mejores condiciones de vida y elevar su nivel de ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir con ingresos buenos, pero debe seguir trabajando para seguir manteniéndolos. Entre el trabajo que ella hace se destaca la venta de minutas, comidas que ella misma hace, y con lo cual ayuda a su familia, es una persona muy trabajadora y entusiasta que está luchando por salir adelante, ya que quiere ir mejorando.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, mandioca, carne, condimentos y demás  para poder vender y generar más ingresos el cual la ayudara a mejorar  su calidad de vida. Todas están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
17 women make up this group, and all of them form part of the program for the elimination of poverty, through which they are working in order to give their families a better quality of life and raise their income level.

One of the group members is Lidia, who in the last survey demonstrated a third tier level of poverty, which is to say she has good income, but must continue working in order to maintain her family.  Among the many jobs that she holds, one stands out, and that is the making of homemade meals, by which she helps her family.  She is a very hard-working and enthusiastic person who is struggling to get ahead, since she wants to keep improving.  

She is asking for a loan in order to buy vegetables, yuca, meat, condiments, and other items in order to be able to sell and generate more income, which will help her improve her quality of life.  

All the group members are very thankful for the opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, yucca, meat, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria, es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumos alimenticios. Trabaja junto con su hijo, tienen un móvil con el cual distribuyen sus productos por los distintos barrios de asunción y alrededores. 
Tiene una antigüedad de más de 10 años en su negocio,  también tiene experiencia y una clientela formada. Mediante este trabajo pudo tener para su casa, en donde cuenta con todas las comodidades, y gracias a lo cual no hace falta nada a su hijo.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carnes, condimentos y demás para poder seguir con la elaboración de sus comidas y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
María is a hardworking woman who sells food products. She works together with her son and they distribute their products in different neighborhoods in Asunción and its surroundings thanks to a car they own.

They have had this business for more than ten years, not to mention the experience and customers they have accumulated. Through this job, María was able to buy a comfortable house and give her son everything he ever needed.

She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, different types of meat, spices and other things in order to continue preparing her foods and keep on working.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, spices and other ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Memuna.  She is married and has 3 children ages 20, 16, and 13. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her for schooling.  In 2007, Memuna established her timber business. She began her business just to enable her to support her children’s education. Her business is located at the outskirts of town, and her main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Memuna has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans, and now requires a new SLL 4,000,000 loan in order to saw leaves of timber.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to buy more stock and improve her stock level. In the future, Memuna plans to own a house, to generate funds to pay her son's college fees and to own an outlet in the middle of town. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more timber.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмире 49 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. Образование-средне-специальное, окончила техникум по специальности технолог швейных машин. Работала швеей на протяжении 2 лет, затем вышла замуж и после замужества на протяжении 23 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день она смогла развить животноводческую и полеводческую деятельность. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 теленка и 6 овец, а также имеется земельный надел мерою 1,80 ГА на котором она ежегодно выращивает фасоль и клевер. Супруг Элмиры оказывает услуги односельчанам  при перевозке грузов и имеет небольшой доход. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства и полеводства Элмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота, а также полученная прибыль поможет приготовить приданое для дочери на свадьбу.
texts.en:
Elmira is 49 years old. She is married and she and her husband are raising two children. She has secondary-level education, having graduated technical college where she majored in sewing. She worked as a seamstress for 2 years, then she got married and since then has spent 23 years rearing animals and developing crops. She started this business with 5,000 Kyrgyz soms. She has been able to develop her livestock and farming activities. On her farm she has two calves and six sheep and also has a 1.8 hectare patch of land, on which she grows beans and clover. 

Elmira's husband works transporting goods for their fellow villagers and he receives a small income. The monthly total profit is 13,000 som. With the goal of further developing her farm Elmira turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 120,000 soms to buy bull-calves. Elmira plans to spend the income gained from the loan on increasing her quantity of livestock. The profit could also be used to be put towards a dowry for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy bull-calves

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever es una persona que quiere salir adelante, comenta que lucha por ser un buen profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su trabajo.
Ever está estudiando a carrera de contabilidad, y comenta que quiere ser un excelente profesional exitoso que pueda ser útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma está cada vez más cerca de su meta. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Ever is a person with a strong will to get ahead. He says that he is fighting to become a good professional who is able to help others through his job.

Ever is studying Accounting and wants to become a successful professional, in order to serve his community.

He is requesting this loan to pay for the tuition fees in order to come closer to his goals. He is grateful for this opportunity to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is married to an electrician. She has two children. She uses her income to help her husband pay household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. 

A junior high school graduate, Comfort currently sells bowls in Effia Kuma (near Takoradi). With over two years of experience in this trade, Comfort sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise. She does not, however, have the working capital necessary to increase her stock. Thus, her loan will be used to buy more bowls, helping her to boost her overall sales. 

Comfort wants to make her business self-sustaining as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from the expansion back into her bowls enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more bowls, helping her to boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: This is 47-year-old Rugiatu.  She is married and has 2 children, ages 26 and 21. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her for schooling.  In 1996, Rugiatu established her business selling empty five gallon rubber containers. She began her business just to provide assistance to her husband in the running of the home. Her business is located in the city centre and her main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Rugiatu has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy dozens of empty five gallon rubber containers. She hopes that this loan will yield her more funds to solve her domestic problems. In the future, Rugiatu plans to educate her children and to go to the holy land of Mecca. She is saying thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more empty five-gallon rubber containers.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is from the town of Spitak. She lives with her sisters' children as they have no family here. Lilit takes care of the kids by herself and works hard to sustain their living. To tackle their financial hardships, Lilit has been selling clothing for the past 3 years. She purchases clothing from a neighboring country and resells it from her home. Thanks to her hard work, Lilit manages to cover her family's basic needs and provide her cousins with appropriate living conditions. 

To enable her to purchase new stocks of clothing for resale, Lilit needs financial support. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Lilit, and she hopes that lenders will support her in her retail business.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of clothing for resale

loans.name: Ibrahim Sorie

texts.en:
